LD82vMF5hFBFZkuGo4CNEg.text: Favorite Mexican place in Vegas. I have been here four times now and ordered something different every time. the chilaquiles are amazing as well as the fajitas and the albondigas taste homemade! Juan was our server tge most recent time. He was VERY attentive which i truly appreciate especially since it was the middle of the lunch rush. I never even had to ask for a drink refill because i had a fresh drink before i reached the bottom! The amuse buche is tortilla chips salsa and homemade refried beans. These beans are as good as my own mothers but dont tell her i said that! This is the only traditional authentic tasting mexican restaurant i have found since moving to LV. I reccommend the chicken mole. The sauce is rich and thick and frafrant with spices. You will not regret it!

exNF9e30Qdl1_mnKN4FN5Q.text: We're out-of-towners and came here on a recommendation from friends that frequently come here. They also recommended we try the Playa La Llorona (seafood platter). This dish is full of flavor, very tasty. There were various shrimp prepared differently. The crab legs were also tasty. The rice served in the platter was my favorite with a flavorful sauce that included fish and squid -- yummy!! Violeta, our server, was very gracious and friendly. Would definitely recommend this place and come back next time we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cheese sauce that comes with the Playa la Llorona.
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Playa la Llorona

b4SBxt7XgjsxxQOgb_sjEw.text: Waited over an hour never got our food. Never coming back no attempt to make it right just kept telling us to wait.   Should have just walked out without paying for our drinks but at least we'll have our integrity.   Don't come here if you are on a schedule

pTmrchVRhjO6ZNR8zD3qIw.text: The restaurant is nicely decored, and people working there are very good.  Perhaps the best part of the experience was their bartender. It was a pleasure to see a young woman with class, style, grace, as well as being a great bartender. I am glad to see that there are some young women left in the world like her.  She was amazing.

ySt82M7bXHLoQsofYZfQYQ.text: Food sucks, cheddar cheese is NOT used in authentic Mexican cooking. Also, place of business discriminates. My son & I waited to be seated while 2 white customers were seated before me. I waited 20 minutes until someone finally asked for our drinks. I finally asked to speak to the manager & he stated that the host did not let the waitress know that someone was seated in her area. I try to give my people (Mexicans) all my money but, this is one place I will NEVER visit again... & yes I will spread the word.

s6gf8Zc77iO-sIcwWLTMbQ.text: Not bad.  Living in LA and having this place suggested for dinner, I thought 'meh', but it was pretty good.  Very good service, an old building but clean - food was excellent, with homemade tortillas as a big plus!  Nice to get away from the casinos, thanks Yelpers for the suggestion.

aZ2XEpxaG0uhMZlZ_HEulw.text: Probably the best Mexican Food I've had, by the way I'm Mexican I eat these things all the time. We came to Las Vegas from Maui Hawai'i back in July of 2015. In Hawaii we have Mexican Restaurants but none are as good as this one. I was amazed at how authentic the food was because it really felt like home. The atmosphere was great and the service and employees were friendly. I hope to go back one day to eat here again.  FINAL JUDGEMENT:  5 STARS-----Customer Friendliness  5 STARS-----Taste of Food 5 STARS-----Restaurant Appeal  4.5 STARS-----Pricing (Well worth the cost)  4.5 STARS-----Cleanse   AVERAGE 4.6-4.8 STARS but Ill give it a 5 STARS simply because its too good to be missed.

AGneKKb0z8rj2Pvwzyrm4g.text: Best Mexican food in Las Vegas... chips and salsa aren't great but their Cilantro Steak is very tasty.  I would also recommend their Chicken dinners.

KERIoR7LYMDwJosvCeeitg.text: I visited this place yesterday afternoon with a friend. I hadn't been in years, but thought I remembered it under a different name years ago?? Anyway, decor, service and food did not disappoint. The restaurant has a very authentic feel and I love the decorations. Our server and other staff were very pleasant during our dining experience; chips and salsa and drinks never went empty. We both ordered combination plate entrees--mine was a pork guacamole burrito (excellent), a cheese enchilada, and a chicken taco. We also enjoyed the house margaritas which are offered through check in. They were so good, we opted for one more :) I would definitely recommend this place for people looking for good, authentic Mexican cuisine.

vLa84yX8F49zivz2MMBnyQ.text: I have been coming here off and on for about 16 years and this gets better and better they have extended their menu over the years as well as their desert and cocktails. You really can't go wrong with anything you order I have had chicken, steak, and seafood. Breakfast is also good and the posole. Prices are fair and it's a good little spot if you want to get out of the strip a bit and enjoy some good Mexican food and yes I am Mexican

2LeitSLjmL1SjKWulvib_A.text: Great service, friendly staff. The food is so delicious!! I Highly recommend this restaurant. It was our first time being here and We fell in love with it! We are most definitely returning when we are in town.

isNDMrNXko16GJKlAINQ7Q.text: The steak & shrimp fajitas were very good, and it's a great meal to share. There was definitely enough to share with 3 people, the service was quick and I loved the chips & beans. For appetizers the cheese with chorizo dip was the best choice and delicious

Hf7TtIpCfpRxNKaCb8-qCA.text: We live near this restaurant which appears to always be hopping and very popular. I truly appreciated the welcoming and very attentive staff. Margaritas were good. My husband had camarones rancheros which come in a red sauce with beans and rice as well as a soup. I had flavorful camarones borrachas which were better- buttery garlic sauce with red pepper flakes. We had very nice coffee and split a flan.  I thought at around $18 the entrees were overpriced. Portions are not overwhelmingly huge which is good. A good solid family place- not Wow but Good.

3vjO3MsW09oWvlfsr1TPjg.text: *The BEST Fideo soup. Ever.   My favorite Mexican Food place in town, hands down. Better than Viva Zapta's, Roberto's and some of the more expensive places. They give you free chips, salsa and bean dip from the get go. If you order an entree they bring the tomato/noodle (fideo) soup out pre-meal as well. The enchiladas are fluffy and cheesey and the enchilada sauce isn't so strong or greasy it gives you heartburn. The 'Mexican Pizza' appetizer is awesome, very crunchy with light fluffy chicken (or beef if you choose) on top. They'll make guacamole right at your table for like $7. It can get a little chunky if you put everything in it, but it's a big amount you can take home. I enjoy everything I order here and have heard rave reviews about the Steak Ranchero as well. Haven't had anything bad yet. I'd like to save room for once to try their fried icecream, it looks like they give a generous portion!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole salsa and bean dip
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two cheese enchilada meal
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pre-meal (fiedeo) soup - I tossed some tortilla chips in there cause I know what&#39;s really good

d0Kv9aHj4g3ehOz0fjR4tQ.text: We celebrated my wife's birthday here and the waiter got the mariachis to come sing Happy Birthday in Spanish and English and put a big sombrero on her head while she downed a shot of tequila mixed in lime juice. I recommend the 16-ounce rib eye with a bone. We only went here because the one on DI was closed for the employees Christmas party.

qj-Mntik0cjGLdQy9ZBvow.text: Best food in town! Make sure to request Richard as your server, he's the best!!  And special bday dance for the ladies  Don't forget to order table side guacamole and queso fondido

wROk5kzh7dS-htreyj6ADQ.text: This is a solid place for Mexican. The food is usually amazing. I did have to send something back once, but they graciously and quickly made me something else that was fabulous.  Great service!  Great prices! Great food!  I do recommend!

lYahaquz5ui-HoukH7GdlA.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. I'm never really disappointed here and I felt the need to bump them up a star for being my favorite. It's still not the best Mexican restaurant in the world, but it's definitely one of the best in Las Vegas!  Every dish I've tried is delicious and the portions are extremely generous for the price. The menu is ridiculously extensive. There is just too much to choose from sometimes. I try to get someone to share dishes with me so I can get a taste of multiple things.   I enjoy the decor and as a fan of clowns (rare, I know) I actually quite enjoy the back room that is decorated solely with clown figurines and pictures.   Great place for large groups as well. I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ne94C2HRreJsBlSUbOu1vA.text: This is the best authentic Michoacan restaurant in Las Vegas!! We have tried several items on the menu, had lots of birthdays celebrated and this I seal way our first choice for Mexican cuisine.  The service is always impeccable. I am a picky eater and I can honestly say I have not had a bad meal. Every meal is prepared to perfection!   We will also recommend Bonito Michoacan.

TYy0XFgjtgHP2KsE_LtLUQ.text: Great service Richard our server was on point . All attentive and profesional . Definitely recommend this place

oATQl3XLayOwwpQDZvUNXQ.text: If it weren't for the excellent service this place would have 1 star. The food was awful, the soda was watered down, and the restrooms stunk like sewer. I have eaten here years ago and it was very good, i'm very very disappointed in Bonito Michoacan. Also, the mariachi band, AWFUL and ANNOYING!  Note: try Frank and Finas on Grand Canyon and Flamingo instead, best Mexican food in town, IMO. And guess what, no mariachi band:)

RS-sBt1Yd9OZmzievMbgyg.text: Best food quality in Las Vegas and better than my home town in California better than anywhere else. And the next best thing about it is, that they have live music with the best beans and chips. The top place where I would recommend people to come is here.

zdTfOOTNQK8p77NCapsbnw.text: The food is great!!! Too bad that's the only good thing about it. Customer service is BAD and with an ATTITUDE. They take too long to bring you the food but it comes with the check.

x1HQ8mMv3lVdPZ9n_Cvk7Q.text: OMG the best, freshest truly truly authentic Mexican food this side of the border.  The pina coladas were to die for; to die for.  The ceviche was HUGE and out of this world fresh.  Real fresh fish!  I had to leave a little to make room for the Mole Poblano which was amazing.  My husband had fish tacos and I never heard him surface for air the entire meal.  The staff is super cool, too.  Beautiful atmosphere, super authentic.  The bathrooms are so cute!!  Super clean, too.  Will most definitely go to again and again!!!

puJcbwAIGPu0whm1umrnSA.text: The restaurant is a classic family owned mexican cantina vibe with quality food and a fun atmosphere. The menu is large and the drinks are strong. Definite a solid place to check out.

BRY4azQLNOfX-UtKZT-tAA.text: My fiance and I stopped by here while in Vegas. It was delicious food with a unique taste. I ordered the enchiladas michoacanas and they were delicious, the taste was very homey and authentic. My fiance ordered the veggie enchiladas and he loved them. The servers were attentive, helpful, and had great energy. We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My &#34;check-in&#34; margarita and enchiladas michoacanas. Delicious!

C2Lsk80Fm8ksRVcHNLfbTQ.text: This place is a very good Mexican Restaurant. The people here are very friendly and welcoming. I usually do work birthday parties here at this location. I always reserve a spot for 15-20 people at lunchtime and they never say no!! When its your bday they bring out a big Mexican hat and make you wear and sing Happy bday to you in Spanish. Then they bring out a nice complimentary desert. I recommend this place to anyone that craves Mexican Food!!

wdu9HvYCuKLzkvnCBOmvxQ.text: Hands down best Mexican in Las Vegas! Food & service is always great. Staff is super happy & on point. Everything is delicious! No complaints!

iB0wX03qLKwr8lb0CtgOmg.text: Chile relleno was excellent.. Free margarita with check in.. You know a Mexican restaurant is excellent when over half the customers are Latino...

OHcBBm7avlni6rRbp5GLIg.text: Love the food here! One of the best mexican in town hands down. Service and time to wait for the food though NEEDS WORK. The staff does not really know how to coordinate seating and we had 3 different waiters come to our table almost every time i ate here. Otherwise highly recommended for good authentic mex.

6MeVd-IHQYVT0nouBW_OGg.text: The enchiladas were great and the service was outstanding. Don't forget the jalapeno, cucumber margarita.

jkyi-YWey7Fbh7tZ8UT56Q.text: We are from LA where thiers an abundance of Mexican restaurants,, but when we leave it's seams hard to find a decent restaurant that's authentica Mexicana. This hidden gem of the strip tailors to the local clientele.  What a treat it is. They would of gotten a 5 star from me but. Customer service is a bit busy. This restaurant can probably hold 200 plus. And frequently they do. So food is great! But service is slow. Try the homemade gugamole, just like mom made at home right in front of you ( table side.) Thanks Vegas coming back soon again.

tiX87LgX0sSQK8ZwEDyIuw.text: I got to give 5 stars on my 1st visit on Septemeber 2016 on our vegas trip to celebrate my daugther bday the food was excellent and the service from a wonderful lady was just amazing give her 10 stars not sure what her name was they take cute pictures and the happy bday song and the sombrero was just amazing so we where happy to have come across a real mexican place in Vegas so we decided to come once again in Nov on thanksgiving weekend they server was man with horrible service we had drinks and coronas and ask for Lemon he came back saying they where out of Lemons like really how can a mexican place the sells tacos be out of Lemons so a few minutes later we see him on a another table making guacamole and he is using LEMONS!!!!!  Ok whatever i decided to stay quiet and not say anything he will take for ever to come to our table to check up on us or for refills he was just horrible the guys cleaning up the tables where more helpfull they have funny names on their food and its a cute place and our server did not even brough us the fideo soup i had to ask for it in the end and he only came with one he was just horrible

oi_zL_tq2E22xHfff20oNw.text: Excellent ambience.  Cilantro steak was delicious. Service was top notch and checked in to enjoy a margarita on the house. Finished the dinner with flaming ice cream that was a hit!

6PHZCuZ_1HMleXg9z77vSA.text: Excellent service, excellent service, excellent food.  The prices are a little high, but they don't nickel and dime you for more chips and salsa.  They also have fresh refried beans with those homemade chips..  Staff was very attentive and in point, this is the kind of place that will bag your to-go portions for you.. awesome. Overall this place was very nice and I highly recommend stopping by.

ssl4Fmi777NFAbOIazpJqQ.text: Our first time here.  Loved the bean dip and salsa.  Our meals were better yet.  Recommend the Camarones Saranadeados ... Delicious.

PhxSKuDeQg4odMqyMZTW3Q.text: We stopped by here on vacation. The food was great, service was great and the environment was great. It's well worth a stop.

QsaCvqegmHKTr5IQFe1Hwg.text: My favorite mexican restaurant in town! Always delishious, I come here when I want hearty comfort food.

BYVdzysJ_i1xalk9U66BPg.text: Great authentic mex place! It's impossible to find food like this in NY. Well worth the visit if you're in Vegas!!

3Cs-9yrK1ANvfmYEd4RJfQ.text: Parking here is super easy! If you go left when you walk in you'll see a full bar and they do karaoke! If you want it a LITTLE more quiet sit on the right side. My hubby and my daughter went with another couple who also had a 3yo and they had an easily accessible table for the 6 of us. Us ladies ordered frozen guava margaritas which were veeeeery tasty and the consistency was very smooth. I'm usually a rocks kinda girl and I'm truly not a guava fan but I tried hers and needed one too!!! While we were deciding our server brought out sopa de fideo for the kids which was nice because we didn't even ask! Now to the food! With the location of this place the prices surprised the hell out of me.....I'm not saying it was uber expensive but the average was probably $15 which is a little out there for a Mexican restaurant IMO. Every meal comes with chips, salsa, and beans and the sopa. I had birria de chiva which is goat cooked in a red sauce or was pretty delish! Hubby had a shrimp/octopus coctel it was the usual nothin special. The other couple had an enchilada and then shrimp fajitas. All pretty ordinary. I did see they make guacamole table side and got to watch another table have it made it looked pretty cool!  We were too full for dessert...  Service was good Drinks were awesome  The food...nothin special. Will I return, yes! I think I'm gonna try somethin different/unique so they can change my mind a lil :)

KG55Vfy29cUSotHmVCXEDA.text: Absolutely fabulous food, service, and drinks! Thanks again for such a wonderful night.   We were immediately seated in a nice quite area of the restaurant even though they were quite busy. The wait staff immediately greeted us and took our drink order, and served the complimentary chips and salsa.   I ordered the Steak Cilantro with a Strawberry Margarita while my husband ordered Carne Asana tacos. Our food was delivered within a reasonable amount of time. I ordered the steak well done (I typically order it rare but I knew better than to do that outside of a steakhouse) and was surprised when it came a little pink. It was absolutely perfect, moist and thankfully did not make me sick from being undercooked. My husband had zero complaints about his food. His tortillas were thick enough to keep the taco from breaking from the juice of the meat. The rice was fluffy and full of flavor.   We were pleasantly surprised when we received the bill to find that the waiter did not charge us for everything we  ordered. The staff was on point, the food was on point, and as always we were very pleased. We will be back!! Oh...... move to the NW side of town you are too far away from us! That's my one complaint haha.

2Eh0rF137U4oRasWqUXriA.text: I ate here yesterday and the food and service was great.  I came back today and was ignored by the front door staff...it felt as if I was not of the appropriate ethnicity.  Very sad.

RMNkkBgx2gvi02I9085GaQ.text: I'm back at it again with the yummie Bonito.. I really like this place with the happy hour and the drinks are great. I love coming here it reminds me of the real deal LA food. I've been to other Mexican restaurants but this one just makes me want to come back for more.   The service is great. When we go there we try to go during happy hour. I always have to order the Ceviche, Street tacos (carne asada, carnitas and pastor), sopitos and Toreados con chorizo. The hubs just shares with me but like to order the guacamole and chips. But the drinks oh man I get the Paloma and margarita.  The hubs get the beer. The tacos are delish, reminds me of LA taco trucks. Love the home made sopitos.  It is made in house which is amazing. The Treados con chorizo is good but I think I would rather just have cheese but then that would be called Chili Relleno. Good stuff this place has. With great happy hour price can't beat that for Mexican food.

eP1YDZA-z4QIfsljRZ8WAA.text: Great spot to eat and great customer service and make sure you ask for Saul, he's great!

8Bx6onGgWaM-DqkQKHQPbw.text: I like this place overall, it's clean,colorful and the employees here are friendly and work hard.  For food I've tried the Albondigas Soup,Chips,Salsa and Bean dip The Albondigas soup here tastes great with perfect Meatballs! Tip: make sure to ask for the sides that go with it if your ordering to go, which are Spanish Rice, chopped Onions and Cilantro and sliced limes it's great for hangovers.  I liked the free Bean dip and Chips but the salsa had a chemical taste that was off putting maybe the salsa bowl wasn't cleaned properly.  I gave only 3 stars because of slow service and the Salsa...both times I've come here the Bartender was working hard, but overwhelmed with trying to keep up on drink/food orders, they were working so hard it was near impossible to get my to-go soup order in and later to pay my bill.   I wasted a good 30 minutes waiting, because the bartender who was working as fast as possible was just simply overwhelmed with other chores and kept ignoring my trying to get her attention.  Tip to Owner: maybe 2 Bartenders during peak business times would lessen customer frustration.

v3qYieUhIQblO9yF7d4O4g.text: Great environment and service . The ribeye and lobster plate is amazingly good, chips And salsa are also bomb ..

UnVMuRoagL4ENrAwysm7nw.text: This restaurant has incredible food. The service is 5 star for sure.  Great prices and fast service . I would recommend this place anyone.

q4d5skcrGn3_MMADzqv4OQ.text: One of the best Mexican restaurants in the valley. Our go to for the travel club luncheons and definitely for a date night out with my hubby!

Yjp_irdstsnJCHk0z2WgIg.text: So glad it visited this place. I ordered the Cilantro steak. Delicious! Juicy tender meat with a savory green sauce. Also the salsa they serve with the chips and beans so good. Nice and spicy. Ample amount of parking, authentic Mexican decor, and the Margaritas are to die for.

We kept being told 10 more mins and it was way more then that. We come here regularly but today we were really disappointed in the service. Probably will not be coming back.

Incredible staff, authentic Mexican cuisine, and the atmosphere is to die for. The experiential aspect you witness when present is unbelievable. This place just makes me genuinely happy.

eNgASDUMioNuCHUJ9kwsgg.text: Very good service I love the food and the margaritas. Lorenzo was my server he is the best. I will come back for sure

An hour and a half of waiting and seeing every party that came in after us get seated we asked how much longer their answer was no one has left. Management is horrible they don't know how handle busy days and their excuse was just unacceptable.

xTxHGhYS3KCBRL6pQ7uVuA.text: This place is good enough for the Mexican craving fix. The space is large and festive and the food is just alright. They have a lively bar scene during games and the occasional live entertainment.

xHVtG-oTVMAo0tyo3Xb86w.text: Bonito Michoacan is phenomenal!!!! Hands down a go to spot in Vegas!!!! If your looking for authentic savory Mexican food this is the spot! Their salsa and chips are so good! Their enchiladas plate is to die for! I have also ate their carnitas Michoacan which as phenomenal as well! Great drinks has a little bar inside..... great place to bring your family for amazing food I cannot emphasize enough!

GSkYM9-cBFbKcDr4rz7k2g.text: We found this wonderful GEM off of the chaos and traffic on the strip 2 years ago. First, they are amazing at taking care of people with Gluten allergies. Second, real Mexican food from family recipes. Real flavor and amazing service are why we come back anytime we are in Las Vegas. And if that's not enough when they say steak it's not some cheap cut, it's delicious New York strip. Also, you can not beat their reasonable prices.

VWmFGpVvGFzvcE2qsKx5ZQ.text: This place has the best customer service, truly. I came in needed to place an order for pick up later in the afternoon and they were so helpful. I was not sure what to order and the staff was great at recommending what I should order.  Then when I came back to order like three people asked me if I needed help. Just very nice and the prices are good and this place is clean.

rurIAEeUJXrFXFgfslqOug.text: I have passed by this location many times and they always have a nice crowd. Tonight, we decided to try out Bonito for my birthday dinner. The atmosphere was authentic and our server was very helpful.  I had the chorizo tacos, which were filled with their homemade chorizo and served with rice, beans, and a scoop of guacamole. Their chorizo was good, not too spicy, but smoky. My partner got a combination platter with a chile relleno, taco, and enchilada. He said everything was good as well.  This location offered a free house margarita for checking in for Yelp users. The drink was actually very good and I ordered another. I did notice they only give each table one complimentary chips/salsa/beans starter and charging $3.50 for additional refills. I have to say I've never encountered this, even at more upscale restaurants.  The beans served were good, the salsa a little too smoky for me.  All in all, Bonito offered an authentic Mexican dinner for my birthday this year. There was a nice live band performing and the service was very good. We will more than likely be back to try some other options.

PIU_5HCTnBiuBxIU182UiA.text: Bomb! Bomb! Bomb! I love everything about this place.  1. Service is great 2. Food is as authentic Mexican and delicious  3. Price is very reasonable.  Micheladas are the reason we first went here and they did not disappoint they are delicious with the Perfect amount of spice and lemon. Table side guacamole is always a must. The aguachile extra spicey was so fresh and delicious,everything just perfect. It's a must go to place whenever I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table side guacamole made your way is so delicious. Michelada and comp chips salsa and refried beans ridiculously good!
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Camarones aguachile, flavor, lemon and spice are perfection

sm2rUBfdwAraFlmr5KpI3w.text: Great food. Great service. Our waiter Julio was excellent. Definitely coming back. I have to say that the seafood was very fresh. My wife love this place just as much as I did. We can't stop talking about the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Cocktail size medium, shrimp ceviche, Camarones a la Diabla!

c5YmzpMLPraIlQBlTGq1zw.text: One of my favorites! I've been going to this place for years now but as I've grown older I've grown to appreciate the amazing food they offer.  The chips, salsa, and beans they offer as soon as you sit down are always so delicious that I have to limit myself lest I spoil my appetite (I'm not fancy - I've just always wanted to say "lest"). If I'm particularly hungry I order the Nopalitos as an appetizer. I absolutely love cactus and the way that it's cooked with onions and peppers is amazing and it's healthy!  I've had the shrimp cocktail, which has never let me down. The shrimp ceviche is one of my favorites as well. On hangover days I like to go in and get the Fideo soup (I have tried the menudo - I wasn't a fan). And nothing cures a hangover like a Michelada! The ones offered here never disappoint! The margaritas are also very good, as well as the Corona Margaritas, but the mixed drinks I've found are way too strong.  The one dish that I actually had to send back was the Mole. Call me spoiled but once you've tried my mom's mole, nothing compares. Mine was too sweet and the meat was too chewy. I sent it back and got a shrimp cocktail.  I guess this place just depends on your taste. Amazing for something things, not so great for others. Try it anyway.

F5Q2DSKTkjqj3WbS8IVtCg.text: Best service! I mean impeccable! It's Mother's Day and we waited for nothing. Food was fresh and absolutely delicious!!! I'm so excited about this place! Out of town guests will love this it here! We actually feel like we are on vacation in Mexico. The music- the total vibe in here- so much fun!!

_QR-6QZWVUXyeEoRvLklCQ.text: Unfortunately, this restaurant has gone downhill.  I travel to Vegas frequently and always make a point to visit Bonito Michoacan.  Tonight, I took two friends there and we were all very disappointed.  The food was fair but the service was terrible.  We were treated as though we were a pain-in-the-ass and I even suggested no tip for the rude server but my friends are too nice and left a tip.  Quite frankly, our dinner and the service were an embarrassment.  Watch yourself, Bonito.  There are too many excellent Mexican restaurants in Vegas.  I'll move on to Mi Casa which is located in the Silverton and receive better service and better food.

Super friendly staff, waiter started us out with a sopa de Fideo that was outstanding perfectly flavored broth. I couldn't make up my mind so I created my own combination plate of a carne asada sope and a chicken green enchilada. I also ordered a mangonada margarita the best margarita I have ever had.

fUQOvnOKcPidO1JZakeG1Q.text: 2nd tine coming here. Food is bomb, and huge portions. The mixed drinks are authentic and on the spot. Pricing is on the expensive side but definitely well worth every penny. Steak cilantro is delicious, the nopalitos are perfect, amd the parillada mixta is the best ever. Great vibe and workers are very respectfull.. managers greet u once u are at your table. Suggest anyone thinking bout coming to just come. U will not be dissapointed

3l0nPRIj3sxQP2nb0Doa8Q.text: For me being in Vegas 30 Years now..this is the best by far all around restaurant..food..service..its always packed for that reason! Tho its quite large inside and have never had to wait. The ambiant..decor is stunning! The waiters are 1st class and can handle even the worst drunk customer with the up most class! A must try..you will not be disappointed. Everything here as far as the food is to die for!!!!  And on top of that they can satisfy any special requests too...the sopapillas are the best..I always end up ordering like 3 orders..haha!  It has a casual and refined and relaxed feel..they just got it right!!!! What else can I say?

mFgkJfM4xjIgVvu9ECGEsQ.text: Just remember "Sarandeados", and everything will be wonderful. That Shrimp dish is amazing. As is everything else I have eaten here. The Decatur location of Bonito Michocan has become a destination for me every time I visit, or even just pass through Las Vegas. The staff is always friendly and efficient which makes the experience that much better. I've been told that their other location is even better, but I can't even imagine how that could be.

9RR1QmQqxIhErPq-eyzVAw.text: By far one of the BEST Mexican restaurants I've been to from LA to Las Vegas.  They give you chips salsa, and a warm bean dip to start!  I ordered the Ceviche tostada to start and my main  course was the hueto plate that included a chicken taco, tostada, and enchilada. The food was so flavorful and well seasoned that I didn't need any salsa!!!   The salsa is actually my only issue. It lacked flavor, and was a little too spicy for me and they only have spicier salsa, so I was a bit disappointed that my request for Pico de Gallo was turned down, but if spicy is your thing then this place will hit the spot!  Overall it was a wonderful experience and somewhere I will ABSOLUTELY visit anytime I'm in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hueto Plate minus the taco! Delicious!!!!

0rM4028Kroy8Kd_5bW3SnA.text: This restaurant has a very welcoming and casual atmosphere and the hostesses and waiters are very friendly. For starters, complimentary fresh fried tortilla chips are served with warm bean dip and red salsa or you can request for the spicier habanero salsa which I love. They also give you a complimentary small bowl of fideo soup to wet your appetite. For appetizers, we ordered the beef sopitos which were very juicy and delicious topped with guacamole and sour cream. If you checkin with your Yelp account, they give you a free margarita! I always end up getting full just from the the complimentary appetizers, so save room for the delicious entrees.   For dinner we ordered the Carnitas Michoacanas and the Chicken Mole Poblano. The carnitas were cooked in spices and were very succulent and tasty. They are served with a green salsa and a spicy charred jalapeno, yum! The chicken mole poblano was juicy and served smothered in a flavorful, mildly spicy and sweet brown mole sauce, so good! Both entrees are served with Mexican rice and warm beans topped with cheese.  Also all of the entrees come with freshly made corn or flour tortillas that are warm and delicious. We always leave here stuffed, satisfied and with leftovers because the portions are huge!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Michoacanas
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken mole poblano
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef sopitos

2gQ6esPtQJ6NeUpI6-AqnA.text: If you are going to dinner with another person order the Tierra Cliente. This dish comes steaming hot with chicken breast, carne asada, carnitas and chorizo stuffed jalapenos.  With a compliment of beans and rice you will need a to go bag and several hours of exercise to work it off.  Great service and hot food. Absolutely worth it

yKOoWnsmLtCQ-7csCWUGsw.text: Today I have the worst experience in this place. Today I whent to lunch with my two kids and the busser said our soup would be right out. We got our food and our drinks and our soup never showed up. Then 3 good looking girls sit at the table next to us and they got their soup and drinks before they ordered. And its sad because I thought this was a family restaurant but I guess we have to be young and sexy to get better service.

Zhi5AV9-lHHUGaze8CgxlA.text: Gotta get the Guac!! Everything I've had here is great, but the Shrimp dishes are the business.

_7kGK9lipWkpqquZJYrpTw.text: Better service, better food, and a LOT less crowded (although it's only Tuesday..), than their counterpart Lindo Michoacan there in Henderson.  Sure, sure, Lindo has the spectacular views and what not, and their food is decent but all of that gets cancelled out when you're in a packed and noisy (super kid friendly) restaurant. Moving right along..  Back to Bonito!  Greeted by a friendly gentleman and escorted to our table, my eyes scanned the room to observe the typical, I mean traditional Mexican themed decor; vibrant colors, cheesy artwork, and no Mexican restaurant would be complete without "football" on the telly. My party and I giggled at the music selection throughout our entire meal, it went from Latin Country, to Latin Classic Rock, and my all time favorite, Latin elevator music. I have saved the best for last though folks when it comes to the decor at good ol' Bonito Michoacan..THE MILLIONS OF CLOWNS EVERYWHERE!  What's up with clowns amigos? I just don't get how creepy clowns and puppets dangling from the ceiling tie in to delicious home made guacamole and sizzling, cooked to perfection fajitas. The clowns didn't sit well with me, but luckily their food did! (*round of applause from my stomach*)   In any event, this fine dining establishment earns 4-starts on the Kim-scale-o-food-places, the fifth lacking for, well, it's no real mystery here: the clown decor (ok and I don't fancy the location either).  Great job Bonito, I'm not positive you would be the first place I would pick should the mood for Mexican food strike again, but you're for sure in my top 5!

r2lkQm76fJtyLi2CfZTMSg.text: I've been eating at this place for years. Most of the waiters know us.  Tonight we decided to place a 'to go order' (despite of the fact that we have noticed some changes with the food for the worse), but still after a busy day I called them to place an order. BAD idea. It says on the menu (and online) that soup (a small cup with some very inexpensive pasta) is included with some meals (which ours qualified for), but was told on the phone that "not on to go orders". I talked to the person on the phone (and later on with the manager in person) but no change. Actually I don't understand why they have a manager.They have the containers, the soup and it should be included (they could NOT explain why it is not if you have it to go). The same for the small bean dip (also available only if you eat at the restaurant but not to go). However, the prices were the same (regardless if you ate there or at home), and expensive not only for the amount of the food but also for the poor quality. The flan that I used to like tasted like water and sugar. I have recommended this restaurant to many people and taken many friends to eat at this place. It is a shame to treat a regular customer like this. NOT coming back anymore and will make sure to tell everyone that it doesn't pay to go to a place that values a cheap cup of soup over customer's loyalty.

exrUgw2ttKbbllnSd5eYGw.text: best customer service hands down ! the food was great and they had apple juice for my daughter back to back!

Qf3CuiNVbpaauaLa-cbhIA.text: Their ceviche was good, but their margaritas were even better. What I loved most about this place wasn't the food, it was the service. The waiters are incredibly friendly and helpful. They make sure you enjoy your visit there.

Yqf7pBIAqoq1TRZDBsd0xA.text: Food was great. Had steak and shrimp combo. Servcie was outstanding (Richard).  Highly recommend.

tXEBCvh9EX9iT5q6SppaOQ.text: Pros: -Service was excellent. The servers were very polite and our food came out fast. We had about 3 people constantly filling our drinks/chips/salsa/beans. Plus, they're really good at singing happy birthday :) -My fiance loves beans and was really excited to see they served complimentary beans with their chips and salsa. A nice touch and one I have never seen before in a Mexican restaurant  Cons: -The food was OK. I got #16 (two hard chicken tacos, all rice) and I enjoyed it, although the tacos were a little small. My fiance had a combo plate as well (hard beef taco and enchilada, all beans) and did not like the enchilada's red sauce.  All in all, the restaurant was alright and if I was in town again I might consider coming back.

YKJ0cvxtW2MLyEd6rtyPaA.text: Busy cozy colorful place with great Mexican food at a reasonable price. Lots of  blue collar workers have lunch here. They know good food.

svWfBtSNSncUJ_lxvS7F6A.text: The atmosphere, staff, and food are all wonderful. The waiter we had, unfortunately we forgot his name, but he was the best. The cilantro steak was amazing. It's a little pricey but worth it.

PszzX350uTF9-aqgFXpA-Q.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. Great Fideo soup, enchiladas and tamales. Don't forget to try the Sophie's

aYGeJkd3Qn9zIo33-F3psg.text: This is a great place for lunch.  You can have a ten minute or sixty minute lunch, up to you - the staff will meet you half way on whatever YOU WANT.  Be sure to ask for Violetta, she gives the best service and is so pleasant, you'll want to come every day.  Ask for a bowl of the special picante sauce that they make daily and be sure to get the guacamole made table side.  Other than that, get what  you are hankering for because all of the food is good.  Don't miss this place - can't beat the price/quality mix!  ENJOY!

SQoikPlhasQLCeRi_yIUPw.text: I love this place. Be sure to get the table side guacamole. I would say they have the best guacamole in town.  The food is consistently good. The service isn't really the best but the food makes it worth it. They have a happy hour, too, so that's when to start drinking the Cadillac margaritas.

-0dOOaiKLw3ZnOhNyiDLpA.text: Ok it feels wrong to add stars for this reason, but I'm doing it anyways. As my coworkers have a borderline obsession with this place, I'm learning to adapt. I'm on a loose sort of "diet" (very strong word), I'm really trying to avoid Mexican food joints as they are very hard to eat semi-healthy at.   As I stared hard at the menu searching desparately for something I could call "diet".. I did notice they have a diet section, but all the food sounded bland and too well diety for my taste. I decided to try the lunch special called chicken #9 ($9.99 with soda). It rocked! It was chicken marinated in garlic, spices, chilis and it was full of flavor but light on the spice (just my style). It was served with guac, rice, beans, and tortillas (hardly diet food, but just noting you could eat this as a full calorie dish as you desire). Some of the best grilled chicken I've had in awhile... yay for a mexicn place that has something on the menu not full of lard !

KPykdF89DnmnGqqtvtUy4A.text: Prices are higher now but the quality of the food is still superb. I love the seafood cocktail and the fillet relleno(don't think I spelled it right.) It's very delicious and highly recommended. Food is 5 star. One star removal for the prices but I always go. Lol.

O4-FnfpPg9o957dRkxRTlQ.text: Second time here and never will I return. Service is good drinks r good. But there food is just not my type.  Got chicken Chipotle last time n was just tomatoe sauce. Got drunk shrimp today and had no flavor. Sent it back to add some spices still the same. Only ate 1 shrimp that's how bad it was. Sorry but I'm from southern California and this is more for different type of people

CuIyYF96HSy-PRJVgPsXww.text: When you come to Mexican Food, I always tell people to go to this place. Great interior and exterior color such as authentic mexican feel you were in mexico. I cant say anything bad about this place little bit of louder music who playing the keyboard in the corner. May be that's a part of mexican lol. ANyway, The very first thing you try is the Fresh Guacamole  they made in front of you and give with home made chips and the mouth watering beans ad salsa. They have a biggest verity of any mexican restaurant in the town... Their Number of stake is right on the money and their other plates are also huge.  Also, The soup they gave you before the meal is make a great appetite.    Finally, they have great magaritas and great seafood if you love to be drunk and a islander....

azUsEkAyIvVujw_Kl8dohQ.text: We have been going to this place for a while now. We love their Shrimp Cocktail and their Ensalada Marinera. When we are in the mood for Mexican food this is the first place that comes to our mind.

dB_bxmcKwHsPzxwvpUv3xA.text: Not really much to say.... Really good food excellent customer service and one of the best Mexican food burrito spots in town. Decorations are nice inside.  Good atmosphere and prices are decent

sHR3057SNoGl5ezUDKu7Yg.text: Came here for dinner unexpectedly on a Friday night. Not the first time i've came here but this was the first time i've brought my mother to something like this. Since we were only a party of two, we were sat at a booth in front of the bar to the left.   Lighting was pretty dim with live music being played. The kind of environment you'd expect on a Friday night ! Pretty nice.   As this was only the 2nd time i've been here, their overwhelming menu was pretty hard to make a decision with. We were given their fresh tortilla chips, bean dip and salsa pretty quickly. Besides that, it was an easy decision to order a Mangonada margarita. What a delicious drink this is ! Definitely not the first time i've had this either ! Quite yummy drink. I couldn't really taste the alcohol but my mom said she could. Definitely a dangerous drink with majority of the alcohol taste being masked by the mango.   It's been a long time since my mom's had anything mexican so she'd become a bit american and order fajitas (apparently fajitas aren't genuine mexican cuisine but a Tex-Mex ! gasp !   Fajitas de res (Strips of New York steak mixed with tomato, onions, peppers, cilantro, and spices. With guacamole and sour cream. Served sizzling) - Very simple dish served with a choice of flour or corn tortillas. Their tortillas are homemade and are completely different from anything i've ever had (.... even in mexico ! LOL). The flour tortilla is so fragrant and soft. Its so good ! The corn tortilla is actually... much finer and softer than i expected. You definitely can tell that its a corn tortilla but its like a flour and corn tortilla had a baby o.O?! The strips of NY steak with cooked veggies was simple and tasty. Though i expected the steak to be more tender, it was quite flavorful.   Aside from the fajita, i definitely had trouble deciding what else to order. Originally i was looking at something chicken or pork but mom suggested something shrimp. With 13 different dishes made with shrimp, i had asked our waitress on some recommendations. She had made 3 different recommendations, one creamy, one spicy, one with cognac.   Camarones Sarandeados "Tia Esther" - Large fresh Mexican gulf shrimp basted with sarandeado sauce with a rich selection of dried chiles and secret spices blended with a touch of mayonnaise  I do hope this is the dish we got. I actually forgot the name. As with all entrees, comes with rice and bean plate. The shrimp used was definitely LARGE, granted not many in quantity. The sauce used was a very delicious creamy sauce that was extremely tasty with the shrimp or mixed and eaten with the rice. Even my mom was like OMG THIS SAUCE IS SO GOOD ! I know for a fact we opt'ed for the "spicy" one. Spice wise, it was not spicy, very mildly. Granted we do love eating spicy but im sure its decent for even the not really spicy eater.   Service was mildly slow as it took a while to get our bill and pay, but it was near the end of the night so it wasn't that bad.  Overall, very yummy experience ! I just realized after looking at their menu online that they have lunch specials ! i wonder, size wise, how do they compare to the normal entrees?! I wanna try for lunch !

TAx9JsyRzXBBGcTA7sk-_Q.text: We stopped here on our way out of Vegas, we wanted to try some Mexican Food off the strip and the night yelp rating brought my family here. We were seated promptly and were given our menus. I asked if they had any freshly made Aguas Frescas which is a good measure of how authentic the food is, and much to my dismay they didn't have any hand made Aguas Frescas. So I ended up settling with some water since I didn't want to consume any soda. The food I ordered was nothing special. The only plus is that they made their Tortillas handmade, everything else was so so. Average food, average prices, nothing special.

x7ThA-WhdXt04xfjy0Er-g.text: Mediocre food which is overpriced. Staff was nice, the environment was pleasant. I probably won't pay them a 2nd visit.

db7wcHxYqdevoqSabAO-fA.text: Came here with my friend because I was craving Mexican. We ordered our own strawberry margaritas and he brought us out the biggest cups for margaritas. He said it was happy hour. Drinks were big ! I liked it! Our drink was around $9-10 for the big cup. My friend and I shared a special dish for $38. It included shrimp, chicken, and steak. I would have to say the price is pretty steep here for Mexican compared to other places I've been. Our food was good but it didn't come with rice or veggies/beans but it did come with cheese. Everyone loves cheese. I would say the dish was good but for $38, I would have probably ordered something else. The restaurant is too dark inside. I would recommend them making it a little bit more lighter inside to see the food and menu.

rp99aEVCu54VKuTG-gJkmw.text: I don't write reviews but have to warn people that this place is the worst mexican restaurant I've attended..... I love Mexican food and will never step foot into this spot again.   The meat was bland with no flavor and over cooked.  When I mentioned it to our Waiter he said that's how the meats come... I was shocked and didn't want to complain, but will never step foot into this place and wanted to warn people.   Don't waste your money or time and find a better spot.

5uytlTyp_SCRa9WV4y8zyw.text: Visiting Vegas and a local recommended this near-Strip eatery.  Ambiance: 5 stars - adorable location, well decorated Mexican charm, very cutesy location.  Bright colors, facade of a Mexican balcony overlooking main area.  Great family location.    Service: 5 stars - super friendly staff.    Food: 3 stars.  Food was just Ok.  Guac (made at table) was pretty basic, not worth the table-side service preparation.  We ordered a few apps (cactus plant thing, mango salad) and both were just OK.  Ordered their signature enchilada but wasn't super special or flavorful.  My brother ordered shrimp fajitas and enjoyed a flavorful sauce.   Wanted to love the food because service was so attentive, friendly and sweet, but just couldn't give more than 3 stars.

_vgHnvcYm-mpOWUHYEm1iQ.text: The atmosphere here is like a family restaurant, but larger and with lots of people. Very colorful rooms. Mexican art and sculptures on the walls. The menu has lots of authentic Mexican choices. Almost makes you feel like you're in Mexico.  Before the meal, chips, salsa, and refried beans were provided. I expected the salsa to be a little spicier but was rather mild. The refried bean dip was a nice touch.  A small bowl of Sopa de Fideo was provided. Small thin noodles are served in a broth. Good.  For an appetizer I had a small Campechana, a seafood cocktail with shrimp, octopus, and oysters. The small size was plenty large enough and the seafood was all excellent. There is a Timo's Size that is larger than the 'large' size, which would be interesting to see, if not so much to eat because of the size. There was a small amount of cilantro and spice but it was very mild. A bottle of Tapatio hot sauce was provided so one can spice it up to a hotter level if one wants. A bottle of ketchup was also provided, which is something I didn't expect, or use.  There are a lot of entrees to choose from and I selected one of the dozen-and-a-half seafood items, the Pescado A La Vallarta. A fillet of Orange Roughy is pan-fried. An orange roughy fish is orange colored but the fillet is more white colored. The taste of the fish was very mild, which is normal. There were olives, green peppers, and red peppers plenty. On the side of the plate was Spanish rice, average, Refried Beans with cheese, very good, and some guacamole, also very good.  A nice filling meal with a touch of different options not found in corporate-style Mexican restaurants.

gYbJNh2H3ZJizGTPbkvVpQ.text: great little place hidden in China town. love the food and atmosphere. everyone was very friendly.  the food was very good. Bonito Michoacan is great Mexican food in a city that is drowning with Mexican food. we had the margaritas! wow! yummy.! will be going back to try out more dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. margarita time!

Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RafHkV8CCcinLjPWoTZ5pQ.text: Everything started out so well! We were greeted straight away, seated at a cute little booth and given some water while we looked over the drinks menu. Looking around the restaurant, it's got a lot of decor that represents Hispanic culture, even down to the art on the backs of the chairs - super cute and interesting. I ordered the pina colada cocktail and my partner had some fancy beer/tomato juice thing. No idea of the name, but it looked impressive and he liked it. I LOVED mine! It was made fresh and was one of the best PC's I've had! I could taste the rum but it wasn't too strong. We were also given some chips and beans which was a nice touch and my partner ordered the ceviche appetiser while we looked over the entrees. Now, here is where it goes downhill.. firstly, the entrees spanned about 5 pages. There were too many options and too much going on. My thought was: 'how can they make each dish so delicious and impressive if there is so much going on in the kitchen?' Well, in a word (or 2), they don't. My partner went for the steak burrito. It was generous with the condiments and was filled, however the meat was a little chewy and pretty tasteless in itself, would have been nice to have been seasoned. I went for one of the fish dishes- the playa azul. NOT what I was expecting for an $18 dish when it arrived. When the server put the dish down, he had to be careful as the plate was just swimming in thick sauce. There was not much in the way of fish. When I tasted it, it did melt in the mouth, although unfortunately, all I could taste was this very thick and gloopey red sauce. The rice was dry and tasted reheated with little shrivelled peas hiding amongst it, the tortilla that came with it was also too dry (thank goodness for all the sauce to soften it I suppose). After about 6 mouthfuls, I'd had enough of all the stodginess and boxed what was left of the fish to attempt again later.  Such a letdown because the vibe was lovely, the drinks were amazing and the appetiser was great, but the entree reminded me of what I used to get given for my school dinners. Not a restaurant dish at all! I think I'll come here again for some drinks before heading somewhere else for some dinner next time. So disappointing!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A slightly dry and unseasoned steak burrito
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish dish - playa azul. The fish is swimming under all that sauce.. somewhere!

S3SjdImTTcbyKPSqq8e17A.text: Don't know what all the stars are for. Ate dinner here the other night for the first, an last, time. Firstly, the service was over the top...thank you for that. Secondly, the parking and prices were reasonable. Lastly..the food was just so so. The margarita was weak, the beans may have been canned, the cheese enchiladas were not so hot and the Chile relleno, while real, was tasteless, and the beef tacos were average. We are somewhat experts in Mexican food being from LA and eating in East LA. I guess we compare all to that food and the food here just doesn't hold up. Won't be going back.

mZ_MgExGOpIfMDgySVdHTQ.text: Great food here ! I'm from LA calif. And the food here is excellent. The service, waiters and waitresses are always checking on you for any refills or anything else you need. And the homemade tortillas are to excellent in flavor. quality overall, a 10!

eof0DXxNFYK3w3j4FG76pw.text: This place caught my eye Becuase of its colorful exterior building design outside. I mentioned this place up to my girlfriend ,and so she decided to take me here on a Sunday lunch. We had this excellent waiter which I totally forgot his name. But he was very friendly and explained everything on the menu. We checked in on Yelp to receive our free margaritas which was awesome. He only downfall about this place was just the ceviche tasted a little watered down but my main dish made up for this restaurant. The steak was really juicy with my side of salsa to balance the flavor. Complimentary chips and salsa of course is the best.

ZbAf8Mm-uahHBMeGYxllFw.text: My 2 friends, son (toddler) and I ate here about 2 weeks ago and we loved nearly every minute of our lunch! We had the cerviche and shrimp cocktail for appetizers and they were both awesome.  I wanted street tacos but I guess that's only during happy hour but the tacos I had were decent. Our sever was really great, I'm kicking myself since I can't recall his name (blame the memory issue on the 1 Michelada) but it was like he knew what I needed just before I asked for it. We will be back and I'm very happy to see that the quality of food or device hasn't gone down over the years! Gracias!!

ZhhFdCqN0ikx3lKMThN_Iw.text: Been in Las Vegas for two years now and haven't found any good Mexican/texmex. Well, hold up y'all. Found it. This place is authentic and delicious. Absolutely loved it. I will be back.

obXSEWaMoziVrvgYnqpujQ.text: I was part of a big group on Cinco de Mayo. Great food and great service!! The staff didn't miss a beat. Too bad that their parking lot is so small.

LZFkgijDltfRm0Tn-cc1yw.text: Food was excellent the staff is super nice the drinks are amazing very clean love there bathrooms there are so pretty, but the food is super authentic Mexican food love this location in Summerland it was super nice

C0BMS7IjM0k3-avAIi-f_Q.text: This is our second time at Bonito Michoacan and it is even better the second time!! The service is amazing and the food is off the charts!! The margaritas are yummy, but the handmade tortillas are the best!! Very authentic and so worth spending our Easter here with family!!!

VaJ7O5mjqaJeKNd6Wm6ZMw.text: We met a local friend here at his invitation, and it did not disappoint.    Curb appeal is inviting and parking ample.  We were seated immediately and our very gregarious, personable waiter took excellent care of us from beginning to end.    The margaritas had plenty of authority; the warm chips and salsa delicious.  Apparently, every entree includes a small cup of chicken-broth-style soup, which had a nice flavor.  We didn't see our favorite thing on the menu--a fajita combo of steak, chicken, and shrimp--but we asked and they gladly made it for us.  It was perfect, with just the right amount of char, served on a sizzling platter.  The rice was flavored superbly and the guacamole fresh and creamy.    My only complaint is the lighting:  It glares just a bit, and could be solved easily and inexpensively with dimmer switches.

6RaK9dWGf4eL2-PbAn3RrA.text: Good, solid food- a cross between Tex-Mex and authentic Mexican, definitely a place that caters to both American and Mexican tastes- the menu is HUGE! Chips and salsa are outstanding as is the guacamole. I had enchiladas and they were awesome, beans and rice typical.   Vibe is great and waitstaff are wonderful. I will definitely be back!

6-d_olIDncBHvVnZZhdhhg.text: Gaudy, loud, bright colors and stereo-typical Americanized Mexican restaurant. Average all the way around. The chips are normal, the salsa is non-offensive, even the salsa that was supposed to be 'hot' wasn't any different that a typical jarred salsa. Refried beans with lard, orange rice with frozen veggies in it.. you get the picture. Nothing that would drive you back there. The prices are ok - we had 4 adults and 2 kids eat for $110, which included 2 beers and 2 margaritas.  Those margaritas are pre-blended. - pretty gross really. However, we sat at the bar waiting for our party and they pour a serious shot, so order tequila and hope for the best. Even though it is off the strip, its not authentic by any means.

t3tUv-OqmYMhXldvLTS_yw.text: Margarita's were just "ok".. fajita's for 2 over cooked .. beef was so over cooked!  No flavor, asked for some additional hot sauce and they brought out verde salsa. Can't understand how it get's it stars?

hEHmSkoJhzW44nJTIllYzw.text: My hubby, son and I went here to Celebrate Cinco de Mayo and give the restaurant a try since we always drive by.  The food was delicious with really good portions. They serve chips, refried beans and salsa right when you are seated. We devoured them!   My hubby and I ordered us a round of Cadillac Margaritas which were worth the $12 we paid for each.   I took my time looking throught the entire menu, trying to figure our what i wanted to eat since everything sounded so good. I decided to go with the Mar y Tierra (Surf and Turf) since I was able to order from any of their shrip dishes and NY steak dishes! Best decision ever.   The atmosphere was good and the service was decent. The only reason we would come back would be for the food and drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son had the Ribeye and Lobster and my hubby had the Steak Ranchero. Both delicious!!

3ifs1K5q4YIP_ojdQmZX5Q.text: Good authentic Mexican food. Huge servings and good flavor. My only issue was the service. Our server was not very friendly and honestly seemed impatient with us when we placed our order. The hostess was nice when we walked in but just the server was not nice.   I enjoyed my Posole and enchilada. Oh and the free chips and salsa were very good too. They also give you free bean dip.   We did get a free picture with our meal. The girl was trying to sell us photos but when we opted out she gave us our free picture and also seemed annoyed. Oh well.   For the food in itself I would probably go back but wish the service was better.

11ccOooFLQn4TTqMZFzJGA.text: Delicious margaritas and ceviche! Definitely will be coming back! Happy it's close to home

MpgMuyGP4T5z4gNTMo583w.text: If ur looking for authentic Mexican homemade food then look no further! Off the strip so its a total locals place! The decor, the staff uniform, the sopita de fideo, the beans, ughhhhh everything is HOMEMADE! I do wish the tortialls were hand made though BUT trust me u won't regret it! I had the cilantro steak n it was juicy tender and full of flavor! The food is delish! And its not greasy like some fake bootleg Mexican places ive tried out here! Am from Cali n recently moved to vegas in searc of some good authentic Mexican tacos n food like back home and FINALLY foubd this hidden gem!
