ZEDLaaXtDVwZFmSM1-4AHQ.text: Bueno, visited here with a large party after a family photo shoot. Service was really prompt, the chips were Delicious as was the salsa. I ordered the fajita platter, which was immense and tasty but i fought the battle of the belly bulge and won. Also at the time they offered a free margarita with my checkin so yay :D.

CqokZZcyfS3An91gAT8DLA.text: What 4 stars overall really? This place is way better then Lindo There service is amazing I never had a to call the waiter our food was delicious. Venue is great. Overall it was AMAZING!!!!! Ever since Viva closed this has been the new to go restaurant.

6wzrx9YYE3dh8h-lvETU5A.text: Found them online, got takeout from them tonight.  One star less as they forgot a single fish taco in our order, but everything else came as ordered and was excellent. They may have the best guacamole I've tasted outside my own kitchen. Great refrieds and all else was very good. Super friendly on the phone and at pickup.

mURyYvZ5sarS2akm0M0CVQ.text: Great service. Good food. And a free margarita to boot if you check in through yelp.  Would go back in a heartbeat!!

5gBBHP0vzWkGQ_hfRYqqcA.text: If you were a fan of Viva Michoacan on Sunset, you're probably still crying about its close.  Well, dry those tears!  This place has recipes that are similar, if not the same, as Viva!  The soup, tortillas, and dishes like Shrimp Dionisia and Chicken Zirahuen are to die for.  And the service!  Our waiter was so nice - you truly feel welcome there.  And if that wasn't enough, there was a man playing music, too!  Excellent Mexican food, excellent service, and prices way better than the Lindo in GVR.  We will drive out of our way to Bonita whenever we want the best.  PS- Football fans - there are TVs everywhere!

Ni7QTSX2k9mMV0zgLdchIQ.text: There are lots of things to do in Las Vegas, but there is only 1 thing that is mandatory on our list: dinner at Bonito Michoacan. For me it's all about the carnitas. My wife it's all about the handmade flour tortillas. A trip to Vegas hasn't even begun until we've had our fix. We just love, love, love it.

rLzjZreqJ_joVOMucNMihg.text: Even though my husband and I have been here several times because it's the closest mexican restaurant to where we live...I will still give it 3 stars. Out of the about 6 or 7 times we've been there, food is always GREAT and Fresh...but unfortunately, we've never had great service. Either something is forgotten, they don't come around often enough to check on us, they bring out the wrong order, etc. I hate to only give this location 3 stars because the food is so good...but as far as the overall experience, I hate feeling "forgotten about" or a "burden" because I ask for a refill on my drink, then have to wait for 15 min to get it. : /

eaV2nhfdfPAd9IN4t_dW1g.text: Great food. Not great atmosphere. But when you are with good company, that part matters less.   Pros:  chips, salsa, bean dip, yum  tasty tomato base soup for free, yum  good margaritas and they made my specialty margarita correctly!  friendly and attentive staff   Cons:  odd decor - clowns....creepy  odd floor plan  right when you walk in you can see the nasty kitchen lights because the wall around the kitchen is low   I had a poblano cream chicken dish with rice and beans. OMG. TDF! I couldn't stop eating.   We will be back! I just recommend a little redesign/redecorating. Hire someone to help with that. Don't just let the wife/daughter of the owner handle it. A professional who can help make it more appealing and attractive and updated.

YLIcgcGG6Qv0Wo92Yg7w5g.text: Our favorite Mexican restaurant of all time. We've been going here for 10 years and never had a bad experience. Table side guacamole is delicious and neat presentation made in front of you.  I've tried about everything and loved it. Lorenzo or Julio take great care of you.

FdBg8pOw5Fk7uKKZM6e91A.text: I was visiting my sister and family in whittier ca and decided to go to Las Vegas for the weekend. We were looking for a good mexican restaurant and asked when stopped for gas. Thank God they gave directions to this place. Being from San Antonio tx I like tex mex food. Was this a pleasant surprise as soon as we walked in. I really liked the sopa de fideo to start with. Then the chips with salsa and very good re fried beans in a small bowl. Settled on chicken enchiladas with white sauce . Must not have liked it because I don't remember it being very good. Service was great. Ordered guacamole and they fixed it at the table for you. Very good. Was not crowded since it was Sunday before noon. Did not like being in a cramp place. There were five of us. Also used the womens bathroom they ran out of paper towels. Told waitress and a very nice lady and gentleman talking to her offered me their napkins. Waitress didn't know what to do.we were there in April. But overall the food was very good. I will go back next time in Vegas.we had been looking for a good place every time we are there.

t6of_xGBxPpZLf-udmED7A.text: Second time here and it was just as good as the last time. We arrived Saturday night @730pm. It was packed but we were able to get a table right away. The hostess was friendly and was able to get us regular table instead of a booth by a very loud party. Our water and chips were almost immediately served. The salsa was hot......ouch, but not for my partner who devoured the bowl!  Seconds followed and so did our waiter to take our drink order. I had a mojeto.........pardon my spelling. It was tall, cool and refreshing. This was laden mint leaves and plenty of alcohol. While waited for food, a DJ played some funky 70s tunes with Mexican music, we laughed and thought it was cool.  Our food was good, nothing out of the ordinary...I had the shrimp sauteed in a cream sauce with lots garlic which I love. My partner had the burrito....covered in cheese and sauce......uh interesting since burritos are not covered in either.  It looked more like a huge enchilada.  The overall service and atmosphere was great. The food, good....but not exceptional.  We will go back.

G5RuVsplzk0joxz71euWUg.text: This place had really friendly service. The food came out fast and hot. The food was great especially the fresh guacomole that they make infront of you, just the way you would like it.

GuqYJZ08cQaLaISnyVp4Lg.text: This place is a hidden jewel to all the tourist.  if you are looking for a tradtional authentic mexican restaurant then this is the place. the owner came from Michoacan, Mexico and they know how to cook.  from homemade tortillas to everything on the menu. You can not go wrong with nothing on this menu. they even bring you chips, homemade beans, and salsa in the beginning.  i would recommend this to anyone. Great food, Great service, and TRUE mexican food.

l_QgjzpQ9FLZOYyh1J9J5w.text: Came here for a family gathering. Unfortunately, there are no real vegan options. Even the beans are made with dairy. The rest of the family seemed to enjoy the food, but vegans should come prepared to starve.

gCv0GQ2yy-2nH45Ac0UeFw.text: Absolutely delicious!  My husband and I love checking out Mexican restaurants where ever we go. This place is the real deal!  We tried several different things on the menu. The shrimp tacos were fantastic!  Service was great. We will make a point of going back next time we are in Vegas!

o1O-WgrqTqAgOU2ow1_G2g.text: We stopped by on Super Bowl weekend and were not disappointed the food was great Bam Bam was at his best. One of the most interesting men in the world ! Friendly and entertaining waiter.

_GinylzXUby6Sho_xBUq1A.text: Went here for a company birthday party and I must say that the waitress we got, was on her game. She was working our table, 12 people and a few others that were 2-4 people and she didnt miss a beat.  The food was good. The albondigas soup was awesome. Im kinda plain when it comes to ordering, so I had myself a couple shredded beef tacos with some rice.  The beef was seasoned nicely and was a lil too tender for my liking, but good for the most part.  The atmosphere is great. They do karaoke(or at least i hope it was karaoke, not a band) when it gets a lil later into the evening.

9x99NI4rmsqAbW4zGuoTAQ.text: People, if you are in Vegas for a few days, hire a car and get off the strip.  The restaurants are 100 times better off the strip.  I have to confess:  I have never been a fan of Mexican food until I discovered this place and Lindo Michoacan - also in Vegas city.  Admittedly, the only Mexican food I've had has been in Toronto and ... well, need I say more.  Everything at this place is good.  They even prepared (complimentary) table side guac. for us.  OMG the freshness of the ingredients is unsurpassed.  They have traditional Mexican food like pozole (one of my favourites) and chicken with wine and prunes.  I salivate just thinking about the place.  Spouse loves the chicken verde as well.  The freshness of the ingredients ... tomatillos that were not out of a can ... indescribable.  The refried beans is like silk going down.  One of my all time favourite restaurants ever.  The owners are truly nice guys who really make one feel at home.  Go there.  Tell them I sent you.

xXOLGfEzB5dNhC5hCGcPfg.text: If you go there, be prepared to eat!  The food there is delicious, and the service fantastic.  We brought our daughter for her birthday meal here, and they could not have been more gracious.

cV2uhhR07uMkI25GyJHDdg.text: Craving the delicacy we call carnitas, I found myself at Bonita Michoacan.  I ordered the Michoacan carnitas expecting deep fried goodness but came out with a savory, saucy goodness! It was coated with a delicious green sauce that was superb for the carnitas!  The tortillas were thinner that what I was use to but they were homemade. Being different made it better!! The tortillas were also larger than the normal corn tortillas.  I LOVE BEANS! So it was a plus that they gave SALSA and BEANS with our chips at the beginning of our meal.  For all you clown-a-phobics, do not go here! There is clowns galore near the bathroom. If you go, you'll know what I mean.

rX_075yV3Xz3aNsvGYfMzw.text: My husband and I went here to use our groupon. He ordered chile rellenos and I carnitas. Food was great specially with our groupon. However our server was not the best. He waited several minutes  before he checked on us or to refill our drinks. But the busser was very attentive and took care of us because our server wouldn't. Also the so called live music is just a man with a key board. If my review was solely based on food I would rate it 4.5. However based on the overall experience I had to rate 3.

IX0m20d4Jy-yNbp1wmuO9w.text: I used to love coming here! It was my family's place to always go out to eat but recently, the last couple of times I've gone have not been to great.

QGAeBpB6eiWQjL5PGhpmhg.text: Seriously good food, and great service!  Very authentic,  and they made stuff for our group that wasn't even on the menu!

JkKIpBS54kGt1c2iukI0nQ.text: Just finished having dinner for the first time at this restaurant after driving by it for so many years!  Well, we could kick ourselves for not stopping in before.   I ordered the Chile Rellenos Camerones, which were 2 mild green peppers stuffed with shrimp and topped with cheese. They were really tasty and the shrimp tasted fresh and not like they've been sitting in the fridge for a week.  This entree came with tortillas (corn or my choice, flour) freshly made on-site.  Curiously though, as many homemade tortillas I have eaten in my life, these got really stiff, pasty and cracker like once they got cold.  The wife had the Sopes with Carne Asadas which she enjoyed.  Our sons enjoyed a cheese quisadilla and the other, a cheeseburger and fires, which were really good.  All entrees came with a really good fideo soup.    Service was really good.  The only hiccup came at the end.  At the beginning of the meal (when we were ordering) I presented our 20% off coupon from our local newspaper that was valid Sun-Fri.  Our server told us he would deduct the discount when he brought our bill at the end of the meal and placed the coupon in his shirt pocket.  I made a silent bet with myself that the bill would not reflect the discount because the server was going to worry we would not tip him appropriately.  My wife and I are not those kind of tippers.  If they are good they will always get 20% from us and if there is a discounted amount, they always get the pre-discount amount for a tip, but we know there's a lot of people who don't practice this but to each their own.  Anyways, we finally got the bill adjusted and left, happy.  We'll definitely be returning here and bring out of town family and friends here also, since El Patron closed.  This place is a lot cheaper than Lindo in HD, whose parking lot also sucks!

1waS31DUnkW7zeF3g4Q3Dg.text: Good authentic food with reasonable price. They have exceptional service with live band... I will definitely come back here with my fam... Have to try their fresh  guacamole made to order...

527UqMjsEjYMA7wLWmZToQ.text: I had my dad's birthday here. The staff was above and beyond accommodating. They allowed all 20 of us to sit and drink a while before ordering. They let us bring balloons and decorations. They split our check into small parties. I cannot say enough how much I appreciate their customer service. To top it all off, they sang happy birthday and gave my dad a 60th birthday shot! Great food, great service, great atmosphere...GREAT, GREAT, GREAT!

Yc6ahRQLsY36usbgcPeJMA.text: The food was great but they refused to honor my free Margarita offer for checking in via yelp. No bueno.

f-kxwl2GrFQSDSW1tPJ-2A.text: I prefer New Mexico mexican food but Bonito Michoacan has some very good dishes.  The carnitas are very good, as is the mole enchiladas.  The gratis chips, salsa and beans is a nice touch too.

M6hY0OWhS8hVt6uTP70DDw.text: Received free margarita for checking in, so decided to go here for Cinco De Mayo. The margarita was served on the rocks in a very small glass. We could not taste any liquor in the drink,  and noticed other folks paying for their drinks had full size glasses. We've been traveling the southwest (new mexico, arizona, california and west tx) for a month eating at a different Mexican restaurant every day and this place is nothing out of the ordinary. The flour tortillas tasted store bought and the green chili verde was gross, pork rubbery not falling apart like we are used to. The chips, salsa and bean dip are served complimentary, but did not wow us. Our server Lorenzo was arrogant and acted as if we inconvenienced him. Worst food we have had in a month. We will not be back. Go to Yuma or Tucson for some really great authentic Mexican cuisine.

HWRGzn1lDBNvbqDL7zlBxQ.text: This place is great!  Huge portions, great service and awesome food.  The decor has a little to be desired here but who gives a flying F when the food is this good?  Awesome lunch specials too.

pbfVIxwz0IMNm15H-fz-eA.text: We went at 4:30, which unfortunately is before the live music! (I don't know if it was every night, but as we were finishing, a mariachi band started playing).  One weird thing, either the seats at the booths were low, or the tables were high (or both...) but when I sat down the table was noticeably higher than a normal table...but I'm short.  This was some delicious food.  We got the tableside guacamole (made fresh, to order, pretty good, but no tomatoes) and it was quite an amount, more than most other sides of guacamole I've gotten.  We (me and three guys with appetites) didn't even finish it.  Of course, that may have had something to do with the HUGE portions that came our way.  One of the guys got fajitas (I think shrimp) and all his fixin's took up a full third of the table.  I got nachos with carne asada...mmmmmm.  A huge plate, piled high.  I think I only got through a third of it before collapsing.  After lunch (lunch at 4:30...this is what happens when you wake up at noon...) we went down to Fremont Street for a couple hours, and even nachos after fours hours sitting in a car were soooo goood....

MDNHqYFYdy3JfvCuQwLRcQ.text: This is easily my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.  The chips and salsa are great.....both are home made and the salsa is very spicy.....just the way I like it.  It is not for the weak.  My favorite dishes are: Queso Fundido w/Chorizo - Basically a cheese appetizer with chorizo served on a hot fajita plate.  Comes with flour or corn tortillas....this is very good.  I order this when I take friends to this restaurant for the 1st time and every one of them agree with me.  Carne Asada Burrito - Very tasty, good quality Carne Asada.  Inside their menu, they have a lot of dishes to choose from....not to mention an extensive combo menu where there are a lot of combo dishes.....I have tried at least 7 or 8 different combos...all are very good.  We go to this restaurant at least 1 to 2 times per month for lunch at work and 1 time per month for dinner.  The prices are very reasonable too.

7egr_k7ymOvIpoFd4yRCSQ.text: I was in the mood for some Mexican food Saturday night, so i drug my man out and we ended up here.  A friend comes here frequently and had recommended it to me. We started off with the Queso Fundido which was pretty good. For dinner I had the Camarones Al Cognac which was amazingly delicious. I ate every last bite! My man had the Chile verde, I didn't taste it (no room left!) but he assured me it was to die for. Service was great, only complaint was the ambiance is so-so. Will definitely be returning here!!

aAGmPxkfupOyCJDONvW5Mg.text: I ordered the Machaca con Huevos; Superb! However, the service was super slow though. Because the food is so good and authentic, I give them a pass.

_IwlEv4uInJZvZuiuuO-Jg.text: My wife and I went here last night.  We had a shrimp dish and the carne asada.  The steak tasted salty which was weird.  The shrimp was a little too chewy.  Not great overall.  The service was good, lots of helpful guys.  The reason for only two stars was the after-affect the next morning of Montezumas revenge for both of us.  That was an experience we could have had at a roadside taco shop.  No amount of free alcohol would make me 'Vote Benito'  Thanks.

P6mVAh6v1-LSVGvQ0VmFoA.text: authentic mexican. live music, bar, attire & decor make fresh salsa & guacamole tableside. my tea never got 1/2 empty. more chips & salsa without ever asking truly the best authentic mexican yet!! very spicy & meats were tender and juicy. crispy tacos too a truly authentic mexican joint with great lunch specials. $5.99/$7.99/$9.99 for 1/2/3 item combos

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JXHrArzIVbrC4ip5-l5zeA.text: I really like this place. We come here pretty often and never really have a bad meal. Service is hit or miss, but we usually have a good time. My favorite dishes are the green pork burrito, whole fried fish and menudo. The salsa is good and spicy too.

21m4RxIjnDjgfNemiOoiUA.text: Great food, nice atmo...They always give you more than you can handle. Almost any entree is started w/ soup...Fideo.... I have fond memories with friends at this place...It almost takes me back to the time before I had kids & we could sit at the bar drinking Corona's till they close.   I have a bad habit of ordering the same thing... Fajita's...  I guess 'cause I know thier good & I am a definate creature of habit. highly recommended I would have given 5 stars but I guess i'm just picky that way.

EgXb7NDxBDwT3HzZDS-z5w.text: Servers are very nice but the food taste like microwaved leftovers.  However, if you give them a good review they give you a free margarita. Guess I'm not getting one...

7xfq-7posijFj_RaewK0Kw.text: The food is consistently good, service good. My biggest complaint is when someone is celebrating their Birthday, the wait staff engages in this" Happy Birthday To you" song. Not only is it WAY TOO LOUD, it's obnoxious sounding because of the tambourine, guitar,and noise making devices they use. It's OVERKILL!!! My ears are usually bleeding from this stupid tradition they have. They need to get rid of this ritual. The greatest waiter they have is Julio, professional, attentive, excellent personality. There is another waiter to avoid, he usually works nights, he is loud and obnoxious and should be selling used cars somewhere, I don't know his name but would give it if I did! He is so loud that you can hear everything he says from across the room, again, classless!

epZ5ztM9blrova5zWnS2WA.text: came in to vegas for vacation, i ask a local were to go for good mariscos. he was dead on this place was great.  good food good service great beer

lQ4QLgal2RNher3kaiNF3A.text: Delicious guacamole made table-side. Staff was prompt and took care of our needs quickly, they seemed to genuinely enjoy their work. Bar service turned out delicious Cadillac margarita's, customized for each of our parties particular tastes with no complaints.

Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6NOQgD-rRLV9Cy4hXQzvPA.text: Was visiting Las Vegas and decided to go here because of the name and since my boyfriend is from Michoacan, we were attracted even more.  Service took so long to even refill drinks. Salsa for chips was like frozen salsa they just microwave. Michelada was a joke.  He had some enchiladas with side of steak which he requested to be medium rare. I had some sort of fried fish.  The enchiladas were dry and nothing like what the pictures showed. He was so disappointed.  The fish was just like any other fish... left some weird feeling after eating but overall I didn't enjoy it. You would think this place is in some way representing Michoacan and the food would taste good in a authentic way. WRONG!!!! DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!!!

Oi1ygdeGvagTf3shTJ9QJw.text: Great lunch fajitas. Awesome flour tortillas.  And hey, the free margarita for checking in at the place ain't so bad either.  The bartender at lunch is very talkative and easy going.  Food was excellent, I recommend it.

t5djPKCnqNC6gGfM6Uarfw.text: Me and my family eat here every few years on special occasions. Both the outside and inside is very beautiful, adorned with beautiful colors and decorations. There is often times a mariachi band inside, filling the room with romantic ballads. Usually we get a platter of grilled meat and seafood, unless we want some of their quesadillas, caldos, and other dishes. Their torillas are handmade, very delicious with either soups or carne. Don't forget to save room for dessert (if your not full by the main course that is).

MlNqyEa7vx-gRjYA8Cgs2w.text: Seriously some of the most authentic Mexican food I've had here in the states besides my abuelitas cooking.  The service is outstanding! They are super friendly, fast and helpful.  We come from Utah twice a year to come to this amazing restaurant.

fifBLmfFgdMFPh7DgdR4vQ.text: Love this place and the food. I had an awesome time. The guacamole is made in front of you. They have live music.

OrjArUJ_vPfeevQgy-f1pQ.text: This place is great authentic Mexican food. Really good food I had the Chile relleno with shrimp

nq9JFwz2dHTL06_OQxB_yw.text: Omg!! This place is amazing!!! By far at the best restaurant I've tried in Las Vegas. The spot is sooo cute and colorful with high ceilings which is a plus because it doesn't make the place feel all stuffy. I tried the enchiladas Michoacanas and they are a MUST the sauce is sooo tasty full of flavor a tiny bit spicy but it's perfect. Please please try it lol. All the main dishes come with fideo soup that tasted homemade just like the one my momma makes :) my friend had the ceviche de Camaron she disliked it she feels it needed more flavor by the look of her face i can tell she didn't enjoy it one bit. But overall the place was great at least my dish :) oh an their agua de horchata is very good tooooo

bk8spAekCKihoBekKFOvGQ.text: Me and my family are regulars here. The food is good and the service is awesome, especially if you have Ricardo as your waiter. If you are a seafood lover you must try the fish enpanada with their creamy sauce on top. If you are into steak their new York strip with cilantro sauce is very good. Hubby and I really enjoy the Oyster with ceviche on top (they are not stingy with the shrimp).  We do birthday dinners here ALL the times because we love the atmosphere.  For birthdays the waiters and waitress get together and do a band like show for the birthday person, love it! Thank you guys for a pleasant experience we will see you soon

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the reason we come, waiters like Ricardo
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster with an awesome twist, shrimp ceviche on top. umm!!

hyceQjIHCYXwN5QKVVbDyw.text: I went here with a friend of mine. The hostess and waiter were very friendly. The waiter took the time to understand what we liked and recommended a couple entrees. The food was delicious. Two disappointments were the chips and salsa and the small amount of guacamole. The salsa lacked character and texture. It did not taste fresh homemade. The guacamole garnish on the entree was about 2 tablespoons. Still, I will go three again for the appetizers and entrees, and the pleasant service.

FTNGUStIrLxwgq7ds5ue5A.text: Visitng on 4/20 weekend so we were looking for a place to sit down away from the strip with 10plus hungry guests where we could enjoy some Delicious Authentic Food and have Guacamole made fresh at our table. I really liked the Fideo soup we got as a complimentary appetizer. It was a good choice that we had found on Google.

rW0OxJZ8nYzdqaZZPNWbkw.text: This is very good quality food and excellent service! I have been here several times before, this particular visit I was a little disappointed with the bean dip. I look so forward to the chips, salsa, and bean dip that is served when you are seated. Usually it is AMAZING and I dive in like a maniac! Today the beans were hard and dry, just not good at all. Chips and salsa were still good though..... just a bad day for the beans I guess.  Today, my husband and I shared the Parrillada de Marisco. A huge platter of shrimp, crab, fish, and rice. A very good value for $45.  There was shrimp prepared different ways, butterflied and fried (which was very tasty) bacon wrapped (wasn't my absolute favorite) shrimp in enchilada sauce (very good, especially when eaten with the fabulous rice in the center of the platter) There was not a lot of crab. One bunch of snow crab legs... they were nice and sweet though.  A large Tilapia filet in a butter sauce, which was very good.  Wonderful creamy rice piled right in the center of the tray. Then on the side they serve an amazing queso and warm fresh homemade tortillas!  We accompanied our Parrillada de Marisco feast with a couple of shots of tequila, 1942 and it was FABULOUS!!! Pricey tequila shots, but good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shots... 1942 Taquila
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parrillada de Marisco

zD-utGtHjyOTF23YaWirkQ.text: This is my first visit to Benito's, as we have just relocated into the area. My first impression was how well we were received and welcomed. From the hostess to the waitress to the busboy , they were all upbeat and friendly. Now the food. We travel a lot and generally try to test the Mexican fare wherever we go. Comparatively speaking, this is one of the best eateries I've encountered in a long time. The chili verde was like mom used to make. The complimentary appetizer "sopa" was excellent, and the margaritas were great as well. I look forward to frequenting this establishment and work my way through the menu.

n3X13ijm_KW7JoANPI-fZw.text: This place was great! The ambience and decor reminded me of my Abuela's house, and the staff was super nice and friendly. They gave us complimentary chips, salsa, beans, AND sopa de fideo. The food itself was great and was a nice reminder of home and home cooked meals. I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for authentic Mexican food.

uLklKEhN7Hd9vd4g-Wz4fw.text: Came here after recommendation from others as well as seeing the reviews on Yelp.  First off, the starter chips and refried beans/salsa are great. They come quickly, taste fantastic, and are plentiful.  Service is also great - I found it hard to reach the bottom of my glass before refills, waiters were (sincerely) friendly, etc.  Soon after ordering they brought an appetizer of spaghetti soup(?) which was way too salty for my taste.  I had ordered the fajita, which was just okay. The beans/rice/guac that came with were high quality but pretty sparse. It came with some pretty amazing flour tortillas though, which really carried the meal.  Flan topped off my lunch here for dessert. It was definitely too sweet and soft for my taste, but was edible.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajitas!

KTLqP9DFM9hn-PWeSVX4Vw.text: A must any time we're in Vegas... the food is 4 stars but with all the added "treats," it makes it a good 5 stars. You are greeted with chips, salsa, and refried beans followed by a warm yummy fideo soup when you order an entree.   The staff is attentive, friendly, and welcoming. Today, we tried the Carnitas Michoacan and they were absolutely delicious. The hand made tortillas were soooo good. Completed our meals with an order of warm churros!!! Time for a nap now :)

4Xp51-rEn0J3Hl5RxADk3A.text: good place to eat mexican food. ambience is also pretty cool. i feel like im in mexico lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. good place to eat mexican foods if your craving for it. place is really big and the atmosphere is one of the best.

83DXXeXHC6xBrU360NmySA.text: Great mexican food. Wonderful margaritas! Huge menu, I can always find something no matter what my mood is.

RK-LGuRzyUUg9aX5CIFSfg.text: Delicious! The only thing better than the food was the service. The waiter was the best! He was warm and friendly and funny. We had 5 different entrees and everyone enjoyed. I had a creme and pepper base chicken breast entree that was so tender! Each meal came with noodle soup as an appetizer along with tortillas and salsa. We left very satisfied.

6bR4vHVHdVhFQD11Paj1eg.text: This is our favorite Mexican restaurant in Town. It's our go to once a month spot. They serve fresh food thats consistent in taste and portion. They have a frendly staff and usually get seated right away. They serve chips, salsa and warm bean dip with every dinner. You have to ask to get the spicy green salsa. Soup is served with your meal as well. The margaritas are the best in town. We always leave with leftovers. Great the next day. Moderate to medium prices. Always worth it. Been going here regularly for four years.

gIg0ndzZ-WNybXxYDfKWHw.text: Ate here only once with my best friend and at the time his girlfriend back in 2012 or 2011. Overall the food was pretty good really enjoyed the tacos and enchilladas and rice the wait wasn't too bad as we went on a day that wasn't too busy. The service was real fast and and very good and we got the food and drinks fast and in order. Overall this is a nice mexican restaraunt to eat at whether for business family get togethers or etc. The prices are kind of pricey but so worth it so if your in the area and looking for a restaraunt with a nice atmosphere and good food then check this place out.

LkWjveEEccWiWAKXnETKjw.text: I've been here twice and the food is very authentic. Everything I've had here is delicious it can get a little crowded on weekends but that's pretty much all restaurants. The staff is very nice and they constantly check up on you. The portions are generous great for sharing.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rz5mTOA8hO1FdFRpRDU6iw.text: This place is amazing. From the ambiance to to the food to the service.  We had a shrimp quesadilla and the shrimp and steak fajitas. The homemade flour tortillas were so good. We also had cheese enchiladas. I would give them 10 stars if i could. The waiter was so attentive and friendly. We will for sure be back. I love how clean it is and the decor is amazing. The prices are reasonable and definitely worth it. We will definitely be back.

A3QoCQLIMDMZA2YFGPzKmg.text: My son and I went here on Cinco de Mayo.  They were busy, but we got seated right away.  Lots of friendly and knowledgeable staff!! The menu is large, and has many authentic dishes that are hard to find, such as birria de chivo and a tacos de lengua.  The food was delicious, and portions were very generous.  They even had a mariachi band in elegant costumes!  I highly recommend it!!

ftjXxeznccbKyMOJwApmuQ.text: Half of the waiters guys kept flirting with the ladies table next to us and we waited an hour til we can get our drinks cause they kept flirting horrible plus the waiters were rude as hell

XcLVGfI8jN1PfqGMOP5C8w.text: Love this location of the family of restaurants. I always order the Queso Fundido with chorizo and mushrooms and the Pollo Sarndeado. Lunch specials are a great deal!

Z3vDS-qlExSdIn6DP0wHMQ.text: I've come here  for years. And every time I come back I enjoy my experience even more than before. Best authentic Mexican food in the whole Southern Nevada area. Not to mention their mixed drinks are also very good. I definitely recommend to anyone who wants to eat best Mexicans food and drinks in town.

WWi9kHg-h62obtMW_Zg9OQ.text: On a company business trip to Las Vegas and we decided to come here and since its highly recommended to us.  We were greeted and got us a table right away upon arrival. With chips, salsa and beans with water. The drinks was very good. The menu selection made very difficult to choose. Food was very good, our group ordered different things so we can taste from each plate. The service staff was excellent and attentive. Most definitely come back here again.

iov64_kLEll3WfTjj3zywg.text: I came into this restaurant to accompany my boyfriend and his cravings to eat here. I didn't touch the free chips I wasn't served soup because of course I wasn't hungry and I wasn't there to eat. But the one thing I did ask for was water. WATER THAT IS FREE & I get very dehydrated especially because am pregnant. & not only was there multiple times the waiters offered to refill my boyfriends soda and not my water. Am over here chewing ice , chewing my boyfriends sodas ice,  while they  keep only offering him refills my boy friend then tells the waiter to bring me another glass of water. & THEY NEVER BROUGHT ME A GLASS OF WATER. WORST PLACE TO COME TOO IF YOU AREN'T GOING TO EAT THERE THE EMPLOYEES TREAT YOU LIKE SHIT.  VERY DISAPPOINTED ON HOW A GLASS OF WATER WAS TOO MUCH TOO ASK FOR.

EQicp2VHdAtEDgt3WyoLNw.text: I expected it to be a lot better. Don't get me wrong, the service was amazing. They Kept coming to our table just to make sure everything was okay. HOWEVER, the food was whitewashed. I feel like people who don't know what real Mexican food is are the same people who gave it 5 stars. The food looked presentable but taste wise, it wasn't close Mexican food. On top of that, it was pretty expensive. Save your money, go eat somewhere that's worth paying  for

uQDwcQpZ6vP1qamtqpSPSQ.text: This is good Mexican food in Las Vegas area. My only complaint is the green Chile I'm a fan of New Mexico style Mexican with hatch green Chile's so out here I recommend the red sauce but it's very good food and great service

gkpIFBsOu4PvEd55_uLaGA.text: Went to Las Vegas for a week long trip and on the last day we were all extremely tired and in need of a great meal! We searched up Mexican restaurants and although this was the third closest, we still drove the extra miles because the ratings were good. The attention was great! He made us laugh and took care of us. The food was exactly what we were expecting. Great place!

BdybM-MmSPFIJBHTJ_J05g.text: This food was hands down, the best Mexican food I've had since living in Vegas. The staff are courteous and attentive. They're there when you always need something. The food was very flavorful just like your Na would make in the kitchen. Lorenzo is hands down one of the greatest waiters here! Highly recommend!

TD2bUD8odfdGJ9f8duDUcA.text: From the moment you walk in you feel the authentic vibe, colors and schemes and the hostess dressed in traditional clothing! Be sure and check in for a free margarita. Fresh chips salsa and bean dip when you get ur table. And it's real and good! We ordered our meals they come with a house style broth soup with noodles that is amazing! I also ordered albongdos soup which brought me back to my days in Mexico! I had the cheese and chicken enchiladas beef tostados and chicken taco! Hi gotta tell ya! Your missing out if you don't come here! Our server Isreal is a top notch guy! Thanks for all you do in preparing presenting and delivering an amazing meal! You deserve 8 stars!

pIG8IjZMZ1kpDL0UmExi2Q.text: Good Mexican food from a gringo white guy. Plenty of parking and good service.reasonable prices and extensive menu. Good place for kids too.

R5FwHg9DKsA8dVNHJAZIAA.text: Great staff... fun and lively.  A good selection of many items to chose from on the menus.  Fun art and bright colors.  Feels like a family.   Great staff... fun and lively.  A good selection of many items to chose from on the menus.  Fun art and bright colors.  Feels like a family.

3DIIOrXRDSs-zNRwdgyPCQ.text: I called in a to go order my first time visiting got home and the menudo was Bland no flavor whatsoever I ask for cows foot I got three cow foot bones with nothing on them. I have to come home and literally season up the menudo myself for flavor .

2rPAgn3BzW6ZCAgOlay5ww.text: We found this place completely by accident on our way home. The breakfast was so delicious. The servers were so nice and attentive. We decided to try it for dinner our next time in Vegas. Again the food was delicious and the service was wonderful. The sopes were so delicious and good size portions. The beans and rice were perfect (I'm Mexican and picky about my rice.)

9WYh-pUOEf2ZXcmAKF0K1Q.text: The worst experience. We were 4 last night and the server tricked us with the price of dish, glad I double checked before paying the bill. Only 2 tortillas come with Fajita, and additional will be charged for $1, but the server charged $6 intentionally. Kids don't get served the fideo soups before the meal. I don't recommend this place to anyone.

bMJ9RilONNLySDJ9wDSyww.text: First time here but came after a good friend says he goes every time he's in Vegas!  Great food, outstanding service (thanks Richard), and good atmosphere.  The place was packed, but we had a reservation and were seated right on time.  This is now my go to place for quality Mexican food!  Thanks for a great Father's Day!

T2a2eY07X3MRnRQkTz9JLw.text: Great food. Good drinks. Closest to my mother in laws home cooked meal that I have found. Love the live music on the weekend. Great place for large groups.my favorite is the menudo on the weekends. The shrimp cocktail is yummy to.

n48MoMl__O1-PTDTeTlJIg.text: Steak cilantro was amazing. Went on cinco de mayo. Being a Mexican restaurant, it was busy, but in 20 minutes we were seated and had our drinks.THE STEAK. WAS THE BEST!!!!! I had chile relleno and it was delicious and... Delish. Do not miss steak cilantro! We stuffed ourselves with guacamole and their fabulous bean dip so we were already kind of full. Totally worth the short wait. I recommend this to anyone who likes Mexican food. Large menus ensure everybody gets what they are looking for and even if they don't know, it's safe to try something new!

7ShYRHsV_p1AM4-vaYOP4g.text: This place was really amazing. They have a great menu and very creative dishes. I had the fillet relleno, wash it down with a ice cold michelada and you're set.

c44Lb08LjAq5kzlbx64xvA.text: Great service, great guacamole, generous Margaritas, and all around very good food.  It's the tastiest Mexican food in town and the best service too.

iwYIoB99UA1l4MZB9m6PfQ.text: Service was good, food was okay I'd give it 3. Stars for food and 4 for service. The guacamole was really good- got some fresh homemade tortillas to go with it. I got a veggie burrito and I heard the chicken enchiladas were okay.

IJyTCf4mVcTGyetV_lhS5Q.text: My family and I absolutely love Mexican food and this is a great spot we've been coming to for years! The margaritas are very delicious and the food is quite traditional!The staff is very attentive and I look forward to coming back very soon!

l9y4zXWIhienNqWlsArW1w.text: Fan-friggin-tastic. get the chicken they recommend - it's a mind blower! Menu is insanely difficult to navigate so I just asked for a recommendation and poof, it was killer good. The best Mexican food I have ever eaten.

4Ieec880mt3kgHQu6Pa1og.text: This is a place that my friends from California really like to go to.  The service is quite excellent where when you get chips you get salsa as well as bean dip.  When ordering food I suggest you get the Flour tortillas to be used because they taste so much better than the corn ones where the nachos are very delicious where they don't skip out on anything in it.  I ordered the Flautas (which are nicer taquitos) and it was really really good.

eAOoWGvoeLbTeDhFka7VVA.text: My 5 stars are specifically for the quality of the food, the meal was phenomenal. Amazing flavor and a very large portion. A tad bit expensive but what can you expect from a great quality restaurant. Hands down one of the top 5 Mexican food spots I've ever had, I'll be back whenever I find myself on the west side of the strip.

m20HoZT9QzVDp__tbYoKwA.text: Great place for music, drinks and mariscos very friendly. Friends and I stop by for dinner on our vacation to vegas we had verity of food.  Coctel de camaron, agua chile, ostiones, camarones al mojo de ajo, margaritas, vampiros everything was as expected good great taste drinks on point, deftly will eat at this please on my next vacation to sin city.

Jf4EURUA69LSJkFHUaIpoQ.text: Thats is not a real mexican food we ordered chicken mole we got grilled chicken w mole on top grilled chcken con mole l am from mexico a my wife fron guatemala and she like mole but not grilled chicken horrible  and chilaquiles con huevos estrellados the eggs was raw eggs l told them to cook om they burned and the chilaquiles w no cheese and onion Would I do not eat not recommend the place is nice But the food is not real Mexican food we never come back again

dXVgrYadZRU4sPe_oBCwfQ.text: Get a free margarita when you check-in on Yelp! Generous portions of delicious Mexican dishes :)

hP8FmcFC0lLJffCaHdzwiQ.text: Excellent dining experience. The ceviche was awesome, carne asada dinner was one of the best I've ever had! Very nice service staff, everyone had a smile and kept our drinks and chips full. The gentleman providing the music on the keyboard was very talented. We gave him a $20 tip! It really set the mood for a authentic Mexican dining atmosphere. Whenever I come back to LV, this is a must stop for us!

WIPwYJUOCxLrsMNtBjTSgA.text: I love this place! My favorite dish is Camarones Dionisia! By the way ask for Juan the waiter he's the best!!!

HA9DhBhoofu_uGmxxy3FKg.text: Where should I start? This place has great Mexican food for Las Vegas! The bean dip compliments the chips very well. I visited this place mid November and I didn't know what I wanted to eat for breakfast. It was already passed 10am when I realized that McDonald's would stop serving breakfast at 10:30am! I decided to google some Mexican restaurants and voila'! This place is close to the Las Vegas new strip. I had the machacado plate and he had the chorizo with cheese plate. Everything was great, the customer service and the price. I will definitively be coming back here every chance I can when in town. I am from Texas and it's sad to say the food here is better than some places back home. Now, you know! When in Las Vegas stop by here for Authentic Mexican Food....Only a 10 minute drive from the (new) strip.

HzO5-VzKIOYhwALm67AdvA.text: I was having a bad day and was in a horrible mood. Came here to eat and relax with my girlfriend. Juan totally turned my day around, he was the best server I've had in a long time. He Turned my night around and I left in a better mood. Food was good, price was affordable. I will be back again!

W26qMXIvkl4DeZ-oBi22kA.text: We loved this place!!  The service was spectacular!  The food was unique and delicious. They still had traditional items but some very creative dishes as well including beef tongue.   Maybe it's because we have been mostly eating on the strip where service is wakeful and the food is way over priced and bland. But this place with its festive decor and very very friendly and attentive staff really made our night!  We come to Vegas often and plan on making it a regular stop'

wQlqj2tro8SKasjt8EDr1g.text: This place is amazing, the steak ranchero, steak cilantro and the lingua are all fantastic. I moved to vegas from Texas and when I first got to vegas I was extremely disappointed with the Mexican food. Thats until I found this place, it does get crowded during peak hours but it's soooo good.

_eLUrAaMis6E36AklD1e5Q.text: Real authentic Mexican food. If your looking for something off the strip and want a family style restaurant, this is the place to be!

UhXJEM1vtjbkE8m7UFIQkQ.text: Great service and food as always. Can't go to Vegas without stopping here to recover after a long night. I had the Pollo Del Res. The veggies were so fresh with tender shredded white meat chicken. The tortillas both corn and flour are made fresh. I highly recommend!

0EUweVfx_7r_IM7a_eXgiw.text: Bomb!!! However this rude waiter brought the check to my party and said outlays that both mine and my boyfriend was declined. That was upsetting and embarrassing. I'm from LA so our bank put out account on hold. He should've not done that infront of my family. He should've pulled us a side or in low voice. But he rather screamed out on purpose. We didn't like him btw.   Other than that it was amazing! My bday surprise my bf got me was fantastic! Maybe mariachi every night would be nice.

04UgGkTHwq0A74j0fh5Ujw.text: Food was delicious  very authentic flavors. The bean dip with the chips is a nice freebie. Next time I will get more tacos  and maybe a margarita since they are known for having really good drinks.

-YIk0mBJMBst50AxR0Dtkg.text: A nice mexican restaurant!!! Very good food!!! Our server donal was very kind and funny, litle bit loud cause of the tv , but is ok

She was engaging, funny and took great care of us.  We will ask for her next time we go here.    The food is super fresh, well prepared and plenty of it.  The tortillas are amazing and we can't get enough of them.  This is my favorite place when I want Mexican food.

s5z8ex_ixZfHtmHTsaSbqQ.text: Great food and service. I sat at the bar and ordered margaritas and chile relleno and a taco. The bartender was very attentive and personable. Good conversation with a couple of the locals. Very friendly atmosphere would definitely come back.

p7EkWyeeKJvmbEjUAANyag.text: Food was good but the margaritas was amazing service was a little slow but OK one of my favorite places to visit when ever I'm in las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My free margarita was yummy

egcPDffsfC4bqki9tPEa0g.text: A must every time we come to Vegas the food is amazing the cilantro steak is my absolute favorite

BfB_y_N4-nMx-D2jNSUWmw.text: In town with the family, we choose to eat out at a Mexican Restaurant, they being locals and we being from out of town took their word.  This place serves you chips with beans and salsa to start and their re-fried beans are amazing delicious.  When I ordered my food I had to ask for another side of re-fried beans.  I tried their Green Chicken Enchiladas, the sauce was not spicy at all which is a plus, because if the food is too spicy where you can't even enjoy it that's not a good experience.  I got 2 enchiladas with rice and beans and that was enough to fill me up, I wasn't left hungry or over full either.  My family members ate the Shrimp Ceviche Tostadas, I tried one of these and they were amazing.  This place was a good pick, they had music, great tasting food, the price was right, the atmosphere was nice and the servers were very fast and nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salsa Verde Chicken Enchiladas, Delicious.

DO5atH3P1CpgiwGV7Ap1RQ.text: Very very  Excellent food And dining experience... You are great at and waited on as you enter staff is immensely  Impressed. Waiters are knowledgeable and pair if you are gonna drink their drinks are wonderful and delightful a must come

kwFkn10D5o0w6BYszkhqbQ.text: Driving back home to California, we stumbled onto this Mexican restaurant. So glad we did because the food and staff were great.   Thank u to our server Matin, for making our experience so enjoyable..we will definitely be back when we come back to Las Vegas.. .

0dG9VU3sTmN7hAe0pZHXLg.text: We decided to visit this restaurant based on previous reviews. Living in Southern California, we have visited many great Mexican restaurants and this one is on par! The decor, food, service and bar are awesome! The bar has a great selection of Tequilas from blancos to extra anejos. Their chips and salsa are fresh and the bean dip is an added plus.  The menu has something for everyone from basic Mexican plates to specialty seafood. Great place away from the strip.

KQcw2tnhMiRP-YkQeYWrTg.text: My favorite Mexican food joint in town. Hands down.   Customer Service is always excellent, but I like to sit down on the right side of the restaurant and get served by the pretty dressed up lady. Otherwise, service is usually pretty good overall.   I would come back here whenever I come back in town. Its one of those must.

dGV_S3Z9WlA5fyWIZ9WN_g.text: A pretty big disappointment all around. Decent location, ample parking. This is a plus. Enter, no clear host stand/seat yourself situation. We stood awkwardly waiting while people piled in doing the same.   Got seated in a cute booth. Fun decor. Lighting hurts. Ceiling fans make for a strange strobe light effect. Maybe a special for Halloween?   Service is terrible - possibly the worst in Vegas. Our "server" was Israel (so says our receipt). Forever to greet us. We probably were 1/3 way done with complimentary chips (the salsa is hot, the bean dip with is excellent) before he remembered to ask someone to bring water to our table. We ordered cocktails. They came out separately. By about ten minutes.   Ordered an appetizer (ceviche - pretty okay). Israel came by to ask for our entree order. We said we wanted to wait for our appetizer before we ordered our entrees. It had been a while. He gives us an "oh yeah!" Guess he forgot that too.   Ordered our meals. A table sat down after us. They got the included soup and chip refills AND entrees before us. We had to ask for included soup - from I'm assuming a food runner - he was hustling though!   Our busboy had our meals boxed for us before Israel came by to see how they were.   Food was okay (pollo al cognac). Not worth going back for, when such terrible, neglectful service is "provided". Definitely not worth the price though.   However, shout out to Domingo, our hardworking busboy who kept our water full and table clean. The server could learn a thing or seven from his work ethic and care for guests.   Sucks it's so close to home, but I'd say it's worth the drive for ANY (maybe even Bell of Taco) other mexican food in the area.

bd42A1zEePKltPr3a3_V1Q.text: The service is always great. Tonight my family of 5 came in for dinner. I ordered the chili relleno with cheese enchiladas. There was no cheese in the chili relleno the server took it back to the kitchen 2 times. When he brought it it was smoothed with cheese the inside the pepper still no cheese, the pepper was hard and the breading was so soggy with water. Since my plate went back to the kitchen multiple times and reheated the enchilada, beans and rice were over cooked. One of the gentlemen working asked if i needed a to go box i replied with i didnt like he didnt offer to get the server or manager. Its very disappointing we drove 30 minutes to have a nice dinner and it was not good. i dont think we will be returning anytime soon.

6uf_O2POI3Vc0TVtYK5cjQ.text: All the way from Dallas, TX!! I was recommended to this restaurant and I must say I'm very impressed, food is delicious and the margaritas are even more delicious!! The Margarita Mangoneada is the best!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gCW8hQ36U2iRuhW1NUe8xw.text: Totally love this place! My parents always want to eat here when they visit.  Chips and salsa are good, though not my favorite in town.   But they get a nice bump by ordering the table-made guacamole. Order how you like and enjoy, very tasty.   The lunch specials are great. Chicken is made well and the fajitas are always a good option.  For those wanting a different flavor to life, try the Coca Cola carnitas. A truly different flavor to Carnitas. A great mole-ish sauce with the flavor of coke.   Home made tortillas also sets this place apart.   Try the food, especially some of their specialty dishes. You might be surprised by some new tastes.   My only issue with the place, is with their iced tea. It is not great. Either the machine is broken or the filter is not great, but the flavor of the tea is not great. This is a recent development. It used to be clean and refreshing. I hope they fix it or replace.

pzLnjBhFzgHXojkTJs5gaw.text: Violete was perfect!! She helped us decide between apps and was so cheerful & polite!! Surprisingly it's not often to get such great service in this hospitality town (we are locals).   The food was like being back in Mexico on vacation, authentic and fresh!!  We will definitely be back and be referring to our friends!!

jjPAmBUKri5CSs-Gw5mDzg.text: Good service and drinks!   We were immediately seated though they were quite busy. The staff immediately greeted us and took our drink order, and served the complimentary chips and salsa. Then a nice young lady approached our table and took a picture of our group. Picture is available for purchase.    I ordered the steak burrito. The meat was chewy, dry and pretty tasteless. The rice was also dry, tasted and looked reheated.My partner had the red chilaquiles and they were very dry. Good flavor but dry. The meat also dry and tasteless.  Such let down! I will definitely return for drinks.

8oVKoODESkOHPnlL6s8-9g.text: I'm Vegas for the weekend and found this place and came for breakfast. Great food and excellent service.  Handmade tortillas.  Will definitely be coming back.

qFFi6PFr1AOjohTDNaMMiA.text: Carne asada tacos- 3/5 stars. Just average.  Lengua tacos- 4/5 stars. It was tender and delicious.  Fresh churros- 5/5 stars. I'd like to come back just for the desert and that's it.   I think overall it's not a bad place, but there wasn't too much of a standout item for me besides the desert and lengua tacos.

vXxvxIgXpFIDBP93I8vpjg.text: Wonderful atmosphere,  our service was splendid, and our food was delicious. Our server was sweet and he was very helpful with his recommendations. They have an extensive fun cocktail menu with a lively atmosphere. They were very busy while we were dining and it did not reflect in the quality of our food or service. As soon as you sit down someone greets you immediately with water, chips, Salsa, and warm bean dip. The portions are very generous and the drinks are delicious.  I highly recommend.

vCSSWt85XULCFv5fnHMJlQ.text: The food here is to die for. It's me & my boyfriends absolute favorite restaurant in town for sure. We always come here and we are never disappointed! Staff is very friendly, very nice and very helpful. This place is good for kids and good for lunch and dinner, I'm vegetarian and I can find at least 50 things to eat and they are all delicious. I recommend the fajitas de camaron, ceviche de camaron & the camarones a la diabla. You won't be disappointed. We'll be back here soon!

Y77d8DFR9mr8bsGJ-wg8RA.text: Absolutely horrible! Would never eat here again. Drinks and food were awful. It took an hour and a half to get dried out disgusting cold food.

NjJbMDCIObFYgjuTFBauYQ.text: Awesome Mexican Food We come to Las Vegas 2-4 times a year. When we do, we try and find hidden gems away from the hotel/casino's. This trip it was Michoacan Gourmet Mexican. Turned out to be great choice. Located on the corner of Decatur and Twain, north of Flamingo, the place has a classic Mexican restaurant feel to it. We made reservations for 5:30 and arrived just a bit early. While it wasn't jammed at that point, when we left at about 6:45 the place was full and they had a full lobby waiting. So, reservations are strongly suggested. Food was outstanding, In our party of five we had two orders of Fajitas de Pollo (so much food that honestly two could have shared one order), the Mole Poblano (raved about), and a couple of combinations. All orders come with a cup of sopa de fideo which was a nice light start, plus the proverbial chips and salsa/beans. You can also order. You can also order their fresh guacamole which is made table side. We didn't and after tables all around us did, we regret not doing so. All the food was great. Service was good-to-very good. The busboy (Ivan I think) was outstanding in refills of drinks and being present for any request. The server was pleasant but not as attentive. However, as mentioned before they were busy so no worries. It was a great leisurely meal with friends, one that we'll definitely visit again for. tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

cT7bBqllJyepdg5_wmE4sg.text: Great restaurant great atmosphere service was just perfect! This is the second time we go every time we are in Vegas we stop food is delicious. Would you guys go to Vegas stop by and enjoy their Mexican food. A must go!

3gDJq3EAuRAehirjDOaE8w.text: I love this place ! Great food and really good horchata ! I also love the old Mexican man singing he is so adorable !! I love the Esther sauce the green salsa and everything else pretty much! Never been disappointed here ! Every time I'm here there is a crowd.

_UZWv0gU73QZ-iVKVy-C8g.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurant in town . Always great food and excellent service .

tWAUvXEAilunRokrr97lNg.text: We spent the weekend eating the best of the best on the strip. When we woke up to head home, we were all hungover and all we wanted was some legit Menudo. My dad found this place online and we decided to try it. My family is from Michoacan and the menu looked solid. We started with coffee and it was PERFECT. We each ordered what we wanted and then they came out with complimentary Fedeo! My most favorite comfort food! If I had to choose a last meal, it would be Fedeo and when they brought them out, the whole table perked up and got so excited. It was PERFECT! So they bring out the entrees and we realize that we got used to the smaller portion sizes of the strip and these plates were giant lol. I ordered the chilaquiles with salsa verde and carne asada on top. The waiter asked me if I wanted eggs and I was like "sure why not!?" Then I saw the plate and it was a mountain of food lol! I've never had chilaquiles with carne asada on top and now I can't imagine it any other way! I built every bite with chiliquile, carne, and egg and it was PERFECT! My parents loved the menudo and to top it all off... they passed my only test... PERFECT horchata! It didn't need to be watered down and there was zero pulp! The music is PERFECT. The space is PERFECT! And the staff is even more PERFECT and welcoming! We found our new favorite hangover spot in Vegas! I can't wait to come back!

Y2qnDouGLD6eo7fkT48DbA.text: Delicious authentic Mexican food. Last time we were here I ordered camarones al mijo de ajo very tasteful flavors. Today we got camarones sarandeados and they were finger licking delicious. The sauce is so tasteful we cleaned our plates! Would definitely return next time we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Camarones Sarandeados

59bZ5HPMdO8C-4ovB7w20w.text: I really enjoyed the authentic vibe of this place, the food was delicious, the service was fabulous and the wait was non existent even for a crowded brunch hour.   I would/will be coming back when I'm in Vegas again visiting my family, next time I have to try the drinks.

5vgD98uXJESt9rcwMzhF3w.text: The food and the service here is always amazing. I have lunch here quite often and it's always been a good experience. I always get the Steak Picado or the enchiladas but I tried the Carne Asada Soft Taco today and it was good. Free chips on the first bowl and they have amazing guacamole. When it's someone's Birthday, all the staff come out with tambourine and guitar. You think the Cumpleanos song is over but they repeat it. It's fun and they give you free churros after the song.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mrpGEjQwVwrmllfrBAkBKw.text: Pattern of sadness: BIG Mexican restaurant = BAD tacos. "No rice en beans por jur tacos??"   My eyebrows grimaced at the waiter with a silent OH HELL NO. Whoops, I've become such a taco-snob. "No thanks", I replied more politely. "But can I please get onions, cilantro, and salsa for them?"   At that he half-grimaced back at me with a silent HUH? "Chure, ob course." ...aaand then they forgot the toppings when my tacos came out...   2   S T A R S  * FOUND THE TACO GEM! Never fails -- every place has an unexpected taco-gem. The joy of a Taco Flight is that sweet moment of discovering the stand-out. "JUREKA!" :::: Raja Con Crema Taco -- MEXCELLENT! Slices of poblano peppers and steak bathed in a creamy mushroom sauce, and served in a fresh tortilla. Every bite was moist and delicious!!  :::: Fried Fish Taco -- DECENT. Crispy and fresh. Toppings could have been better, but nonetheless it elicited happiness. :::: Fresh Tortillas -- WOOT! :::: Consomme -- DECENT. Starter soup with tiny noodles.  * BIG, FESTIVE JOINT Bonito Michoacan is the prototypical, fun-for-the-whole-family, Mexican-American restaurant. It's got the hostess in bright, ethnic dress, southwestern colors and faux-adobe walls, mariachis selling songs, a photographer selling photos of the dining parties. No cheesy sombreros, so a little dignity is preserved.  3   M I N U S E S  - TERRIBLE MEATS :::: Carnitas Taco -- MEH! Soo dry! They forgot the toppings. SKIP! :::: Asada Taco -- BLEH! Flavorless beef. Basically inedible. SKIP!! :::: Steak Picado -- TRASH! My buddy's steak was just disgusting. Dry, worst cut of the cow, tasted like meat-cardboard. :::: Rice -- AVERAGE.  - EXPENSIVE!! Dude! $28 for 2 average margaritas?? $18 for a plate of STEAK TRAGEDY??  - DISCRIMINATION? My dining buddy watched the restaurant photographer go from table to table, taking nice pics of the customers and offering to sell them prints. Our table, which featured the only Black man in the restaurant (not me), was ignored. Hmm... The photographer came back a few minutes later and skipped us again. Coulda been nothing, but the double cold-shoulder left a taste in our mouths almost as bad as the Steak Picado.

bfl3R-dj85k64mQ7V-qaEg.text: Best Mexican restaurant In Vegas! my wife and I just came in for the first time we will difently be coming back, great food, and great service, keep up the great work!

LEGqEMvoRxIKPYbmmLZOpA.text: Very good services  Food is really good Highly recommende The tilapia fry fish was amazing  They made tortillas by hand De harina y de maiz

tJajcLQ0lZ9f4PocCfy-Xw.text: Nice authentic feeling environment with a very large menu. I am not sure if i had a bad day but  the service and food were not very good. Tried this restaurant based on Yelp and another persons suggestion. But after eating here it was disappointing. I ate the fajitas and my friend had the Carne asada. Nothing seemed to be very fresh and the vegetables were overcooked. I wasn't expecting to be this disappointed but it really was not what I expected. Overall not great and will not be trying to return anytime soon. Sorry but that is the truth.

OfzaSzRNec2bvN_0c0BQDg.text: Tasty guac, chips, margaritas and chicken mole!!  Service is always quick and friendly!  Great place to dine with friends!

ybq64TXmOaJDrznAcLXOhg.text: Love the ambiance but i think it was the ambiance that made the food taste good.  Food was on the bland side.   I got the steak fajita and i prefer the steak fajita served at Chilis. It was very bland and steak was over cooked. I mean overcooked to well done and i don't believe anybody should eat steak well done.  I will definitely be back for the ambiance and hope that the next dish I order isn't like the fajita.

2nmBEjiIb_nkB6K2zmTPlQ.text: Carnitas, carnitas, carnitas.  I have to give a place props when they make carnitas so tender and yet the meat is not fatty.  I respect that!  Portions are so big, you can easily share this dish with someone else.    The restaurant has a singer, our server was very attentive and upbeat, you get this addictive re-fried bean dip with the appetizer, it's easy to get full before your food comes.  I have yet to try the guac, everyone is talking about it in the yelp reviews.

FuMYImaQK_PTq8nAELNLJg.text: Granted there were two large parties in our area, but service was extremely slow and inattentive. The food was ok, nothing extraordinary, but not bad. We waited 19 minutes after we were visibly done with our meal for our waiter to finally come back by and ask if we were ready, then it took probably another 10 minutes to get our check give him the card and get it back. I went in at 8pm thinking it could be a nice quick dinner and took almost 2 hours for 2 people..just seems ridiculous to me.

AKAGdfA80DOZvulqk0GG_Q.text: The fresh guacamole made at the table was delicious.  I had chicken enchiladas which were huge portion & taste wonderful

IgI2UlL5z3lA_Mr55McIOg.text: Extremely friendly and made me feel like i was at michoacan. I loved it! Food was delicious. We checked in and received a free margarita.  great place if you are looking for great mexican place!

gzGUgcMmmAPeWwn1nxCKZQ.text: Nice people helpful. But the food I ordered was very very bad!!! I ordered some asada tacos, I didn't even eat them. they were full of oil and it didn't taste nor it looked like carne asada. Very disappointing. I have to say their free margarita was very good and their chips with salsa and bean deep was good. But I wouldn't go there just for margaritas and chips with salsa and beans

unEhN7yuah1tk53wrnix0Q.text: Outstanding! Best Mexican food in the Vegas valley. Nora the bartender is fabulous. She is always a joy see. She greets you with a smile and is always happy to see you. She is very knowledgeable on menu and makes the best suggestions on what you would love to eat. Make sure you sit at the bar next time your in and say Hi to Nora for me.  P.S. watch out for the owner. He stands at the end of the bar with a grumpy face and watches you eat...

DduaYkbdfCNcNBqUIYkE1g.text: Came here to celebrate my Dads birthday and we absolutely loved it! The food was great and the service was exceptional! Thank you Bonito Michoacan for making our celebration a little more special there's nothing better than going to a restaurant and getting great service and great food! We will def be back!

eRHKe1IY95pkHQfj3VsGZQ.text: The staff was so friendly and welcoming. We just happened to stumble upon this place(Glad we did). Food was great! I really liked the Mexican feel and the live music: a guy playing a keyboard and singing..not loud so you can still talk and enjoy the atmosphere

fx0TNJ0Q42Ju9vZzlv1PZA.text: Just tried this place tonight. I liked the free margarita that they give you just for checking in on yelp. I ordered chicken enchiladas with green sauce and they were really good. They came with rice and beans. I thought that the service was good, but I didn't get asked if I wanted anything else to drink when my margarita was getting low, but that is okay. My friend ordered the steak in coca-cola sauce which was good. I think if I end up going back here, I may order this dish. I liked the laid-back atmosphere of the restaurant and the prices were good as well.

i75ZR11w0RdIWLNdnp8ZdQ.text: Came here to finish our vegas trip randomly found it on yelp ! Food is so good cant get more authentic . Service js great !! Dont forget to check in for your free margarita!

HJlHRBBM74Q4OaKuOqSD5g.text: The service here is probably the most noteworthy, fun and relaxed- and ultra attentive. Everyone in my group seemed to enjoy their food-   For my Chile verde I substituted Lengua, and it was great. Their Utra Margarita is awesome though! 6 shots in a huge margarita glass you get to take home afterward. I can't belive I got through the whole thing! My fiance tried some of their cocktails which were just- eh, nothing special.  Go for the Tequila Margaritas you GRINGOS!  This is a fun place for classic mexican dishes. Ole!

V24WjgqPl5pnOCBRzOosxA.text: We came here with a Groupon. I was reluctant since I'm just not thrilled with the Michoacan restaurants as a whole. I find the food to be overpriced and ever so bland. But, Boyfriend wanted Mexican food, so off we went!  This location is considerably less crowded than the others. We were seated immediately and had drinks within minutes. We ordered not long after that and were eating quickly. I noticed that the menu items are cheaper than at the other locations (combination meals average $11.99, as opposed to $14). The food was marginally better than other locations, I think.  I would love to go back to this location, though, because the service was phenomenal. Seriously, the best service I've ever had, ever.

-5sn39AiY0fCNw7ZfV3Wtw.text: Cute decor and authentic setting. It seems like they are trying to be an upscale Mexican restaurant but the staff and setting don't agree. We ordered table side guacamole but never got it. Asked to have it removed from the bill and waiter made it out like he was doing us a huge favor to remove it. Food was pretty good, we had steak fajitas and tamales.

dgiRxEqNEnnn0tWNc0ywRA.text: Ok, first time here for us here. We were greeted with fresh chips, salsa, retried bean dip and sopa de Fideo and two Free Margaritas for checking in! After another long day on the Vegas strip we worked up an appetite. I had a large shrimp and octopus cocktail that was pleasantly loaded with shrimp and octopus. The flavor was great! Same with the Asada. Service was very fast efficient and friendly. Really enjoyed this place

ZjMfNDFImNtWcFa-MxHZmQ.text: With a gluten free intolerance, I usually avoid Mexican restaurants, but our group of 6 heard fantastic recommendations for this place, so I went along with a positive mindset and was pleasantly surprised. Our server was not only knowledgeable of gluten, but told me with confidence exactly what menu items were safe. It seems the make all tortillas, chips, etc fresh in their restaurant and possibly the dressings as well.   With a gf peace of mind, I enjoyed a beautiful spinach mango artichoke salad with sliced jicama and raspberry vinaigrette. The best, the BEST salad Ive ever had. That say a lot for a salad!!!  All of the five gentlemen in my group greatly enjoyed their meals as well, from the guacamole made table-side to the fajitas and other authentic dishes. Delicious, delicious food with knowledgeable servers in an authentic and clean environment. Check it out!!!

vOvW2qCNaedUmqylxf77FQ.text: Its really Mexican food in a great ambiance. The service is A1. I had the freshest soup since I live in Vegas. The ingredients were naturals. As many places they alway serve chips with salsa. I would go again.

vgtL_3IR4T-2dN6__HnBUA.text: Delicious chicken fajitas, fresh and tasty shrimp ceviche. Very attentive staff, from the bus boys,expo and server great guys. Bomb fideo soup, reminds me of grandma cooking that .Cannot wait to go back

iNdirqf7P1SQ79mCPaQDwA.text: Everything about this place was amazing!  Food selection and quality, service, bustling vibe, etc. Experience here will be something you never expected from a Mexican restaurant.  Tacos de Camarones (deep fried shrimp tacos) was super tasty.  Parking lot is huge, but it's always packed. You'll see why, on your first visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried shrimp tacos

OkqdtovEkuXO0kzu9syfew.text: We live in SoCal and this is hands down the best Mexican food we've ever had. That's really saying something BCZ we have SO MANY Mexican food options in California. We ordered the crispy chicken tacos and fish tacos and both were the best. I first ordered the chicken mole and it was a little strong for me and the waiter was so helpful to replace it with something I liked. They also served complimentary chips with beans and salsa. Complimentary soup as well. If you check in on Yelp you get a free margarita also! Everything tasted so fresh and very high quality. We will definitely be coming here every time we visit Las Vegas.

uBQ04rzvqqjdviGo2LZUYg.text: Not authentic at all. This restaurant is more for those who know nothing about Mexican food. People who believe chips and salsa is authentic enough. Ordered the carnitas plate and thought they came from a Chinese restaurant. The carnitas looked more like Chinese beef. The rice was dry, the beans were dry.  Id rather eat McDonald's than this place again.

6Wi5Oh8ii_MU2-txPxEGRg.text: I gave up on Mexican places to eat here in Vegas. Even this place at first. But then was reintroduced to this place and it soon became the only place i'd go for Mexican food. Food is always on point here. Fun atmosphere and the best margaritas!!! Love the staff they are awesome and so is their table side guac making skills!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters topped with ceviche

szPcH_tsDXmHiv3-89YsxQ.text: Good place to eat good decor and good food and drink. Chili verde was good Cadillac margarita was good.. Nice service guac made fresh bean dip was good I'll definitely go again when I'm in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream very good
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cadillac margarita 32oz very good
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean dip was good

h9emAo5oMgqu1nkcUa-t8g.text: Found out about this place via Yelp while out in Vegas with my whole family. So happy I did! From the moment we walked in to the time we left, everything was great!!! To start off, the waitress was super attentive and friendly.  We all got the menudo... Yummy! My sister had some type of mango margarita with chamoy that was refreshing and delicious. My dad had a michelada and swore it was one of the best.  It's a bit of a drive from the strip but it's worth it!  We will definitely be going back when on Vegas!

zIgT5EKfKMXpgG5mFXCd8g.text: Not a ton of vegetarian options, but I had their veggie fajitas, and they didn't disappoint.  The service was great, and the place has a nice vibe to it.  The only thing that surprised me was when one of the (typically Strip) photographers approached my friend and I and asked if we wanted pictures.  We're locals, and just friends, so... no thanks.  I thought this locale might've been off the Strip enough to escape that phenomenon, but apparently not.  I'm not irritated by it; actually my friend and I thought it was funny.  Anyway, a solid choice for Mexican food in town; I'm sure I'll be back at some point.

b4I1tHiI3Jsn3auVOB4XYA.text: Walked in and was greeted by friendly faces, assigned a table, drinks brought. I waited for the waiter ... And waited ... Had to get someone to get him. Party of 5 by the way. Finally he shows up, waited for my food ... And waited .... I liked the food wife did not like her's. Finished my Food. Check was brought promptly.  Waited for him to come get the card to ring me up ... And waited ... And waited ... Wife left with two of my three kids .... I still waited ... And waited ... And waited. One of my kids fell asleep cause im still waiting  and waiting .... Still wai.. Zzzzzzz ... Zzzzzz

iM-Vz0J7jC_6C3vIqLFMxg.text: Definitely the best Mexican Food in Vegas.  Their salsa is fresh and delicious.  Ask for the verde if you want to kick it up a notch.  All of their dishes are good, but I have fallen in love with the pollo sarandeado.

WILJOQiU-YXVxcT398rTIQ.text: While I can appreciate restaurants closing for a holiday so the workers can celebrate as well, when your website advertises 'Come spend the 4th with us' and then you post a sign on the door that says your closed for the 4th as it's a holiday, I can't really get behind that.   It's cool and understandable to be closed on that day, but not when your website advertises that you will be open SPECIFICALLY on that holiday....   Normally I like this place, but that was lame.

JreO0XHJ43-cCUgcX_RjBw.text: Very cute little restaurant. Music isn't overly loud. We sat the bar, very clean. 2 female bartenders were very attentive. Checked in on Yelp and got the free 12 oz margarita. The Steak Cilantro was very yummy and the steak was cooked just the way I asked. Guacamole was tasty. Mangoneada we both loved. Chicken fajita    was delicious according to my bf and they weren't greedy with the chicken like some places. Restroom was clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mangoneado.
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Cilantro. Chicken Fajita.

mdRUKVjGCc_lkaxTqFP-ng.text: It's was just ok. It's nothing special. It was very loud, and the service was kinda slow. It's kinda crappy that they charge $3.50 for chips after the 1st tiny bowl. The salsa wasn't very good...

AE2ODxid8t5SZVf7Fx8xHg.text: I've been to many different locations from Viva Zapatas to the Michoacana the food here has always been good for me and I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants to have that authentic Mexican food taste service is amazing and the atmosphere is extremely relaxing they have live music and they give free soup tortilla chips salsa and beans I give this place 5 stars because I've been coming here for years and every time they live up to them stars so if you're out looking for a good authentic Mexican place to eat choose this place
