C97BWG6hGS_5uec4vVqfpg.text: Alright. I'm not a fan of the buying more salsa deal. But I get why they do it. Nothing extraordinary.

JvPMTJvPsyBb9twRBlZ8sQ.text: Food is fabulous as always but the day I decide to bring my family the service was real slow. While others were getting served right away.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cgIyyMXWsTvMa8y2GDI0tQ.text: Great authentic Mexican food!! Hands down! Each dish that was ordered was full of flavor! Margaritas were huge and with just the right amount of kick to it! Will definitely be going mask there love the atmosphere  decor & lighting

sNjLTVYB-0Ns6eO6RJHWFw.text: The restaurant is nice & clean service is good chips & salsas were good and overall the food was good.  Comparing this place to Lindo Michoacan it falls short.  I don't think I would go back.

adlkQ6FNfJ_oQVv7zOiJUg.text: We love this place it's a must whenever we are in Vegas! Good food great service, Julio was awesome!! My kids love the bean dip they give with the chips and salsa.

-bDWY2lUp1C44w88qN0zHw.text: i been coming to these restaurants since 2003,Bonito,Lindo and all the others...service is always been great,better than great food in the other hand not so much...and i understand since i eat out at least 3 to 4 times at week not everytime food will taste the same,but today i order Birria and it really let me down,the stew had no flavor at all amd the meat wasnt any better,tasteless both of them,really desappointed of that dish....the hand made flour tortillas were so good that made the experience not so bad,but ill stay away from Bonito for a while...hope next time i venture there i can get a better tasting Birria

TN-ackew-vhrdJjtAo4j6A.text: Carnitas are 2nd to none!!!!!!!! I love this place! My family is from Michoacan and this place capitalized on it's origin! Love love love!

FJOiyOrIfeuSxkPaTM19bw.text: Well, I think I know why their other location closed down...  We had very bad customer service this time around. We have been to the other location that got closed down (Viva Michoacan in Henderson). It took forever for them to take our order, the waiter forgot about my guacamole & sour cream, they forgot to refill my boyfriend's soda and my friend pronounced the very long Spanish word that supposedly earned him a free margarita...which they never brought.  Yes, I'm Mexican so let me say that the food is mediocre. I think you'd had better luck going to Pepe's Tacos down the street. The beans needed salt and. I felt that they were like Rosarito beans that you get from a can and just heat up. I don't understand why all their burritos are smothered in sauce and cheese. that's more of a enchilada...and if I wanted an enchilada I'd order one. A burrito is meant to be eaten with hands, not with a fork.

IX4Q4EyIusP-dck0zrb6Sg.text: Had lunch here yesterday before heading back to LA. Ordered camarones a la diabla. Service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My goddaughter and I

w1zcyVaiqkSDBm7xn0p_8g.text: If you are looking for authentic Mexican Food that is as good as it gets then you have come to the right place!  I'm pretty sure that someone's grandmother is cooking in the kitchen, it's that good!  What I like most about the menu is the variety of home cooking dishes that you don't find on the menu in other restaurants. The fish and shrimp dishes are great. Yes, we order the specialty dishes rather than run of the mill ordinary dishes. My wife and I have been eating here for 15 years and the food has been consistently good.  The staff are courteous, gracious and very efficient.

zKjo3_2brp62scqKVStUxw.text: Always good food, and the service is always spot on. Great guacamole made at the table. We have become regulars at this restaurant.

-ct-2iPTbs2WLEhI_mbUug.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch and the service was amazing.Their soup is so tasty and the food is just as good. I will for sure recommend this place for a great Traditional Mexican Meal.Ill be frequenting this stop more often.

7PCyY8rbZ1yLN0V7CjXhGQ.text: If you are in Las Vegas please come to this mexican restaurant it is the best. Great service and wonderful tasting food at its finest. The best service I have had here were from Nacho and Gabriel. Gracias chicos son de lo mejor, cada vez que venga ha las vegas vendre visitarlos

wANgN-xn2bDrkU85zRUQuQ.text: The menu is amazing. I can't wait to come back so I can try everything. I had the ceviche and fish taco. Everything was delicious! Great service too!

vncTy1O2Ww7PJgbWt8ApFw.text: Love the Margachela (margarita) and their service! Look for Julio (attendant) and Jose (food server) you will love your time there and the cozy atmosphere and the very cultural ambience and wood carved, painted chairs and tables. Lovely tine and friendly people!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2XSDRzB37RS1RHknD50nmA.text: Came here again and as per usual, the food is great and so was service. Unfortunately our eyes are bigger than our stomachs so we didnt manage to finish our meals. If we had a fridge and microwave in our hotel we would have taken home the leftovers. The tableside guac is a nice touch and made to your tastes.

PwckY23mDUM4TN8wafxLtQ.text: Came to Vegas and was a bit tired of the overpriced Vegas Strip food. I love coming to this place when I visit from LA. I highly recommend it!

sa_phH67zTuQzYP5EWQvmA.text: Absolutely the best Mexican food in Las Vegas!  We always stop here when we are in town and it never disappoints!  Juan has hot to be one of the waiters I've ever had.  Upbeat and fun!  Great food!  All around great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great for birthdays!

BYiKpCWJ8PpUz5VxATI08A.text: This place can get busy during weekends, so don't think they'll treat you any better when you come on a weekday. It's just as bad or even worse. My family and I came on a Thursday for my father's birthday. This place was not any where near busy. To start off we called ahead letting them know we had a party of six. Come to find out they had given away our table to someone else because they weren't sure which reservation was which. The ladies at the counter went back and forth about when they should seat us, and eventually did. We let them know we had a birthday there at the counter, and they said "let the waiter know". We sat down and discreetly let our waiter know about the birthday. We ordered our food and I for sure made it known that I didn't want any sort of pico de gallo on my dish (#6 on the menu). They still put it on there which made my dish worse than what it already tasted. Ordered two beers that took the waiter an extremely long time to get to the table. Had to ask another family member for a sip out of their own drink because of this. The food took a very long time to come out and no one enjoyed their food due to the plain taste it all had. The only thing that was enjoyable was the tiny fideo soup. We sat there twiddling our thumbs after everyone was finished eating waiting to see when they were going to come sing happy birthday (the only reason why we even chose to come here). We had to go let them know we were ready for it and no one came. Mind you there was nothing else to do besides sit there and wait awkwardly for them. We waited as long as we could. Noticed none of them were getting together for it.  Ended up getting up and walking to pay for our food and that's when they embarrassingly came up to us and said they were NOW ready. We let them, and it was extremely unpleasant and way more than just awkward. We were all already done with the whole experience. I will never bring one of my loved ones here for any sort of special occasion, or even for dinner alone and I will highly encourage anyone else to do the same!

PiUqaK4FUQ4hxyE6lYG_lQ.text: Carne Asada plate was excellent. The meat was cooked well. Nice and tender. If and when you are in town check this spot out. Service was excellent and Jenny at the bar was very conversational.

EEE6EDtWhxT_ZMUIkjxOYg.text: These guys have spent hours cooking and delivering free food to all the hospitals around town since the terrible mass shooting. It's a great representation of the heart of this family. Awesome to know they care and freely give to their city. Thanks bonito Michoacan !

W89_Aiqk4v08tYtMh4dwmA.text: The service is top-notch and as far as Mexican restaurants go this is one of the better spots in Vegas. The decor is bright and fun with a cheerful atmosphere.   They have an extensive menu with a nice selection of seafood. I've tried the orange roughy and the camarones a la diabla but my go-to is the red snapper. It's a whole fish served fried or in garlic sauce with rice, salad and french fires. You can sub for beans or veggies. I usually do, it just doesn't feel like fries are the best option for this meal.  The guac is good and they serve a habanero salsa with a nice kick. It's not the standard salsa that comes to the table with the chips and bean dip, but if you request it they are happy to comply. There are no taps at the bar and the bottle selection is limited. The beer is not the main attraction at this bar, it's all about the margarita.

CyJR2GHMA4mtW5a_8bYeEQ.text: OMG I'm in LOVE with this place. I grew up and lived in this area and have been going to Bonito Michoacan for years. It's the best mexican restaurant that I know of in Las Vegas. I always start off with thethe part. Their steak pacado is my #1 dish!!   I love this place so much that everytime my husband asks me where we want to go on my birthday I choose Bonito! MMM! 5 stars all the way!

8EQxj9Sm4Bizx2ggv04ltQ.text: Slow service.....food was good, but waited 30 min to get check AFTER credit card slip was signed. Then found waitress having a lunch break when I went to ask what was taking so long.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aftermath...

7lbbeFgEeT4SWCHbBKVfOg.text: Can't give lower or I would...1:00 lunch on Saturday...crowded, with a couple of big parties of 10+...My wife and I getting a couple of burritos, maybe $18.00 w/$4.00 tip...got the chips and dips, with soup to start...and that was it...chips gone, soup gone and an hour later, we were gone...nobody came to our table for an hour...our waiter was next to us, behind us, but never said a word about where our burritos were...no refills, no water, nothing...at least the gal taking pictures didn't stop and try to get us buy pictures for $10 a piece...pretty intrusive....stay away unless you want to get free chips, dips and soup and then eat your entree somewhere else

XSK3ss7wEG0KXdjvvuaNbw.text: The margaritas are good.... not too sweet, but not trying to drown the sweetness with too much liquor. The food took a little long, but they were busy for a Monday I thought. Once the food came out, it was easily worth the wait. I had the mojara which is a pretty traditional dish that is replicated a lot in Mexican restaurants, but is a hit or miss. It was crunchy on the outside, moist in the inside. The waitress was friendly and efficient. This location is a gem outside of the strip and I would highly recommend it.

NWquDkFMql_Cl_077557nA.text: Nice atmosphere and great service.  They had live music for Mother's Day which added to the experience.  Even though the restaurant was very busy, all the staff seemed to be in a great mood.  I came here expecting a great experience all together, but I can't say I did and it's only because of the fish I got.  The drink I got was a bit strong as well, but I'm not one to complain about that!  I do hope to return and give this place a second chance because I do like the Michoacan in Centennial Hills.  Just don't get the garlic fish.

OkIrCvXlmV6M-g7WnTLnGw.text: Wow! What have I been waiting for?!?? I've driven by this place like 3000 times and never had the urge to stop.  My wife finally talked me into it and now I'm mad that I've never gone before.    We got the chips and salsa, jalapenos w/beef, ground beef burrito and the grilled chicken breast with vegetables.   The food was all great and so was the service.  The have a great menu with reasonable prices.

Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_-zcuw8_fM6gMcgyOzWU2g.text: Really good Mexican food and great service Much better than Ricardo's which is down the Street

5go-uHgL-QDYyHuGXpjqkQ.text: Best decision to eat here! Food was amazing. Staff was great! Get the fresh made guacamole!

yrKMQK6N9Ix8u4O5pq7oUA.text: I love this place! The ceviche oysters are lit!!!  I get them every time, and everyone I bring here loves this place! The fried fish, grilled chicken with garlic sauce and the service are all amazing! They do fun stuff for your birthday too. Eat here!!

gf1NW8Hrij-QOtxrD-Me3A.text: Food is sub par and over priced. I went for my birthday which apparently was every one else's birthday too because they sang to at least 15 people while we were there. When my friend told them it was MY birthday they asked which dessert we wanted, they brought it, didn't sing and then charged us for it. I didn't care that they didn't sing but when my friend paid for my food (and dessert) the man was surprised it was ACTUALLY my birthday...and still charged for the dessert. My first and last time going. Food isn't worth the money and it was overall not a good experience.

pF4i4Muo1oXHYcfbo2uadQ.text: Loved the carne asada plate here!!!! Its a little pricey but everything was delicious here. Their mariscos are amazing too!! For some reason, Vegas has the best Mexican food..hands down. I'm from LA and I still havent found a restaurant that comes close to this place.  Their drinks are also yummy!! We had a chamango type of drink...cant remember the name of it but if you see it, get it. We enjoyed the Mexican candy submerged in the drink too lol.   Give it a shot, its really delicious food.

tfM0QYMkgXKZ59DcaexngQ.text: Wonderful service and most importantly, delicious  food! The cuisine is authentically Mexican and have gourmet flavors and presentation. I will definitely come back - Patty makes the best margaritas!

NVzZfkFksBE34rQmZo6Lrg.text: First time and won't be our last time! My fiance and I just moved to the area and were craving authentic Mexican food. Love this place! The food is amaaaazing and their drinks are a must try! Most definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink for 2 + house margarita

z_BVQa6i8rM7mRsfpRa4bw.text: Brought my dad and his wife to eat here and they loved it! I've been a local for 5 years and my family is from LA. So if you can impress my family from LA on good Mexican food, YOU'VE WON!! Great atmosphere with live music, love authentic vibe and EXCELLENT customer service!! Amazing prices and the food is INCREDIBLE. MUCHAS GRACIAS!

oqJcabBOZdha7hNnxMTs3g.text: I eat a lot of chille rellenos. Just prefacing with that here because, holy crap, this place made the best chille relleno I have ever had.  I have no complaints about anything else either. The chips come with fantastic salsa and bean dip. Margaritas are strong. Tortillas are good.  This place met all my expectations for good Mexican and then some.

oZGXh2wnr2rDV-M_DuPlfQ.text: I used to come here often with my family back in 2007.   Fast forward to 2019, me and my girlfriend are craving some margaritas and Mexican beer, why not just eat Mexican food as well.  I did not like my food at all. Must say, Lindo Michoacan is a tad better. I had a steak dish that wasn't nothing great, and my girlfriend had shrimp in a paprika cream sauce.   It's a place I don't expect to ever return to sadly. Must say the cilantro margarita was refreshing but it's actually listed as a Jalapeno Cilantro margarita and I didn't pick up the pepper tone.  Just lacking sazon (Spanish for flavor). You get more great flavors at Lindo Michoacan and my favorite Mexican joint, Flaming Fajitas. Hope you have a much better experience then ours.

qnutxSReO5RwOyYTpIzc4w.text: Food was amazing, service was good. We recommend this place for authentic Mexican cuisine.

3SeaQPSmoX3Fi4pVvrLbeQ.text: I love this place so much I try to go every Tuesday and enjoy some carne asada her tacos at the bar with the best Cuban bartender. The food is delicious and I enjoy the ambience.

-HoesjiKnY0QG49zwF_rOw.text: Great service ask for Lilly. Great food. Great service . Great customer service. Food is great

KhnnHjMt_whURaDG2INs1g.text: F**** Lindo Michoacan..... Bonito Michoacan is the real spot!!!!  This is the best authentic food in all Las Vegas

yjlMda1wAW6zjd7hBuyvlw.text: To start my review, I ate too much.  I am Mexican and cook a lot of authentic Mexican food.  After being in Vegas for few days, my boyfriend was craving Mexican.  Free refills on horchata was a bonus for him.  Fideo as a starter was a bonus for me and a first.  Delicious.  We decided on a combination plate because quite frankly we couldn't decide.  I had to special order and the waiter was happy to oblige.  Poblano chile relleno was the standard and just fine.  Mole enchilada was spicy just how I like it and the beef lengua was cooked to perfection.  That was my taco choice.  The flour tortillas were just like the ones you get in Mexico and I we ate them all.    The place was packed with several large parties which tells me it's a local favorite.  The service was great.  Everyone was so courteous and friendly.  A must visit when in Vegas.

P1oY-ielUeOW_UifdYvQNA.text: First of all I am giving the customer service a 10 Star rating. Food is always the best.  There were more than 25 of us on a family reunion and the servers went above and beyond to accommodate our family. Everything was perfect. They took care of each and everyone of us like 'Gold'. The service was impeccable. Yes we were a big bunch of fun loving ladies and we felt completely happy with the service. The service was awesome! We even had a pretty young girl who photographed us for our big group, and Im pretty sure we all bought the group photo that was offered to us at the end of the night for $10(good deal).   Two of the cousins had a birthday, and the staff came out in full form with a band, hats(for the birthday girls) and shots for them both!!!   Yes, this is Vegas! But, not many local establishments go out of their way to make everyone so comfortable and happy!  The food is amazing, I will not comment on 25 meals that were ordered, but I know everyone loved the food.  Thank you for being a place to dine that cares and looks after all needs of the customer! We all appreciate!   See you soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mucho margaritas!

fCL5Vbx_TgYziVPjnI5A4A.text: Great place - off the strip. Loved the refried beans and salsa appetizer- very authentic. Fideo soup is realllly good! Very reasonably priced. The combo dinner taco/burrito was awesome! The margaritas were AMAZING!

wsg4r9Aw16Fv59JpW_4Iyw.text: Came here for Cinco de Mayo, so it was pretty crowded. Parking can be a bit of an issue, but I was lucky enough to get a good spot. It took a little while to be seated, but I figured it was because of the holiday.   I ordered the Carnitas Michoacan, which was delicious! The pork was very tender and had great flavor. The beans seemed average, the rice was good, and the hand made tortillas were also good. I had the Tamarindo Margarita and the Mango Margarita. Both were very good! Our server, Violeta was awesome! She did great managing our large group, and all of her other tables. She was friendly, funny, and flirty, while getting all of our orders correct. I'm sure I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamarindo Margarita.
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Michoacan. Delicious!

gMByo3pXTR_zaaN7FTQhnQ.text: Came here for Happy Hour with the girls. We ordered a small Margarita which by the time it got the table we realized small was still very big!! We just knew this happy hour was going to be a success. The Mango Margarita is amazing and Israel was very nice and gave us great service. Will definitely be returning soon! Love finding new spots

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos with Pico  ..
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Margarita

06zbb8Ivp95caMT3lQ3IAA.text: The food and atmosphere is great. It gives you that authentic feel. This isn't my first time here and I came back because I like the food, however our server was meh. I had to ask for everything from other people and he didn't come to check up on us much. I still gave a decent tip, not exactly twenty percent. Lol. (I got to the restaurant before it was busy) Four stars for the food. Two and half for the server.

n1xAVhDzLZBQ_AnFTDzZGw.text: I travel to Vegas a lot on business.  This is the one place where I think the food and the experience is a good or better than I can find in San Diego.  Its fun to go to the restaurant or the bar and have a nice marg with a big plate of mexican food. I like the mole and the parangaricutarimiquaro (comes with a free mini-marg if for any norteno who can say it).

EX8F6UDGxxlP3YNcPWYK2Q.text: Saw this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. Let me say everything from the service to the food was excellent. I got the queso fundido w/ mixed fajitas for two. Oh and the micheladas hit the spot for sure! RICHARD thanks for the great service.

s2GguaEtnC6TeBfU7rVpoQ.text: Amazing service and great food!!! Personally loved the Guava blended margarita with the shrimp enchiladas.

ZtZEMoEne4kO1FtCjM5n3Q.text: This place was SOOOO good! I highly recommend it! Camarones Rancheros was excellent! My Michi was perfect and my Service was OUTSTANDING. Thank you to our server Jonathan.

n6t1bBhREvudbt9_HvsZ8g.text: The food in general is pretty great, but the home made flour tortillas!!! Oh my goodness. I'd come back for those alone. Great service and atmosphere.

pa5cI0SjB0JhJ0LtdUmSOQ.text: Fantastic authentic meal - great atmosphere. Had the "doctor" chicken - with prunes. Will get again!

E6VxWuZl-MizvVdPV3kfXA.text: This place never disappoints.  Food was excellent, the margaritas were great and service was very good considering the restaurant was full.  Always a good experience.

Eljf7Rz7Aeqq9xOZ6f0itw.text: I have been to a few of the Michoacan restaurants before. I feel it is safe to say Bonita Michoacan is my favorite.   I came here with my family last weekend while they were visiting from out of town. They were told of Bonita Michoacan by a waiter they met at an IHOP who also works here also.  We were seated quickly upon arrival even though it was a Friday evening and we were a party of five in this busy restaurant. We did not have to wait long before chips and salsa were brought out. Then we were also brought the sopa de fideo as is customary at the Michoacan restaurants. As were were looking over the menu and munching on chips, we saw another table which had ordered the fresh guacamole. We thought it looked good and ordered it too. I'm glad we did. It was chunky, creamy, fresh and just the right level of spicy. That was a nice way to start our meal.  For my entree I ordered pollo al cognac. One bite and it quickly became my favorite chicken dish any where. The plate was huge as was the chicken breast though I could not really see the latter. It was a large breast grilled to perfection while maintaining tenderness then smothered in a sour cream sauce with mushrooms, onions and a touch of cognac. I am a sucker for sour cream and mushrooms so this was just awesome. I would go back and order that again for sure.  There are only a few small things I take issue with at Bonita Michoacan. They are the margaritas, the salsa, and the sopa. At least on this occasion. I ordered a house margarita and that is exactly what I got. My issue with it is that it taste like a premixed syrup like the ready made stuff in the grocery stores. It is very sweet and I don't care for that. The salsa was Ok. It had good spice but then there was a bitter after taste. Possibly from dried chilies being used. And finally the sopa was kind of salty. I realize it is soup and soup is salty. This was just a bit much for a couple of us in my party. Aside from those things that I'm just nagging about, this was a primo spot for dinner and we were all glad we tried it out.

4GC7SdLjVFq9Cl2zx8Ma-A.text: Been enjoying this place for years!  I am not sure if i should review today's experience or combine my overall opinion.  Today there was a VERY long wait for our food.  This is not typical so I am not going to give less than 4 stars.

hWjlx4FjIlB7OziBkbqElg.text: The service at this place was phenomenal. Despite being packed for a Friday night dinner rush, we had our food and drinks in under 10 minutes. Our server was kind and attentive, and went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. The menu is packed full of great choices, and the food was fantastic. Easily one of our favorite dining experiences in Vegas.

VVVW1JdtXgw5VccMe9aA7A.text: Made reservations for my daughter here for her 21st Bday while we were here in Vegas...she wanted Mexican food and based on all the reviews this place looked like a great pick. Drove in and the barely found a parking spot so for me was a good sign for also a good pick as well...dropped the ladies off at the front door and parked the car.   After checking in with my wife things didn't look so positive...they didn't have our table ready which was very frustrating! I gave them hours notice which in my opinion is totally their fault. I will say the staff was  very friendly and very apologetic about the situation. The managers even came out and bought our whole group a round of drinks and brought the kids lemeonades. Finally after a 25 minute wait we did get seated, but again the manager came over and gave us free table side guacamole and again apologized.  At this point no one remembers the wait my daughters could care less and everyone was having a good time. Our waiter Richard made my daughter feel really special and did an awesome job with her birthday. The food here was really good and everyone really enjoyed the atmosphere...would love to come back and enjoy this place again on a trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow the political agenda everywhere!

R-dSvlPx9JqFlcXmkWvAsQ.text: The food here is very good. Coming from California, I know good Mexican food. The food here is authentic and tasty. I ordered guacamole and they made it right in front of me. The food was amazing and needless to say, I have been back numerous times to date. I will continue to frequent this palace as the customer service is superb.

gZ5MfZJoVMfnkliYuQbz0Q.text: Very pleased with quality and quantity, with variety and authenticity. Good service while letting our large party mingle and talk at my husband's 80th birthday party. Alberto gave us all required care, full explanations of preparation and ingredients and helped me plan for guests from 1 year of age to 80. We'll visit again.

JCJ8leLuub4OZkgcjXmUXg.text: I love it!!!! Very Mexican.  Tortillas made by hand  The drinks are great  And the food is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ycW3kB_-c903yHakPXcUIg.text: Was in Vegas for a friend's birthday weekend and looking for a place to go eat brunch/lunch at and one of our friends mentioned Bonito Michoacan, we all thought it sounded great so off we went!  When I got there, I check in on my handy dandy Yelp App and guess what! Just checking in I scored a free margarita, how sweet is that!  But they also had a little text promo too that gave you a free margarita as well, so the table of 12 was already set with free margarita haha.  They start you off with homemade chips, bean dip & salsa, the bean dig is great, mix it with the salsa and it becomes amazing!  Just take note, 1st round of homemade chips, bean dip & salsa are complementary, additional orders are 2.99, but we were a party of 12 and there was plenty.  After checking out the menu I went with Zitacuaro - 2 enchiladas in a Verde sauce, I picked chicken for my meat, and I have to say these enchiladas were great, the corn tortilla I believe was homemade, it was perfectly cooked, the chicken was shredded and it was moist and very good tasting, however they season/marinade the chicken was delish! The Verde sauce was delish too! One of the best I have had, full of flavor and the perfect texture. These were some great enchiladas.  Service was great and friendly, glad to have found this lil gem in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vKLF7309DSPHVKyGW0RuFA.text: Met friends here for dinner. The food was good, though the waiter got one of the orders wrong. It was another friend's birthday and they sang while she wore a sombrero and they gave her a shot of tequila and churros. It was fun.

cCPo36GFvt3QcpHr_blFZg.text: Been here so many times while on vacay.  Best Mexican vibe for a non mexican city and superb food.  Always leave feeling like i am pregnant with a mexican child after eating too much as its so good!

Z9GzC7-EUPzgNR_g8cHTBw.text: I enjoyed this restaurant a lot.  Everything from the atmosphere, the friendliness of the staff, to the food and drinks.  The maragritas were delicious and so were the tacos and enchiladas. I highly recommend eating here.

UmpN081gFNIW9LbPfIurDQ.text: They have one of the best happy hour menu that includes food and drinks!! Love this place!!

-aySWR2kcL721RLZMxbflQ.text: I love this place.  Food is good...i often fill up on chips/dip before gets there, though.  Wait staff is good...busboys really take good care of you. They often have  live musician (i guess busier times?) which is fun and creates a great ambiance.

SgJXhkFngJB4PzfdhZsvqg.text: Not sold on Bonito Michoacan.  Food was mediocre.  Guacamole was wonderful- avocados freshly cut in front of us.  Sangria tasted like cheap box wine with lemons.  Shrimp enchiladas were good.  Would stray away from this place but wouldn't suggest it. Maybe better for takeout...

cIFrw-B0hpYdQdo3zU0tdw.text: Excellent menu of traditional Mexican cuisine.  We had a group of 12, everybody ordered something different.  Everything was great.  The staff was friendly, the service prompt.  I had the carnitas, they were moist and flavorful.  This place is off the strip but not too far.  I would highly recommend it.  We come here every time we visit Vegas.

BtnjWhA600xa08uLCoJxrw.text: Pretty good place... just not into the clown decor there.   One remarkable thing is that their hand made tortillas are AMAZING!!! Especially, the flour ones... mmm mmm mmm... make sure you work out before you eat there because you will gain a good amount there.

ns9rQRynh1E2-B7r8DftNA.text: This was me and my husbands favorite Mexican restaurant, until one day...I ordered a steak with cognac, I always order this every time we eat here, but that time they over cooked my steak...or should I say they burn my steak. I didn't noticed it because it was covered with sauce. When I sliced it that's how I noticed my steak was burn and the sauce taste burned! I called my server and told them what happened. They took my plate and When they returned it they gave me the same steak! It seems like they just washed it!!! How do I know? Because I know how it looks like and where I cut my steak! Grosssss....!!! I paid in full didn't eat the food that they gave me. Since then never go back to that place again!

6WcciMFHqNdsMDY59U7MRQ.text: Superb Mexican food.  Although we had to take a cab there and we wanted to stop at the market before returning to our condo, the drove us to the market.  They did say that the sometime pickup and return customers to the strip, but not sure of details.

8MtkQk4mGBX-Ed5R-RTF6Q.text: It took more than 45 minutes to get our food. When it finally arrived, 3 of our 4 meals were cold. No dishes were amazing - disappointing considering the higher than average price.

mSIo4rm68tXPbz-nmijN6Q.text: This place is great! One of my best places to go, the Steak Cilantro is my fav. All the waiters are nice and they never leave your drinks empty. They always offer us tortillas to take home and they serve you Fidelo Soup before your meal..  YUM.

r0rz4SC72zumoDJeIb9FTQ.text: One of my favorite vegas places. Giant margaritas, crazy clown decorations, live music, wacky servers. If you are looking for fancy Mexican food this is not the place for you. I always bring out of town guests here for food and fun. Once the server got up on the booth behind us and danced as he made guacamole ha! The food is good and the menu has lots of choices so you are sure to find something you like. Even though its casual the service is always great. Refill waters BOOM, refill chips BOOM. Birthdays are hilarious, they come out and sing to you and put a sombrero on you haha. It's fun and funky familiar Mexican fair.

63G1P4yq5QSmLQxOa2GwRA.text: Wonderfully authentic Mexican food! The best server is Richard, go in and ask for him. He is very knowledgeable, funny, enthusiastic and makes your dining experience even better. Nice live music, great family feel. The food is delicious, you will be coming back!

Ublyg8lJH7qnTHUohqO7_A.text: I'm not going to claim "I know REAL Mexican" - who's to decide what is?What I will say is this is my favorite Mexican restaurant. They have one of the best Moles I've had.  Recommend the Pollo sarandeado Tia Esther and the buckwheat noodle soup.

5H7UxnDST9kOnTcDLyZkqA.text: I got sick after eating here!!!!!! Horrible stomach pains!! Do not waste your time or money on this place. Worst enchilada I've had in my life and their "steak" was low grade beef I wouldn't feed my dog. The place was packed and had great reviews so I was shocked when my food arrived. So disappointed and will never step foot in that place again.

rxRSoeBTjsqiAZLjwcHVFw.text: I am seriously torn.  When it come to Chinese and Mexican food, I think there is a fine line between value, and rip off.  I mean if I'm eating a perfectly delicious taco for $3, how much better will it get for 6-8x the price.  I understand that at a restaurant there are other amenities, advantages, and portions are bigger, but on flavor and experience alone, is the mark up really worth it?  This place serves delicious Mexican food.  I have no complaints, service was professional, and friendly.  There is nothing wrong with this establishment.  I just feel that I would hit up one of my favorite no frills taco joints before returning here.

Ir70COLFKQ4NN84-u80wTg.text: Awesome!  Had their steak cognac and it was killer.  Great service too.

QpVpwYgik1fgpCX70KQsMg.text: had my 36th birthday here with a party of about 10. They were very accomodating and the food was excellent.  It is not cheap but the everything was very well cooked and about half our party were natives of Michoacan so they are very very fussy about their Mexican food.  Everyone loved it. My 3 old loved the clown motif although that may not be for everyone.  The margaritas were sassy!  Great job :)

tEQIujPVvzYJA1zko_LdRQ.text: Went to dinner here last night for my birthday. We had previously eaten here in May, 2013. That time we enjoyed the meal very much and planned on going back again for a special occasion. This time in no way resembled the previous experience. I had the # 1 combination of chile rellenos, chicken enchilada, and a beef taco. The rellenos was covered in some generic tomato sauce and was bland tasting. The cheese was very stringy and tasteless. The enchilada was so-so and the beef taco was almost Inedible. Beef was dry and the taco shell was hard as a rock. My date had a green chile burrito that had big chunks of pork instead of shredded, the chicken taco also had big chunks of chicken instead of shredded, and her cheese enchilada was basically a tortilla rolled up with sauce and cheese on top. She didn't care for any of it. She also ordered sopapillas to be served with our meal, and they showed up 15 minutes after the entree. When we asked where they were the waitress said they were "cooking them fresh".The bean dip was also bland and the chips were stale. Being a Specialty Room Chef in Las Vegas for over 20 years, I know good food. My hunch is that management has sourced cheaper product to cut cost and the quality dropped immensely, or the kitchen staff totally changed and doesn't produce the same quality as the staff from last year's visit. Lastly the table in our booth wobbled and we felt like we were sitting way to low, with the table height up to chest level because of the worn out seating. Also the music could drop a few decibels. It's not a nightclub. Needless to say I would never go back. Chipotle or even Taco Bell would be a preferred dining choice.

IhrsoyuPt0IOfTrCaOEMrA.text: Atmosphere is Very pleasant, the service is very good. Menudo homemade and is very tasty, enchiladas are all very good, the bean dip is tasty with the salsa which is brought to every table. The avocado dip know as guacamole is very tasty but very high in calories. The cactus appetizer is very yummy served with either homemade flour or corn tortillas.  We first learn of this location on Cico De Mayo and have been back several times. One thing I must insist that you do not order are the tacos unless you want to become very disappointed like I did after ordering myself and my date at lunch a la carte two tacos and tostada de ceviche. Only the tacos were very small and fried with maybe a tablespoon and half of chicken and cheese combined and served over shredded lettuce.  These taco's looked like something you would generally avoid at Jack In-Box.

dRa-YnWesmvvdsiLbroofA.text: real chips, real bean dip, real mexican food!  I love this place.  The waitor is hilarious and the live entertainment is so fun!  I love coming here and I love the food!  They have great coupons and always honor them!  The lunch special is a great deal as well!

3101JEbDU9lcrAiSg-gm2g.text: I just moved here 21 days ago from California, I had ask the movers where is a good place to eat Mexican food he told me to try Bonito Michoacan, so after a long day of unpacking and cleaning we went  to have dinner I ordered the Chile Verde was not impressed with this dish, but the beans they serve with the chips and salsa got me coming back 4 times already.  can't wait to take my family and friend there when they come to visit.

Ao1AzqhxaSeIDBzAcyEtlg.text: Hostess and Server were awesome, gave suggestions and the Cilantro steak was so delicious! We asked him to customize and it was perfectly cooked and amazing. Best place for real Mexican food!

ksGmvmCQ45aCql1r1FtvrQ.text: I love this place I come here often and they never disappoint me  food is always fresh and yummy I get the same thing every time lol

1juxAGPh269KnWwN6uO0lg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after work and LOVED it!!!  I think our waiter name was "Israel" and he was so so helpful, funny, and courteous. Not only did we get free seconds on the bean dip and salsa, we got free soup too! He also hooked my boyfriend up with a flavored margarita instead of the regular house kind. They also helped me with certain Spanish words and answered all of my annoying questions! Lol! We even got our picture taken and printed on a free coupon!   The food was excellent! No complaints what so ever!   The restroom cleanliness was about a 4 out of 5.

mJBdrcLI5LQTiPa7jtMhKA.text: Exactly what I was looking for and more.   A family friendly, sit-down establishment with a fun and welcoming atmosphere with live music, house made tortilla chips, fresh guacamole made at the table, attractive and tasty dishes, with an extensive beer and cocktail menu.   Perfect for parties and one-on-ones alike. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be sure to have a meal here.

U1_0NLwMNRaVyEjMOFH1xw.text: Service is always great and the food portions are very large! As an appetizer, I strongly recommend the live guacamole. It is made right at the table, with all your favorite ingredients! Can't go wrong with any items on the menu and their oysters, margaritas, and ensalada marinera are wonderful!

RVwIpaLAv4pJLOQEbs3nfQ.text: I had Huevos Rancheros. They were good. Th staff was courteous, efficient and very friendly. I enjoyed my meal. The restaurant was.clean and nice

2oo-KxMsYcNBgTDAhd5jZA.text: Bonito Michoacan -  Consistent excellent service, food, and affordable selections. (I'm getting hungry just thinking about your menu) So this is what we are experiencing. We like to take our visiting guest out to a nice dinner (affordable). Throughout the years that we have been taking our guest to your restaurant, you have never let us down.  So now, we have created clientele for you driving in from the Bay Area, California wanting to dine at your restaurant.  We will see you soon as our California family member wishes to celebrate her 17th birthday at your restaurant.  Thank you for all the great food, awesome service, and the smiles you bring to my family.

TL1rqFlw73DqHVO_F8Dekw.text: This place has an authentic mexican vibe to it. Great ambiance and the best service I've had in any restaurant in a while. The waiter and bussers are super attentive and friendly. You can tell they all care about making your experience memorable. Great food, drinks, and live music on the weekends. Great place to have a birthday dinner!

1K-wDhic9B_F6fxsAb3jgQ.text: I've been here several times. It's really hit & miss on food and service. The bar and live music can be fun. Steak is decent. Combos I avoid. Servers can be forgetful on drinks and other stuff.

CfFeDkU-G2TaDreeZyxKzw.text: 5 stars for authentic, delicious, traditional Mexican food!! The service was good, but the food was impressive!! The only hard part about coming here is deciding what the heck to order. I ordered the steak with cilantro and I am still dreaming about it 2 days later. It was tender and perfectly cooked. The drinks are great too, the mangoniada is a must try and the micheladas are amazing. This place is also really nice Inside and out, beautifully decorated!! This is a must in Vegas!!

f4md14JZOfL3wFcQRZ-MnA.text: The food was very delicious and authentic! I am definetly coming back. I had the chilaquiles and they tasted like something my grandma in Michoacan Mexico would make. Very satisfied, with food and service overall it was a great place.

8OtKclLxMxQSnYveIv6sHQ.text: I understand it was Saturday night but we should not have to wait nearly an hour AFTER we ordered to get our food. Now... the food was ok at best. Ordered the chicken fajitas for two. They brought us 3 corn tortillas... for 2 people. Had to ask for more. The rice SUCKED. The beans were flavorless. I am giving this place a very generous 2 stars. This is the second michoacan restaurant we have tried here in the Vegas valley and the last one we will be trying.

TOzWE_kCY_df1951P-BWTA.text: By far one of my favorite Mexican restaurants that I've found here in Vegas. Traditional Mexican food. First time here and thus far I'm loving it. Great atmosphere, great service and beast of all great quality food! I'll definitely be frequenting this place more often. Thanks Saul for your service! My only complain... homemade tortillas yes..... but though to eat.

Wj0gBDNUnVcZIvh6No1ndA.text: Love this place the servers are always attentive. And make the dinning a welcome adventure, always great. Hoodie for authentic Mexican flavor! Margaritas spot on.. steak salad has been the best I've had in a long time. Thumbs up!!

apfNffCojCBdOLCs0d7fhA.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in all of vegas. Great customer service, awesome energy, easy parking, and hands down the tastiest Mexican food every time I go!

tfxtCS2gCBgB1mgEeQiJfg.text: I've come here a couple times now...I don't love it or hate it...but there are certainly some very bright spots!    The gringo in me feels like i'm deep inside a different culture just by walking in here.  Also, I love that the menu does a little translating for us...such as: "Servidos con sopa de fideos, arroz, frijoles y tortillas" and then the translation they give, "Served with sopa de fideos, arroz, frijoles y tortillas"...could we be missing anything here?  Additionally, they have some solid prices on some of their higher-end tequilas!  They make fresh guacamole right there at your table!  Their hotter salsa is tasty and...eh...hot!  I haven't found a 5 star Mexican restaurant in Vegas...Bonita Michoacan does a solid, authentic, job!  Carnitas and I have this thing...we love each other deeply.  The carnitas here don't love me enough for me to come here for them specifically, but they'll do in a pinch.

xeKX9SvxRBR3jPk1ga432w.text: It's so sad I have to change my review. First we walk in and as we waiter a table a lady is talking to what looks like a manager about finding a hair in the god. Uh ok anyways we get our table. The server takes forever! His assistant did most of the work. I got a refil after it had been empty for 10 min. We had to ask for soup, which was served the same time as our food. My mother in law got nachos which was just cheese and jalapenos. No beans? I could've made those nachos at home. I'll be going somewhere else for Mexican food :/. It was nice knowing ya for 10 yrs

WFQaTQxINKuw7oB8pk-9mw.text: Came here at 1pm for lunch and they are packed! We waited for 5 mins and got a table by the window, yayy love it! At first they served us the chips, salsa and bean. The salsa kinda disappointed me because its plain, tasted like chilli oil without flavor. But that's not a big deal because it's free lol can't complain about it. I ordered the New York steak Carna Asada. It was very good.  Will def come back!

_2n7mC5vqEL_3asNu3k0Vw.text: Firstly, I really like this place! Now down to brass tacks:  Food: I've been here twice, and the second time was specifically because of how much I loved the food. The green enchilada sauce is amazing, as well as the citrus marinated carnitas. I had some huevos con machaca tonight (breakfast for dinner!) and it was great! Oh! The flour (have not tried the corn yet) tortillas are very good.  Margaritas are made with fresh squeezed lime juice rather than a bottle or gun of sour mix. Very tasty. The chips are very disappointing and so is the salsa. This is the only reason I could not rate it 5 stars.  Service: This is some of the best service I've seen in a while. The staff (bus staff included) truly want to make sure that you have a great time and love every minute.  Atmosphere: While the typical Mexican restaurant theme is the basis for the atmosphere, it is done well and does not feel "cheesy." Pretty quiet most of the time, but can get loud when busy (of course).  Can't wait to go back!

Y-12ZDZ-5jSFW6m5ruY9Bg.text: What can I say? Girlfriend wanted to go to a Mexican restaurant and heard some good reviews from some of my coworkers at work so I decided to give it a shot. Immediately we were greeted at the door and a booth was found for the two of us. We ordered our drinks, and then chips and bean dip and salsa (which we did not both particularly care for) sat in front of us. The fideo soup was simply amazing, and was complementary as well. She ordered the carnitas plate with beans and rice and guacamole. 10/10 for that. I ordered the Pollo Al Cognac. 10/10 has well. The carnitas was better in my opinion, but both dishes were extremely flavorful. We took our dessert home with us since after the beans, fideo soup, and our meal we were absolutely stuffed. I ordered the cheesecake burrito and she ordered flan. She said the Flan was good. I personally do not care for flan at all, so I did not try it.  Food - 10/10 Service - 8/10 (merely for the fact they sat the menu down in front of us and literally 20 seconds later asked us what we wanted. Made me feel slightly rushed) Atmosphere - 9/10 (the live music was a tad bit loud and sometimes I could not hear by date while she was talking to me)  I would definitely recommend this place to anybody looking for a good Mexican restaurant with decent prices and huge portion sizes.

SioZB73BrgxwrqcrmOCAxQ.text: Okay I have been putting off this review for almost 2 weeks but I've finally got the time to explain why my rating for this place is only 3 stars! I came here with a co worker on a lunch break a little over a week ago. Greeting from the hostess was pleasant as well as the customer service from our waiter! Good we ordered was the tacos lengua(cow tongue) and my fish tacos! Everything tastes okay UNTIL I went to go eat my last tacos and noticed a baby ant hop off my plate O_o yeah and we all know ants just don't roll solo now do they? Know what this means right? There's clearly more and to what wasn't a surprise I glance over at the window seal and it's plenty more under this vase! YUCK! We immediately got our server who apologized and told us this wasn't likely well we decided to kill one of them and save it in a napkin for management and surely she came out thinking that it couldn't be possible.. She explained that they always clean very good.. Well apparently not because these ants been shacking up for a while. She apologized and gave us HALF off our bill which actually should've been completely comp'd and maybe even a gift certificate to try them again. After being grossed out I didn't even want a to-go box..not sure if i would've wanted anymore ants to bring home (a lot of pun intended)..

Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish Tacos

ATPGewKvPuDMYFYmqmnrFw.text: I've come here several times over the last 12 years. This time was one of the worst! The food was lacking flavor. Normally you get a huge plate full, not this time. Very little of anything. My daughter ordered the kids shrimp. The price was $8 and it literally had 3 shrimp and about 10 fries on the plate. I doubt we'll be back any time soon, if at all. It'll probably be another couple of years.

lQL_T5A2e1kQMMx58qe0zw.text: Such great food! I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered. The chilaquiles and chorriqueso are my absolute faves. Only downside is that it's off the strip, but definitely worth the short drive from it.

Blq7N_VybFQ-rVToDDb5Cg.text: Third or fourth time having dinner here. Fantastic, authentic Mexican food. Richard has been our server each time. He is friendly, efficient and amusing. I highly recommend this place.

aW0PQQaTi3syryzYip1aSg.text: Best Mexican restaurant hands down! The service is top notch and they're very welcoming, the food is the best everything my family has had has always been amazing! We live in Cali and everytime we come to Vegas we have to visit!

0L5H-UCphXCPzbNqYAmofQ.text: I went here with a friend because of the reviews. 4 and 5 stars? I don't see it.  They do have a good mix of authentic and Tex-Mex on their menu. The menu is extensive...but I'm only going to comment on what I had.  Fajitas. I ordered a mix of pork and beef. When they arrived they were sizzling hot but flavorless. It's sad when the bell peppers have more flavor than the meat. The only way I could tell the difference from the beef and the pork was that the pork looked like pulled pork -- and about that... isn't fajita meat typically grilled? It honestly looked like they threw some pulled pork on the sizzling plate and tried to pass it off on me.   The only plus was that the tortillas were freshly made.  I forgot what my friend ordered but when I asked him how his was he just shrugged his shoulders and said, "It's ok I guess".  The service was great and the waiters were very friendly. The salsa was "ok" and the bean dip that came with it was, well, bean dip...nothing "addictive" about it like I saw in another review.  The lounge singer they had was playing mostly songs from the 80s. 'I Just Called to Say I Love You' by Lionel Richie? C'mon, Man. I think he played 2 Mexican songs the whole time we were there. I personally think it was more annoying than entertaining but hey, maybe other people like that kinda stuff.  I probably won't be back because it simply wasn't worth it. Bland and ordinary.

Sfd4Tc_90bWlOKLfXpQKyQ.text: I love love LOVE this place!!!! Great authentic Mexican restaurant.  Every time I'm in Vegas I make sure to stop here for some yummy food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wMbK7RvQOedcFmTZeu7MtA.text: My family and I went to this restaurant on Mother's Day so perhaps I am being biased as I know most restaurants are out of control on that particular date.  This was my experience: We had a group of 9 and got seated right away. That was initially impressive! Our waiter was a man named Lorenzo. We ordered drinks, got our chips and salsa/bean dip rather quickly. We ordered our food and from then on it was a 45+  minute wait to receive the food. I think I would have been okay with waiting on the food if I didn't notice that all other families that arrived after mine were brought their food right away. Small or larger groups everyone else's waiters were ON IT; however, ours was not. I finally could not stand it any longer and approached him to ask if he could bring our food as each plate was ready, versus waiting on all of them to be ready entirely. He seemed annoyed at my comment, but noticing how slow he was moving kept irritating me.  Once the food arrived, I was starved and shoved everything down. I had a combination plate with Huevos Rancheros. The hand made tortillas that came with the meal were a nice surprise. However, the rice was bland. My huevos rancheros had a weak red sauce with no flavor. I asked around the table, and the variety on our table had burritos and fish combo plates, yet they all agreed that each item was rather bland.   The alcoholic drink selection although not that large, was very good. I ordered something called "Que Viva la Borrachera" and I have to say that probably saved this entire rating. They packed on the alcohol!  I would consider this place for appetizers and drinks with a friend, but not for a meal.

qa-bhtwHFAYOGLQUDclplw.text: Best Mexican food off the strip. Authentic dishes and excellent atmosphere.  Over the 10 years I have been visiting this location the food and services has not changed. Person favorites are the carne asada tacos and the pollo a la parilla.

wh5wHZdSwCpLkcWCpbk2Cg.text: This was our second time coming. I was so disappointed on the service. I was so sad I brought my parents with me. There was so much mis communication between the staff. I should have left it with our amazing first experience last year.

LXzDQSr_lPEkKoHM79sZ2w.text: We've been coming here for a couple years now since we found it. The environment is colorful and culturally authentic to the food. Although I haven't quite yet figured out how the dolls & clowns play into it but whatever, it's fun to look at.  The staff has always been very friendly and on point with their customer service. My glass is never empty, the buss boys are like ninja re-fillers.  I love that they do table side guacamole and you can make it as mild or spicy as you like. Chips, salsa and bean dip come to the table when you first sit down.  One of my favorite dishes here is their fajitas. Shrimp and/ or chicken. The tortillas are home made, you can't beat that! Fideo soup usually comes with an entree. I always add a little salsa for a kick.  If you're celebrating a birthday be sure to let them know. They'll come on over and sing in English & Spanish.  We always save room for some sopapillas too.

f5VZkeEK8skQjs6Tv5k0pw.text: I called all over Las Vegas and this is the only place I found so far that makes homemade flour and corn tortillas so it's definitely worth a stop.

qhyVqhkh3Gtt4-Zyq6q3Yw.text: Came here for a friend's birthday party of 10. Sat immediately, wages no time getting our drinks ordered and brought to us, best michelada. Food was tasty and you can't go wrong the portions are huge. So the waiters had a great positive attitude and seemed more than happy to offer their services and do their job.  1st time eating here and won't be the last.  Delicious.

wkbtVa4_bnyg2p1QZlW-Mw.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant! The food is always spectacular, service is good, and I love the atmosphere!

ZCmUKxdghMFN8g47KLCzOA.text: Delicious, mouth watering fajitas. Outstanding service and even better margarita's. I'm a Mexican food consumer and have eaten at many authentic places from Las Vegas all the way to mexico. So far this is good in Vegas!

mdtLPpM1bNXu8hCBxtDXNw.text: If you're looking for more authentic taste like home Mexican food, this is your place! When you seated they bring out bottomless chips with salsa and bean dip, they also bring out Fideo all complimentary. The food proportions are huge and the food is amazing. You definitely won't leave this place hungry. Not to mention the excellent staff & customer service. Been coming here for years.

dYGD6zLHrN0x-7_9w9cMDQ.text: Absolutely The Best Mexican Restaurant In Town  My husband and I drive from Southeast Henderson almost weekly to enjoy Bonito. We have always had excellent service and the food is phenomenal. Anytime we have out of town guests we bring them here for a special treat. We have tried many different items on the menu and have never been disappointed. We love the decor and enjoy the piano player on weekends. We always leave happy and satisfied.

yZGMJ1_TbfnSwe41W9GjxA.text: This is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas it's a tradition to go eat when we visit absolutely amazing. I love the sopa aguada that they give you as a starter you must have have their refried   beans.Customer service is absolutely great always cheerful and very pleasant I don't think I will ever stop coming to this place... it's a bit far from the strip but the drive is worth it never had a bad experience  nor bad food and for that I will continue  to return!!!!!

prndUeR-p0aJzAzRVhg4Hw.text: Love that they make the guacamole right in front of you

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-bmeM2F_tyFWlP19tLr3Aw.text: 4.5 stars  My family and I were introduced to this place by my in-laws.  They are regulars to this place, and it didn't take us long to see why.  This place has good food and good service.    The experience is started off with Chips & Salsa AND Bean Dip.  Chips are nice and fresh; not salty.  Salsa is usually good, but I love the bean dip!  The bean dip is excellent when enjoyed with the chips.  It is served warm and just melts in your mouth.    Our Entrees were just as good.  Some ofthe entrees that we ordered included a Chicken Flautas (my item), Chile Relleno / Beef Taco Combo, Lightly Breaded Thin Slice of Steak served with French Fries, etc.  although I feasted on the chips and bean dip, I was still able to feast on my Chicken Flautas.  They were nice and crispy (not oily) with juicy chicken pieces inside.  We also had the pleasure of ordering a large mango margarita.  Wow, it was definitely LARGE.  We even got to keep the margarita glass (rinsed clean thanks to our server).    Loved that they sang to my wife in celebration of her birthday!  A churro dessert was served as the birthday dessert.  To top that off, our server even had a shot of Tequila and Sprite to help commemorate the occasion.    Service was great!  Our server and team (food runners, etc.) did a great job.    Prices were also not too bad, especially considering we were there for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large Margarita

646rshP0CUHh2vhkZvdEKA.text: This place never disappoints! Food is always fresh, customer service is always the same. Same friendly faces all the time. I come to Vegas for business every month and always look forward to breakfast and dinner here. Definitely a customer for life!

hc0tuPsgIoWnIDCeM9d0Rg.text: We were so surprised at how excellent this restaurant was. We had no idea. The food and service were impeccable. We had taken guests out to a well known steak house the night before and the food here was 100 times better than the fancy steak house. The service was much better too. The food we all had was great, the atmosphere was perfect and the music was very enjoyable. We have found one of our new favorite Mexican restaurants and the prices were great too and offer such value for the high quality food you get.

PFWPZX6-ymxFQn1MKyjyxg.text: Love this place! The Service and food are always great!! I would definitely recommend the ceviche or the shrimp cocktail with a margarita with the corona inside!

XjugnMg3ECUVeAk3EAkrXA.text: I do not want to even get into it. Meals are priced way too high, not even that good. "Manager" on duty is very unprofessional and irrational. Go to macayos.

WWfFSEjD1gHBijBmTRPxOQ.text: Excellent visit, it's been a few years since we have last visit this site , me and the family was so happy we took the time and made the trip again. First, server Martin was spectacular in every way. Waited hand and foot.. Didn't miss a thing.. Went far and beyond great service. All 4 kids loved him made the stay enjoyable . The food was timely and delicious . Portions sizes were more the expected . The Cadillac margaritas are a must try for a perfect mix of goodness . Place was very clean and nicely decorated , we witness a lot of happy go like tables eating , great vibe threw the whole restaurant we will for sure be back soon , looking forward to it. Great over all experience in every way. The way it should feel when eating out and spending Money ..

F8L2ERJ8aJLHHIZgN6IVEw.text: I always get the same thing at Mexican restaurants, shredded beef taco and chicken enchilada with rice and beans. I've eaten here about 3 times and I think I keep going back because of their lunch specials. Their rice and beans is not the best. Sometimes when the main dish sucks, I can just fill up on rice and beans and be ok with that. But not here. They do have good horchata and my boyfriend absolutely loves this place. I don't know, just me I guess.

ENQcdwJl0lyHtrdW2z8luQ.text: Me and boys love going here a bit pricey I think but very good food I think their costumer service could be a lot better and be more organized

q0mZ9z7JWinoj1MktfeRhQ.text: Definitley an authentic Mexican restaurant.  The organic margherita was excellent.  The tampequnia was amazing.  Fajitas were very good as well.  Servers very friendly and accommodating.

54kOEmNUJseEib_xbGSVig.text: Foos is great but service from the hostess could be much better. Get rid of the two gals at the front and then maybe 5 stars. They are rude, not welcoming and careless

xo3AakOSwJ6A1ECD66LxNw.text: Went here to celebrate my hubbys birthday. Eduardo was great. Service wonderful. Good excellent. Will be back for sure.

71DIMHV0kC_n2Sv9UTiQOQ.text: Great spot. Love the fideo soup they bring out and the tableside guac. Good atmosphere. Friendly staff. Would definitely recommend.

ELqgSKx6gDIH81BfOm0rQA.text: First time in Vegas struggling to find a place to eat. Saw that Bonito Michoacan had 4 stars so decided to give it a try and I was thoroughly impressed! The service was fast and most of all DELICIOUS!!!!!!! the service was great & I enjoyed sitting next to two parties that had the staff sing Happy Birthday Fiesta Style! I'm happy and full!

6LieuR7hhlEWWv5Zwrmohg.text: This is probably my favorite Mexican restaurant.  We come here often for lunch and some Birthdays. We always sit in Violeta's section and she has it together. She knows what we want without us ordering!  Margaritas and food magically appear!  The chips and salsa are delicious as is the fresh table side guacamole!  Well worth a trip!!

U8KN49FQFfiR-OfC9IHUDA.text: Just all around delicious authentic Mexican food with authentic atmosphere. Manager came out and let us utilize the free margarita from Yelp. Hostess was beautiful and helpful. Waiter was fast and always on top of everything. Salsa was good. Shrimp tacos were bomb. Cheesecake burrito was a new dessert worth trying. Just go, no way to be disappointed.

k0eO0HgQBHTPdo1bjNgIzA.text: Tortillas hechas a mano! Excelente service and the food is is delicious. .. great find. We came for breakfast and will be coming back for dinner.

Jx-m8Ji_5tXo6wpn6igu9Q.text: This is a new favorite place! The bf and I came here last night with my little brother and sister at the coaxing of my little brother for some bomb a** Mexican food. And boy was he right.   Upon pulling up and seeing the parking lot was packed I got a little worried we would have to wait for a table but...NOPE. We were happily greeted by two pretty hostesses and taken to our table for 4. Our server arrived promptly, took our drink order, and even gave us a little free cup of their homemade guacamole (delicious!!!) after our chips and salsa arrived. It seemed we had multiple people waiting on us and making sure our drinks & chips were full. I appreciated that, a lot. Pretty cool that they were all having each others backs and truly their focus was on the guests dining experience.   We ordered different varieties of the usual Mexican flare so I won't go into details describing it all. Everything was delicious and we were all happy with our food.   One thing that I thought was pretty awesome and makes me want to go back for my birthday....they had a few people with birthdays while we were there. They make a HUGE spectacle with singing to you, complete with a sombrero and a free shot of tequila down the hatch!  Oh my gosh it was sooooo loud but ya know I didn't mind it, even though it wasn't for anyone at our table it was still fun to watch and even other guests joined in on singing the happy birthday. Pretty awesome!!!   Will definitely be back here :)

a91lY6DdSVXnIF1ibKYUKA.text: I came to here to eat with my boyfriend and my son and it was a terrible experience. I am vegetarian and didn't see much on the menu, So I decided just ordered a bean and rice burrito with some sides  (sour cream, pico De gallo) and some chicken tenders for my son. My boyfriend's dinner looked great but ours looked horrible. First, for my burrito looked like they just slapped down a cold tortilla with some cheap yellow (yes yellow) lettuce from the 99 cent store. It wasn't even presentable o could have made that myself at home for what they charged me. My son's dinner was just insulting. They came out with some fries and the chicken tenders  (which says they are homemade) , the chicken tenders were literally the little dinosaurs in the frozen aisle of the grocery store!! I ripped them open and they were still cold shaped exactly like the dinosaurs!!! It was ridiculous! So i told the waiter and he went to the back to see what's going on and he came back didn't apologize or anything he juat said would you like something else in place of this? I said no we do not want to pay for the tenders just the fries, he took it off the receipt. At least he did that. In any place, I will not be coming back to this place. It was the worse experience. If you bring your child please don't order off the kids menu , total rip off.

-dLLqdV_dfrzVLCFrSJ0BQ.text: Best Mexican authentic food love this place I sure want to come again service is great food quality is excellent love Margrita

z7YRvbC5uiDo1s7PM3tWQA.text: Can you say,"The best Mexican food in Vegas!"  This is a must if you love real Mexican food. The staff was great, from the hostess to the cooks. They take the time to explain everything if you have questions. The margaritas were delicious too.

WgGZJOZ4ln3JAWMNo35_tA.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant.  Everything is fresh and nothing we've tried tasted canned.  My daughter enjoys the steak nefia.  Get the tableside guacamole.  Red and green Chile are excellent choices!

YNqyBf8_8_WSgk52uklAkQ.text: Very expensive...but way worth the high prices because the all male staff is the greatest best courteous kind waiters in Vegas....a lot of the food comes out Luke-warm. Refried beans and the rice came out Cold...and the Fideo soup came out cold also...but waiters are so apologetic

NmH1Wkh2Bk58XT9kGQwlxw.text: Went here for the first time and I have to say I was completely amazed with the service, food, and drinks!   We enjoyed everything we ordered, and loved the Fideo soup that comes with the dishes.   I'd recommend this place to friends and family.

Q2aBrSgbZGJRc9s1bYUuHA.text: I cannot be bothered with this one, anyone who has wait staff add more to their tip than I wrote down cannot be surprised with one star

The bartender Karla was very nice and recommended new cocktails for us to try. Havent tried the food yet but next trip over its going down.

Lig12w_Ys3xZ4njdd2IqOw.text: Great place for vegetarians. Started off with their complementary nachos, hot salsa and crushed beans. It was perfect! Veggie enchiladas and veggie fajitas for dinner. Went well with a glass of their house Merlot. Great and friendly staff. We will be recommending to friends and family.

AueHlpJQt3iRuHK_6ZaNzA.text: Nothing to special about the place , the portion size of the food was good but for my personal taste it needed a lil bit more flavor, the service was good even though it was packed.

dSrlAB37CyQNyA1e82ksTQ.text: I have been eating here for years and finally decided to put up a review... To keep it short this has to be the best mexican restaurant in Las Vegas, the staff is always nice, the food is always delicious. I'm sure everyone says that moms cooking is always the best and believe me it is but when its my moms birthday or mothers day my mother shouldnt cook and I know her favorite authentic mexican restaurant to take her to is and has always been Bonito Michoacan.

gxz4RcvMhARfqCbWRZuRgQ.text: I love Mexican food. Food was ok... not what I expected. Food like warm when it came... ordered a drink but never got it.  Service poor.

A_XpkdCch4F0Hl8QcZUa6A.text: Searching desperately for a Mexican restaurant that stayed open a little later than 9pm on the night of my friend's dad's birthday, we settled on Bonito Michoacan.  What we received was extremely friendly service, a lot of delicious food, and they had like a 4 piece band sing happy birthday and gave our man of the hour a free shot of tequila.  I don't really see anything I could have criticized from our experience. We were seated promptly, treated well, and the food was surprisingly very delicious. Additionally, we stayed there for a good 40 minutes after their closing time and never felt rushed at all.  I had the steak cilantro, whilst the others around the table had an assortment of chimichanga, a crazy gigantic burrito, and chicken helena or something along those lines. Everything was cooked really well with rich strong flavors.  We also got the hand-made table side guacamole and it was extremely tasty and fresh.  All in all it was a very pleasant experience.

JaGqHyItScFKcMWCnXT6AA.text: This place has good authentic Mexican food but is definitely a little pricey. I understand that it's a family owned restaurant, but in my opinion is a little old and outdated to be paying that much. When I go out I don't want to only pay for the food but the atmosphere; and that's all this place is really lacking. Other than that, I was happy with my experience.

nHrxMLbLJEeCFZLyaGD92A.text: This has akways been one of my favorite Mexican food spots, they make the best handmade flour torrillas.  The cilantro steak is an all time favorite, but anything on the menu is good.  The lunch menu has great deals too, the 3 item combo's always great.  At night they have great ambience with the live piano singer along with one of their many Margaritas or specialty drinks.  They are always busy but the waiters and staff are always ontop of their game.  I would recommend this place 3 times a week.

7MMie2vvP7pMNJYm2YsKuA.text: Very great restaurant! Great service and great food! Thanks to Jonathan, Omar Soto, and Nacho give us the great experience!! Will definitely come back!

af7TfKwUS393bihaBQrFqw.text: This place is awesome come here every time we come to Vegas. The wait staff is great drinks and food come out fast. The chips salsa and beans are so good to start. My favorite is the carnitas and tamarind margarita

OyQiXaOKy-d1ISRLANDVOQ.text: This is a must stop every visit to Las Vegas, the bacon wrapped is the bomb. Great food all around and great Margaritas.

PROS: Steak Cilantro               Chili Relleno              Steak Fajitas              Lengua Tacos              Pollo al mojo de ajo    I haven't had a bad experience yet and I've been here a few times. fR1Bh33IhjyNnJUsFydEUA.text: Looks are deceiving let me tell you!   This is NOT REAL MEXICAN FOOD. The salsa had no flavor the chips were stale  The coffee creamer was expired! Oh man our plates blaahhh!! We got huevos rancheros and chilaqueles it was horrible rice was nasty dry the salsa on top of the food was straight out of a can! Yuck! Never again..   I'M MEXICAN THIS FOOD IS NASTY STAY AWAY!! I KNOW WHAT I'M TELLING YOU!!

eL__FCboOO7MM3BVfU18XQ.text: The food is authentic and the service was great! We went on a Saturday late morning while it was busy the service was better than anticipated. The portions are generous and the ambiance is clean and cheerful.  If you like spicy ask for the habanero salsa it was tasty with a strong kick. Overall a must try when in Vegas its a short drive away from the strip but well worth it.

GVmy629iLYVFj8oxoUlwiA.text: This place is quite good. Lunch specials that are price really well and the food is muy bueno!!  The clown room is a little creepy but I'm down with the clown today. Be careful with the beans and salsa. The salsa is great but only the first round is free after that it's 2.50. The only thing keeping this 5 star is I prefer a little dirt.

HnHD9_MlKW9ih7DQ2dokTA.text: This place started out great....(key word, started out). Looked like a fun atmosphere. Got chips and salsa and waters right away. Waiter came promptly and was super nice and fun. Placed our order....then that's where it went downhill. There were 4 of us, and we ran out of chips and salsa and water quickly. There was no one anywhere to help us. So we sat and waited until another waiter (not the original nice one) came with our food. We asked for more water and more chips and salsa. He said he would be right back. After he left I noticed they didn't put ranch dressing on my salad like I had asked for. We sat, and sat, and sat....no one ever came back to refill our waters like we had asked, I still hadnt eaten since my salad was dry. I finally got up and went to the front and asked for all we had been waiting for for at least 30 min. Someone finally came with all the above. About 3/4 of the way thru the meal the original waiter came back and said he was sorry, that there was a party of 30 in the front and that he got caught up with them. We just asked for the check since we were afraid he would disappear for another 45 minutes again. Overall, it seemed like a fun place, and the food was good, but the lack of service and attention to the customer was enough to make me never come back.

SGedRPhhNt74QRbvXIr77Q.text: Im a big fans o Chipotle Mexican Grill and Cafe Habana i know they are not the authentic mexican food but i think i will like Mexican food. My friend told me this restaurant was good so i went there with my boyfriend for dinner. The decoration in the restaurant are quite special (looks like a normal house) and the staff are very nice and friendly. My friend told me the Steak Cilantro was good so I ordered this one and my boyfriend had the Coca cola steak. When my dish came, i could smell something bitter and i just didnt want to touch my dish so I switched mine with my boyfriend. So I had the Coca cola steak now, the sauce was nothing special and the steak was overcooked. The yellow rice which came with it was not really good. And my boyfriend didnt like the Steak Cilantro neither. Maybe we just do not like the authentic Mexican food and think we will stick back to Chipotle and cafe habana. People who like authentic Mexican food might wanna go there and try and see.
