Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Cilantro

5xHyAxRTWNJiD34Vsy4d-A.text: We just had a fantastic experience here.  OUT_SSSTANDING.  The food was excellent, fresh guac prepared table-side, excellent salsas, chips fresh from the oil, great portions, super service, super prices...  The food was delicious, fresh, our server Julio was superb...the hostesses were smiling and really friendly.  No visit to LV will be complete in the future without a trip to this place.  It was that good.

_IU_t9YOFxsAXD01YVqvIA.text: Went here a couple of weeks ago on a weekend at about 3:30-4'ish.  There were a few people in there but it wasn't packed.  I had the Sopes,  (Sopes -Three  handmade tortillas gorditas, lightly deep fried. Topped with chorizo, carne asada or pollo asado.) with carne asada a taco, basically, but with a  thicker, fried corn tortilla, complete with onions, cilantro, etc.  No sissy lettuce and tomato on these tacos.  It also came with beans and rice (some of the better rice I've had, I find it always to be dry and bland, but I like flavor) I finished 2 of them (out of the 3 I had), but couldn't handle eating anymore.  My boyfriend had a dish that was even better than mine.  I can't remember the name of it, but I'm waiting for him to answer me so I know what it is. - Now I know! It was the Steak Picado- (New York steak in small chunks, sauteed with onions, cilantro, jalapenos, tomatoes and mixed with Spanish & verde sauce.) I remember, it was nice chunks of meat in a red sauce (not mole, not chile colorado), I took a bite of it, and the meat was incredibly tender, not the dry, in the crockpot for 6 hours, shredded tender, the tender that only comes from a good piece of meat.  It yields slightly, but as soon as you bit in, it's pure, soft, moist bliss.  And no gristle!  Their handmade tortillas are also very, very good.  I watched the nice lady make tortillas the whole time I was there, she was a busy lady!   We finished it off with the fried ice cream.  To me, it left more to be desired.  The coating seemed...almost stale, it was hard to chew and the ice cream was just plain vanilla ice cream.  I heard the table next to us order the fried banana after the waiter's suggestion, they seemed satisfied with it and finished the whole thing.  All in all, I will definitely go here again, just on the Steak Picado alone.

8BpM0FnAmoyQfNkUxaFwDQ.text: My husband and I found this restaurant through Yelp's reviews as we were looking for Mexican food off of the Strip. This was, by far, the best Latino food that we have ever had. The atmosphere was great and everyone working there greeted us warmly and were very friendly throughout. There was a Mariachi band playing, but not too loud, and everything just felt comfortable. The decor was bright and festive, but it was not over the top. The thing that we noticed first was that almost everyone eating there was Latino, and that, to us, is always a good sign of authentic food. The food did not disappoint. Everything was so good overall that we came back the next day for lunch before heading back home-- just to get another taste of it. The best of what we tried: the oysters (I am not a fan but my husband ate the heck out of them happily), the cheese fundo, and the guacamole. The warm, homemade tortillas were the best tortillas I have ever had as well, and if I could somehow magically have them at my house every day, I would be eating a steady diet of them. All in all, a good value for the money, a nice experience, and wonderful food.

B2uh_nVWLflbJ4qU26UzzA.text: I really loved this place!  Visting LV a local friend of ours took us here.  were were immediately served chips with excellent salsa that actually had some kick to it!  not only that, refried beans were served along with them too..very nice touch!  I had the tacos al pastor...the were ok and not served with the traditional pineapple, onions and cilantro.  Bf got the seafood mariscos..he liked it.  Friend had chicken tacos in hard shell..they looked good and he finished them so thats a sign.  all in all it was a nice experience and very nice to be off the strip.  Oh if anything go there to check ou the shrine of creepy clown figurines, dolls and puppets...very odd

HtsvGaC31qG2edRm05TWrA.text: Tasty margaritas that come in giant sizes.  Not only do you get the standard chips and salsa but a really yummy bean dip too.  Friendly, if a bit over the top service.  A gargantuan menu.  I think this place is a solid hit with tons of Mexican standards.  Even though my carnitas weren't the best I've ever had, some of the other dishes were delish.  I'd eat here again.  Three plus plus stars.

9GxBLFMASEZKh_OGBsbBnQ.text: What has happened to this restaurant?  Just two years ago when my husband and I discovered it just blocks from the Rio Hotel and Casino, we were thrilled to have a great Mexican meal so close to the strip.  When we ate there in November we thought the food was not the same quality that we had just a few months before Then my daughter and I tried it in February and it was worse.  I ordered the steak Fajitas.  They arrived on a cold plate, not sizzling like they normally do.  There were 9 small pieces of beef, three small pieces of onion and 3/4 of the Fajitas consisted of bell peppers.  The Fajitas were flavorless.  No seasoning, just cooked meat and peppers.  What a disappointment.  We noticed on the menu that if you want more chips and salsa, you must now pay $2.99 for them.  What a ripoff since the bowl of chips is small and was about  1/2 full.  Ricardo's is at the corner of Decatur and Flamingo and I hear it is better thanBointo Michoacan.

1RysW1dcaheIAMYJlGfsKQ.text: I love everything about this place. Its always packed, and the service never slows down! These guys do the same super fast service no matter how busy it is! Awesome place, with hilarious live music.

TiT0QVfgbAIi7d9G36psbw.text: This was the second place we ate at while visiting LV(check my other reviews for into).  Coming from the San Francisco area, where good Mexican food is hard to find, this place was a step up with chips and great refried beans served right up, nice Mexican decor, and excellent service.  I started with their Cadillac Margarita with Patron Silver.  Nice size goblet and a nice buzz that lasted the meal.  My girlfriend ordered the "Vampiro" which tasted like slightly alcoholic cool aid.  We sent it back and immediately had it replace with a delicious pina colada.  I had read about their Chile Colorado, a new york cut into pieces in a red sauce(gringos need not worry about it being a spicy sauce) to which I added their flavorful spicy sauce and that did the trick.  I ordered the flour tortillas (I believe they are freshly made, as it tasted that way to me.)   My girlfriend ordered the Mexican combo beef taco, chicken enchilada,  and chile relleno ( The beef taco took first place, chili relleno second, I found it delicious on a taste test, and enchilada a distant third.  Finally, always in search for the authentic churro, it was done right served with small decorative flowered whip cream flowers to dip in.  It was crisp and not overly sweet.   Overall I give this place a B+, as their chili colorado good have been better, perhaps make it bit more flavorful.  Nevertheless, as Mexican restaurant goes from where I am from, this place any day.

YeFGfYF6FuJrazFOt1wzEw.text: Absolutely one of the 2 worst Mexican restaurants I've been to ever.  I thought maybe b/c it's in Vegas and not southern CA? It starts out with soup that tasted like freeze-dried Lipton noodle soup. None of the 3 of us ate it. We took our waiter's recommendations, and although he was efficient, he was not right.  We ordered from the Specialities, and 1/3 was good: the camarones a la cognac. Booths were too short for the table. The live music-1 guy- was okay for free, but sang American songs, which did not contribute to the Mexican atmosphere. Subsequently, 2 of us went to El Nopal restaurant in Vegas, which was excellent, and proves Vegas does have good Mexican restaurants!

WtrQpjwSc3YD2Ed8yc1tNg.text: It really is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is quaint, the service is friendly, and the food is phenomenal.Been searching for the best Mexican spot and I think we found it... the food had large portions and the live band was cool.. The pricing is affordable and although our waiter was useless the bus boy was great.. we are new yorkers so we know good service.. TABLESIDE GUACAMOLE IS THE BEST!!! & peach margaritas come with real peach slices, it's the best snack place!! Fish tacos weren't life changing though.Tableside guacamole that is so good. Ceviche was one of the best I have had. I thought the food was all good. Equivalent to lindo michoacan. The service was friendly.Bonito Michoacan really is a diamond in the rough out here on The West Side. It may not seem special on the outside, but the food inside is worth the drive.The enchiladas here actually do have taste. The chile relleno is also a good choice. I could even tell the salsa was homemade.It's good Mexican comfort food here, and the food shouldn't be disappointing.great mexican place good service, homemade tortillas, freh table side guacamole, good music, good margatitas! I am very pickey when it comes to Mexican food due to being of Mexican decent and enjoy finding the "real thing". Bonito Michoacan is The Real Thing.....love the food, atmosphere and the people. It's a great place to eat or just go and have their delicious margaritas.

erCSW2Mcs8xDpzRAK7t1GA.text: Okay Yelp, you did me wrong on this one.  This is the absolute worst Mexican food that I have ever tasted.  First of all the food is not flavorful, I had to put salt on everything from the salsa to the beans and every item on my plate.  I ordered a combo plate with a chile relleno, chicken enchilada and chicken taco.  The chicken did not have any flavor and was very dry.  The chile relleno was full of water and the sauce on it tastes like pure tomato sauce.  Overall, it was a horrible meal.  The best part about my dinner was the tableside guacamole which of course needed salt and the wait staff who were very attentive.

ix4A9RFT09_Wm32M-iBS4g.text: As one of the first to arrive on this Saturday morning, we were promptly seated and provided menus.  The complimentary chips were commercial grade and both salsas probably originated in a factory.  We ordered the breakfast of champions, huevos rancheros, but both dishes were slightly overcooked and unremarkable as were the accompanying frijoles refritos, salad and rice.  My disappointment was only nominally tempered by the use of a 2/1 coupon found on the RJ's website:

IzOcUXxaOJxpyqY3mVJw_A.text: Pretty standard mexican fare. Cheesy mexican lounge singer singing christmas music added to the ambiance or something. I had the camarones al cognac which was in a rich cream sauce and quite good. My mom had some camarones a la diabla or something like that was spicy, but it masqueraded any flavor. The rice and beans were not good. The salsa was pretty good, had a good kick to it. It was okay, but definitely not the best I've had. Their menu is massive, which yields a lot of choices for groups. Standard is all I can say. And the booths are definitely not at a normal height.

IBTF_zZplfxOjL3dGLK-uA.text: To be fair, I took my 11 year old grandson to lunch. So all my previous Mexican restaurant reviews we directly after drinking 3-4 Cadillac Margaritas. This review is under the influence of 2 ice teas. My Chile Verde was good. My grandsons tacos were a bit bland. He did love the fried ice cream though. I also want to mention, Ivonne our server. She is great, fast friendly and really a great attitude.

2jfaS_3w3eaj0YQaG70VBg.text: My mom and I went here for lunch today ( 8/16/18). This was the first time we have tried this restaurant. The service was excellent from a bus boy named Daniel. Our waitress recommended Carne Asadea for me because I was not so sure what steak dish I should get. The waitress' name is Liliana, she recommended an orange roughy dish for my mother. When our food came for my mom, my mom said,  this does not taste like orange roughy. My steak was a little bit overcooked it did not tasted like medium rare steak at all. But, the service from the bus boy was very nice. When we received our bill, I noticed that my mom's dish is really not roughy dish it's really , Filete D Tilap L/C. So, it was an interesting experience at this restaurant. We didn't want the rice in our dishes so we asked for vegetables instead, we were surprised that they added extra money for the vegetable. I think it was a lack of communication with the waitress. Anyways, we passed by this restaurant many, many times and we always say we were going to try this restaurant one day.  The food is nothing to brag about today but the service was wonderful.

hUyN-QSApKQAz_ewI4AlRQ.text: Ughh i eat her at least 4 times a month and today decided to take it home :-(.. after i got done eating the side of rice i looked at the inside of the container and along piece of black hair i will never get it to go again and think about going back I'm grossed out ..I ate it all

First day had the chilaquiles with green chile was excellent, portions are large. Second day had the menudo with hand made tortillas and a sope was also excellent. Highly reccomend if you want authentic mexican food when in Vegas.

ArCQJOfsUnq2VjQP70-zkQ.text: The best Mexican place out of the strip!  If your looking for a delicious Mexican place out of the strip in Las Vegas this is the place to go to!!!! Also the drinks are amazing I tried a cucumber margarita on the rocks and it was the best!! Cheap good prices and food, drinks are great. The best part of it, it's away from the strip and craziness... free parking too :)

W2-vuRLRsAshFJyrT2jlyQ.text: Excellent vibe here! Came here for my boyfriends birthday and they have live singers! The food was incredibly tasty. I ate it all before I could take a photograph! More so the guava margaritas are to Die for. Not too sweet and perfect! Our waiter Nacho was friendly and attentive even though his side of the restaurant was jammed  packed! They even have a mariachi band to come sing for the birthday boy with a free shot of tequila!

tGXwcCaGRdk4-B6b9mO4hw.text: My partner and I the usual yelpers we are we're craving some at then take Mexican food off the strip mind you this is her second attempt to find a restaurant that not only serves good food but also makes you feel welcome. This place also has another restaurant I can't recall which one but the girls in the front definitely need to be either retrained or keep there attitudes at home, lucky for them we starving so we stayed. Now THIS location was spot on! I'm having an episode of amnesia :) can't remember his name but he will leave an impression on You that you won't forget. Funny, energetic the entire time! He fooled us ok this one, when the tab came out and he took our card (even though I heard him say the same joke to the table near by and STILL GOT US lol came back with something no one wants to hear. "sorry guys your card was declined" I think it was our "wtf" face made him feel bad and came out with the classic "just kidding!" Haha! Ok I'm sure you guys want to know how the food was. It speaks for itself, home made tortilla -addicting salsa - flavorful fish. Yum yum yummm!

FjC9OF5tUxOYSmFe351PCg.text: First time at Bonito Michoacan, and I ordered the Birria de Chivo and my husband ordered sopes, all made fresh and the Birria was the bomb!!! Totally recommend this place great service, great food! We'll be back!

BF1mGl-xpYSrCfUGXeXyvg.text: Very nice place the food was really good, the only problem was the refiles for the drinks I think they need to pay attention more and see if the drinks are good.

7E94uaN9Qu7f8tDKxrfWSw.text: We had the chilaquiles, egg and steak... food was amazing and the service was excellent. One of the places you want to visit when in Vegas after a long night!

5E4HuhhSTjG1QRkutH1nLg.text: We came in to Bonito Michocan and waited shortly to be seated. Armando was our server, he is an amazing server and Juan is awesome! Fast service and delicious food! Thank you Armando and Juan!

QL2Q1k64r0guVKalwViAsQ.text: Best Authentic Mexican Food!!  You gotta try the soups, chile verde and aquas chile!  Great skinny margaritas, too!  Local people come to this restaurant. You can't go wrong!  You gotta try it. No foo foo stuff here. Just real Mexican food!!

3udnMTG_R1ELgXH97J68qQ.text: Great food great service  The carne asada is very good. The oysters with ceviche is bomb. Definitely recommend this place

CNfcSHtcfas_OZNwzQm57w.text: This place is bomb af! I came to Vegas for vacation and my family and I were looking for authentic Mexican food and this was it! The place is super nice and staff is super kind

LRZtY-Dl0nb-ab61Oph3bg.text: This restaurant is anything anyone could ask for, great customer service, the food is amazing, very welcoming and clean facility. As you enter you already feel welcomed, to start you off they provide Fideo soup, chips, salsa and of course anything you'd like to drink. The menu has a wide variety from seafood to tacos and burritos. The plates are just right definitely allows space for dessert! Tue salmon has great taste, the rice and beans have a lot of flavor and the shrimp is a must if you're a seafood person. I ordered "Camarones Abuelito Timo" which is shrimp wrapped in bacon, with melted cheese on top not to mention the shrimp were on top of the rice which gave it great flavor. I will definitely be coming back to try out more of their menu, it's a must if you're ever in Nevada. I'm sure I'm not the only one when visiting other state it's harder to pick and find food that's appealing this restaurant met everything I was looking forward to. 10/10 recommend!!

N82y7DDRMMMmGXb-cft4NQ.text: Best place hands down , I'm from Michoacan and this is legit like my home state ! Hand made tortillas and sopes . Small place but very welcoming and great food . I came from Sacramento California and because of the great yelp reviews I was convinced! Definitely a great authentic Mexican food !

eD-v0VNXe_wuQOCCMzZ4kQ.text: Delicious authentic mexican food located near the Rio hotel. This was a spot I yelped and actually enjoyed the experience. They give you warm bean dip along with your chips and salsa. A large variety to choose from.

svzGIoco1tGq1Tc6XphBwQ.text: Amazing place, very good food, fresh, tasty and affordable. We had a great experience, I truly recommend this place. Service is excellent they offered us tortillas chips with dips and a very good tomato soup to wait but our meals came fast. Very have kids meal and a large choice of mexican specialties. Each one of us took a different meal and all were very delicious. Congratulation !!

0G77DxST-sx_LGiAFcwMEQ.text: Just had dinner here tonight. This place has good vibe, vibrant decorations, lovely music, amazing food and outstanding service. We had shrimp ceviche, steak tacos entree and steak fajita. Everything was delicious. Complimentary chips and salsa are served as soon as you sit down. Rice, beans and soup come with most entrees. I checked in on Yelp and got a free Margarita which was also good and refreshing. The waiters were very nice, friendly and attentive. We really had a great experience at Bonito Michoacan tonight and will definitely come back.

QWp8HEnWn_MOjvrsDeLdiQ.text: We came for the Preparados - also referred to as Michelada - so yummy and refreshing when you feel a little crappy after too many drinks the night before. They're very satisfying here.  I also got the cactus appetizer which was super juicy and fresh, very large portion, too. My friend got the steak with rice and beans and the steak was super flavorful and tender.  The beans they serve have so much flavor and I ate them w chips over the salsa because the salsa gave me a crazy cough attack (I think a little bit of pepper was stuck in my throat) which was embarrassing and something I didn't want to happen again lol Also, the service was really good. We were laughing because I would ask for something and they would bring it two seconds later. We started to think they could read our minds!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Preparado/michelada - so refreshing and delicious

D99kY6hDLdT8Q45rA3zZyA.text: This is a really great Mexican restaurant! I came in for brunch on a Sunday and although it was busy we didn't have to wait for a table. The hostess asked if we minded a booth in the bar area, which we didn't at all, and it was lively and fun! There was a live singer and our waitress/bartender was warm and friendly. I had a specialty concoction that she made for me which was a cucumber jalapeno margarita, and it was delicious and super spicy. For my meal I had the Chilaquiles with green sauce and scrambled eggs, and I saw there was an option to add chicken so I did. It was delicious however I would leave the chicken off next time since it didn't add anything to the dish. I thought it would likely be shredded chicken mixed in but instead was just a chicken breast on top, not bad but totally unnecessary for the dish. I really liked the vibe here and the food, the menu is huge so lots of options of delicious things to try. I will definitely come back next time I'm craving Mexican food!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles with chicken and scrambled eggs
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber Jalapeño margarita!

H0SdqAgfupxI_Ppt2nRZFw.text: THE BEST SHRIMP TACOS I'VE EVER HAD!!  And that's saying a lot considering I live in Vancouver!!   They came with this incredible "secret sauce", a recipe handed down in the family. I have no flipping idea what it was, but it was amazing.   The tacos were so fresh and incredible! This is now my place whenever I'm visiting Vegas I will go here and make my friends come with me. The ambiance was wonderful, it was decorated in a very traditional eclectic Mexican way, had a really nice feel to it. In fact, when I was driving by I looked at this place and thought to myself "I bet that place is really good." So I checked out reviews and the website later that evening and went the very next day. I was not disappointed at all.   Even the starter soup that came with my dish was so delicious! I didn't even know it came with a starter soup, so it was a really nice surprise!  The owner was there walking around being friendly to customers, it was really nice. Had a really positive feel to the entire restaurant that truly added something special to the experience.   I can't wait to go back.   M.M.

hTLXi_0BIx2GVjsUKNINvA.text: We got there when there was no people, seemed like it was only one person working the whole restaurant. I asked for napkins never got them ask for refills no refills. This was my second time here and I was so excited to eat here brought my mother in law to try. Felt so embarrassed because service was horrible. I just give them 3 starts only because food is good:/

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What kind of chips are those because they freaking disappear lol bomb

x2ahR39lm2Up65pxnUJBrA.text: Can't even start this review without first giving a shout out to our awesome waiter, Richard. He made sure every part of our dinner was excellent. And he did it with grace and humor :)   We got: The Cucumber Lime Margarita with Tajin rim, crisp and refreshing. Albongias soup, omg like someone's abuela is in back making those balls by hand. Platter with pork green chili and chili relleno, everything tender and flavorful. Plus a taco pescado a la carte. Mojarra Fritta, which Richard took care to ensure I knew what I was getting. A whole fried fish--bones, head and all. Didn't bother me! Insanely delicious, coated with dry spices and deep fried to perfection. Bones were easily dealt with, despite the low lighting.  And, since Richard learned it was our anniversary, he hooked us up with sombreros, tequila shots and churros with whipped cream, all while he and his coworkers serenaded us.  It was a perfect dinner and we will definitely return!

DIhLAIdaRHuBQpPRfPvFNg.text: First thing to say is Jonanthan was AWESOME.... MAKE HIM YOUR WAITER AND I PROMISE YOU WILL ENJOY. very knowledgeable and helpful, had a smile the whole time, while helping my wife who is not familiar with Mexican food.   This was our first time eating here. I went in with very low expectations and they were blown out of the water....   P.S. I want to call the cops in this place cause the served us so much and so good it should be a crime...   P.S.S. Jonathan had to be trained by Mr. Miyagi, cause he is the best around.

ALA5wWil2zkWy1M6MC5_CA.text: Awesome food great customer service, food came a no time, love their homemade tortillas definitely will be going back when I visit Las Vegas again

UaGtAlMdzVSJxzYD9Hd2hw.text: It was lunchtime and we were in the mood for Mexican. This place seemed to have a high rating on Yelp so we thought we'd give it a try.  We arrived and had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. No problem. If the foods good I don't mind waiting.  Unfortunately we weren't impressed with their food. We found it to be very average.  We were seated near some guy on a stage who thought he could sing. He was so loud we couldn't hardly talk to each other.  The place was very noisy. The waiter was not very attentive.   I wish the food would have been better. The decor was awesome!! Unfortunately, for us, that was the only good part. And unfortunately the decor is not the main reason we visit a restaurant.

DmHgYQYktNw_SgmPa-fYXg.text: I came to this place with my family looking for an authentic Mexican food place and I loved it staring with the salsa they got me and the rest of the food very delicious, thank you yelp reviewers!!

O6RfLHPGsP2fTcdJBaV9wA.text: Great Mexican restaurant! Food was great and the margaritas even better but our busser definitely made the experience even more pleasant. Daniel was a very well mannered young gentleman. He accommodated everything and was very knowledgeable more than our actual waiter and host!! He was working hard helping others but was always attentive with us. Definitely recommend. Thank you Daniel for a great experience, my husband and I will definitely be coming back soon!

8xKspS4MfQkVcJJVy5fJHg.text: My dad likes this restaurant so I went to buy him a gift card. They started to process my gift card, but after waiting over 30 minutes, they could not tell me much long it would be. I asked to speak to the manager, he came over, ignored me and then walked away. I walked out and called them, asked to be transfered to the manager and they hung up! Worst customer service!

w_KrFoea9u8Ey1f5Y4G-9g.text: Charming place with amazing service!  As soon as we sat down, we were greeted with free salsa and chips! Those were delicious. The food is good and well priced. What really stood out was their prompt and friendly service. The restaurant was busy but yet our server visited our table constantly to check on us! We will definitely be coming back!

cezdElPMCiGIyO4tsbt_Pw.text: Outstanding Tampiqueno steak!  Large sized steak- so tender it rivaled expensive cuts and prep in top Steakhouses!  Worth every penny- served with a cheese enchilada. Lots of food- kept bragging about the tender steak cooked exactly to my request.  Treat yourself!

tBixa0DiYPNbtjSAFJMF3w.text: Truly the best and most authentic Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas! Their happy hour specials are just as fulfilling as their regular menu and i come for both! VFG7FtmebaL9Csqd_D_6tQ.text: First time here today with my girlfriend to eat lunch. We have been driving by here for a while and finally stopped to try it. We are so happy we did. The lunch special was a great deal. The place is super clean, the music is nice, food is amazing, and the staff are really friendly. Our server Israel was very knowledgable on the food and very personal. We loved that and had a great conversation. That shows they care about their customers. Thanks so much for the awesome lunch and look forward to coming back again soon. Highly recommend for locals and tourists in town looking for great Mexican food.

I had the cilantro steak which was cooked to perfection and flavorful with a nice acidic bite.  The first time I ordered the chicken fajitas and those are awesome too.  The flour tortillas are addicting...I'm serious! I asked for more tortillas just to eat plain. You can't go wrong with the table-side guacamole as a starter.

6cEIhufVmIxf_H9tVy3gNA.text: This place is hands down the best Mexican food in town. Born and Raised in Las Vegas and this has definitely been our place for Mexican food. The staff is always amazing. fW2RZUURnNpR95fhEY4Juw.text: Great service and table side guacamole. Lots of free stuff like soup and chips and salsa while you wait for the food. I got the burrito and oysters for starters. Food was excellent. Will be back for more. Friendly waiters were super attentive and stressed up in white shirts. Birthday songs and the whole 9 yards.   Yum yum.

l68PIqFQuNR9Lcd0m4dx1Q.text: Seriously! Why would anyone ever go to Lindo.... So they can pay double for 1/2 the flavor?  Bonitos is the best.  Cheap, yummy, fun, great service! Eat here!  Get the pollo sarendeado tia esther!

L6Kr5Zg-MYhBQzSRrsFJpw.text: Top notch Mexican food, if you're in the area make sure to stop here if u like Mex food; aside from the great food it has an awesome atmosphere and great customer service.

yo4T1srfwVTrCdU0Pn883A.text: Another great meal (and I ate too much!). Service was great, nice atmosphere and live music that is not obnoxious. This is an main stay for Mexican food with plenty of options to choose from. Great margaritas!

7O_4eskTCej4QaDjFB2YJg.text: After an all day trip to Death Valley and back my aunt recommended this place.  First and foremost the atmosphere and customer service was exceptional.  I had the Uruapan combo which had green pork and bean burrito, beef enchilada, and chicken taco.  A very tasty and esoteric medley.  I will certainly be recommending and experiencing this place again the next time I'm in Vegas.

FuKPMA2ivFIqbrAeXoAWyg.text: I'm from California and will travel to Las Vegas just to have breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks... This restaurant is worth the drive!  The old saying in Vegas "Save water, drink Margaritas!"   Love the cheesy bean dip, fresh avocado dip, and fresh tortillas... OMG soo good! I must go back ASAP!

wlFYS_2cq08ayit0WguvKw.text: Love this place. The food and the staff are amazing. Only had one bad experience but it was late night and I think both me and my server were too exhausted to understand each other. My go to spot for Mexican and love the margaritas (on the rocks of course).

GNDRWVw-xw9Ax7Oz2FpSww.text: We've been going to Bonito's for a few years and I'm not sure why I haven't added a review yet.. Anyways the food is great, the staff is friendly and it's a fun place to go.  Juan the waiter is a superstar and I think he has quite a following.  Always hugs both my husband and I when we arrive and leave. The guacamole made at your table is so good, and last night I tried their ceviche for the first time and that too was yummy!  Of course the margaritas aren't bad either!  Love this place!

s756P6-u4SkrNqYvvy_LMg.text: This is the place for Mexican food in Vegas. We go every time we're in town for both our daughter's softball tournaments and it's always satisfying. The salsa and beans they start you off with are great. The guacamole is made table side and you choose what you want on it. Almost every plate comes with a hefty serving of guacamole as well. If you check in they give u a margarita. It's always packed hit the service is great. Your cup will never empty.. Even with the Aguas Frescas. Their food is authentic and a reasonable price compared to similar higher end Mexican restaurants in the LA area.

dKo4gEd5VVgTflK5jnncDQ.text: Okay HI! We tried a different place each night on this last little jaunt to Vegas and because I am so much of a Smartina Navratolova I wanted Mexican food and so I went to my Yelp app on my Smart phone and searched for a highly rated restaurant with reasonable prices and Bonito Michoacan came right up.  We were in the neighborhood (my brother in law is Chinese) so we hung a U and drove right into the parking lot (yeah buddy they even have parking fa YA)!   We went inside and the place is beautiful.  There is a beautiful woman who hand makes tortillas RIGHT there. I love that.   The bathrooms are beautifully decorated ...beautiful I LOVE the copper basins.  The whole place is colorful,extremely inviting and interesting.   So we walk inside from hot to cool.  We are greeted by a young woman with a beautiful smile and they have a table ready for us (party of 7).  They bring over these hot chips, with warm bean dip AND really delicious salsa.  (This is new, most places offer salsa and chips and that's it right?)   Then a very nice gentleman asks if we would like drinks YEAH! We order 3 top shelf frozen margaritas (two plain, one mango) and my Mother said it was the best margarita she's ever had...they came out quickly, very well blended and huge (meets all my criteria :-)    So far ...I AM IN HEAVEN I thought...but then we hear music and there is a male singer who sings a beautiful array of Spanish dinner songs and even one Bossa Nova (EYE EYE YEY) Now I am in heaven.  So we check the menu, very reasonable prices, I ordered the Steak Ranchero medium rare, my Mom ordered SHRIMP Ranchero and there were 5 other orders ...I was a little too busy with my margarita to tell you what they got but I can tell you they were all happy.  We did not have room for dessert this time but I am definitely going back next time I get to Vegas and I will update this report when I do okay?   The food was fresh, tasty, hot and it came out of the kitchen quickly.  I had to get a to go box and so did my mother.    They offer hot tortillas, with butter if you ask and the service was oN POINT. Friendly, polite, sweet and generous. My mother said she loved that place and believe me ...she is usually a ...well... a mother.   I have not felt as if I got MORE than my money's worth in quite a long time but (well technically since I didn't pay ...oh you get the picture)   Very very good find, thanks yelp, thanks everyone who rated this restaurant because you all helped make a great evening possible for my family.  My mother has been ill and we thought this trip would cheer her up and she loved this place so much, we all did.   Now you go and eat there and bring your family and friends ( I saw a wedding party y'all) and tell me how you liked it.  I know you are going to be so happy! Go now.

vToaPEj7YEq05Hr89MUXWQ.text: Totally disappointed. Just had my wedding reception dinner here. Staff was rude, they were telling my party they were to busy! When we had our entrance not one staff member asked if we wanted anything to drink or eat. I was told our event would be private and so was charged per person peope we didn't know were seated with us. But last but not least my wedding cake was delivered a day before but was never brought out. so my 50 person cake went to my hotel with me. All i got was a sorry.. But they were never to busy to take $1,200 from us!! I can tell you food is great but having an event here I would say no. I had another place in mind and should have stuck with it totally my fault.

WktjROUZAakV3VLS44lcFw.text: Best borito in town and there chiros are great not too sweet service here is good too soft drinks are bottomless our drinks never got half way before it was refilled we like coming here for lunch.  We are going to try there dinner next

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best borito in town

HhPe2oksF08mR3HSeyzyaA.text: Good food when there open. Whenever that maybe ?? They have been closed three times since the first of the year for BS reasons. Most recently on May 1st .. the reason was to show support for there employees for employee appreciation day. My employer didn't close did yours ?? I was a regular but I have moved on. There is plenty of alternatives in Vegas to eat lunch. Maybe if the owners focused on business instead of being politically correct they would be better off. You have lost my business for good !

3hnzFTKjh_AaqOHI1UrJvQ.text: This place has AMAZING Mexican food!!! Serving portions were big and the prices were right! Be sure to check in on YELP for a free margarita, then vote for them through text and receive a SECOND free margarita!!! Can't beat that!!   I showed up with a friend who was having his birthday dinner there and our server "Richard" took great care of us. He was funny, entertaining, and attentive to our needs. He recommended the prime rib carne asada plate and it definitely did not disappoint! He kept the drinks coming and even showed us how to get the free margaritas on the house by voting on text and checking in through YELP.  He also recommended the sampler special and made us fresh guacamole and dip at the table side. Real funny guy also.  If you show up at dinner you also get treated to listen to their one man mariachi band on the keyboard doing his thing lol. 5 stars for EXCELLENT service. Will definitely be back if I'm craving for some Mexican food!

o12wtxTumhA70itYGGcrPA.text: This place is fantastic. Very Mexican looking, a large restaurant with plenty of seating.  Staff is wonderful and very attentive all the time. They have an extensive menu and their food is really good.  They even make plates that are not listed in the menu. I always get the "Pollo Milanesa".  They have a live band as well.  Their tortillas are so so so fresh and so so so yummy. You can have a soup with your plate as well.  Their prices are great and you get a lot of food. Their chips are really good and they come with salsa and bean dip.

PSdNbtuJucdCN3I8bb2_8Q.text: I really like the food here.  My standard is the Tacos con Carne Asada.  It;s very similar to Tacos al Carbon which is grilled meat, with rice & beans.    I also like the bean dip and salsa they provide for free. Refills are no problem and the service when I've there (3 times) has been quick and friendly.    The last two times there was a guy on an electric keyboard playing which was (ahem) interesting.  Depends on your musical taste, but played a lot of cheesy 70's toons.  Overall solid choice for Mexican, I'll be back.

Fp8ze_4Fc8yShwUIq2mMBg.text: My favotiate Mexican in Vegas! Since I moved here it's the one neighborhood spot I always come to. The staff is great and food never fails me.

YdksKoZJC1VHFIXVb9stng.text: Came here for some awesome menudo. First time ever! The service was amazing. Hand made tortillas. The Agua de Limon bombness in its self. Great for hangover food. Customer service on point. Went around 12pm and it starts getting packed. Come early for the afternoon type a feeling. Atmosphere was like you were in that setting of amazing culture!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menudo!!!

cZtypGxCv6YoDd-eYlOdjQ.text: Food was delicious  Margaritas are very good!!! Love the beans and salsa with chips.  Shrimp chili rellenos were awesome.  Camarones al conac were fantastic  Will return next time I'm in town.

qi4hhuANYMvOA9YXlDt94A.text: I love this place! Great service, food and usually there's fun music. Ask for the extra spicy salsa (not just the habanero one) because it's delish!   It's a go-to for date night when we don't want to spend a bumch of money.

1I9inrX7B90TXOnDrYd_hw.text: I moved to Las Vegas from Phoenix where excellent Mexican food is very common. Which surprisingly, is not the case for Las Vegas. But alas, after almost 3 years in sin city and my search for a great Mexican spot has finally ended........and although i cant pronounce the name of this joint, it is delicious! and not over priced! Make sure to get the guacamole! (SP?)  Hand made to your taste, right at your table, just how it is suppose to be made! I have only been there on one occasion and it was packed, which is understandable, however i don't enjoy eating in overly crowded restaurants (which is the only thing holding back from a 5 star rating)

-dqO9x9rgdmTYRL_XdH-KA.text: I totally forgot to take a pic of my food! UGHH   I love Lindo Michoacan and this is their sister restaurant. cyVyCMBKeBY6d5nZQgQjqg.text: Good food for sure the best place in town  Highly recommend to this anybody that likes Mexican food.

XOONZwFGf9kteO4LBt_emA.text: My favorite place to go to get some delicious Mexican food! The atmosphere is fun and service is always great! I love the steak plate and crave it most the time.. Its a frequent place for my family! Definitely recommend this place!!!

lL9ymE48PqL6K984JsgCrQ.text: This place is amazing!! The menudo they still had some at 130pm most places are out by 10am. The menudo tasted so clean and freshly made. TH8handg8QCbWRRDiV8Jog.text: Terrific authentic Mexican. I try to stop by each time I visit Vegas. Not the fanciest place but none the less it was clean, and the food and service were excellent!

eHGyHXHGgIiSFN2FzGt5vQ.text: Food was excellent. I got a carne asada burrito. It was huge, but could've used a bit more guacamole. My girlfriend got a ceviche tostada which she thought was perfect. We will be returning next time we come back to Las Vegas.

If you don't mind that part and are just there for food and drinks I would def recommend if you're a person with no to tolerance for wait times search for your Mexican food fix elsewhere

hZKF59rmmneK4h0Rli8HLA.text: All food was great!! Chili verde chimichanga enchilada style was delicious! They have a hot green salsa that's amazing add to chimichanga and omg even better. Margaritas are super tasty too.  Atmosphere is authentic and food was too.

LDrX5DYSmLnMF7A37eOINQ.text: Nice place to get away from the strip for authentic Mexican food. Nice atmosphere, all the waiters are in traditional Mexican clothing and the food was also good. Be prepared for long waits to be attended and for food to be served.

LAnGlHRdZKPq0IaWMX4reA.text: Best part was the free frozen margarita with a yelp check in. Guacamole made fresh at your table. Great service, tons of food, reasonable prices. Took left overs that lasted 2 days lol.

pGRBIOkYeb_NJeanWlk_Qg.text: The very best in Las Vegas. Prompt and polite service and always the best chicken fajitas! I've loved this place forever and will continue to come here always

OcSK8qZE7zFEcbhnPnmBcg.text: My favorite mexican restaurant. Atmosphere is awesome. Food is unlike what you get at other restaurants its authentic mexican food. The peach Margarita is my favorite! XidQ7TcuKqGGaSq-u6zthA.text: This is a great place to eat!!! The staff are great! Armando was our waiter. He was friendly and courteous!! We are definitely coming back here!

pdx4d4-nOyTjvbxaSB2MKQ.text: Awesome service and food! Our server Richard was awesome. Great carnitas and very innovative menu! The churros were yummy!!!  We will definitely return and recommend!

t2el1Ay2QVqgAVX5sds-oA.text: We went on a Friday evening fairly early. We were seated quickly and our drink orders were taken right away. The food was great, and the portion sizes were perfect!  Now why the 3 Stars... There was a yelp offer for a free margarita, so I ordered that. The waiter was a young guy and he was nice enough and gave us great service at first. When I showed him the coupon for the margarita he said I got the small margarita and the coupon was for an even smaller one, but he could bring me the other size instead if I wanted.  That was nice, but seemed kind of dumb to waste one for a fresh one just for a silly coupon so I declined. We ordered our food and it came out quickly.  Then things turned, the section we had been seated in started filling up with large parties, three that I could see, two were large tables worth and one was a group of ladies that they seated right next to our booth. We could barely hear each other talk. Our waiter never came back to our table to check on us and when we were done we sat for about 30 minutes with an empty table waiting for our check.  Finally the young man that brought our chips and salsa came and checked on us and ended up bringing us our check. Our waiter was clearly busy with these large parties as he was slammed with back to back tables of people and we paid the price for it. As we were leaving the rest of the restaurant was quiet and almost had no one in it. I felt bad for our waiter and I was glad I did not "punish" him tip wise.   We will try this place again, maybe in the middle of the week next time. Maybe I'll even get to use a coupon if I have another one.

QwWYE8VXgIZXxAUVMqd-hA.text: My best Mexican food experience in Las Vegas.  The service is excellent, friendly personnel We were all very satisfied with the delicious taste  Of every single dish we tried.   We love this place !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorditas De Camaron Gorditas De Camaron

-9KXV5Nore5FTH367lCX4w.text: I'm not from around here but ended up down here on a  recommendation and was pleasantly surprised as soon as I walked in , it was a beautiful restaurant, live music was playing and the vibe was classy, upon check in they did indeed honor the yelp check in offer and I ended up enjoying the margarita which was super good, so fresh and so clean , clean . I ended up with the chicken plate which was very good, tasty and plentiful. The service was good , the complimentary chips and salsa were great, the place was clean, lively and I will definitely come back when I'm back in Las Vegas, great place for a good time and a good meal . Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entryway artwork

M97Gr3aR-dxHKC_2a_8-wA.text: Food was great, service was meh. Check in on yelp, get the free margarita, and upset your server :) We got eye rolls once we showed our check in on yelp. Maybe tell your manager to take the deal off yelp then?  The table side guacamole was good, but we said make it the spiciest and it wasn't spicy at all.   My roommate ordered her food with double beans and no rice and she did not receive that. She even brought it up and nothing was done about it.  No chips and salsa refills until we asked and once we asked it took forever to come to us.  Server was non attentive to us.   Shrimp tacos were good :) My bf's picado was great he says :)

7IE2cUJqV581tN0fk4KfvQ.text: This is a decent Mexican choice in Vegas though didn't blow us away.   The decor is very traditional Mexican but overall had a nice feeling and was cluttered but cool.   They have a very extensive menu; be sure to check-in for your free margarita!  They serve one complimentary round of chips and salsa and beans. Refills are about $3.50. Staff were very friendly and responsive. Soft drinks were refilled quickly and proactively.   The chips and salsa were good. The chips were crunchy and not greasy while the salsa was fresh though not terribly spicy.   I tried the chicken "Dr Francisco."  Grilled chicken breast with light olive oil seasoning and served with prunes. Quite a unique and tasty dish.  Tender chicken, and the prunes actually went well with it.   For dessert we had the fried ice cream flambe which means it was set on fire at the table and burned briefly. This was a bit of a miss. It tasted basically like a scoop of ice cream rolled in slightly burned cornflakes.    Overall this was a decent meal with quite good service. It wasn't extraordinary but also wasn't really too bad. I would be willing to try it again though it didn't quite live up to the rave reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Included soup
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &#34;Doctor Francisco&#34;
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita - free with checkin!

FmI6GERhKISbV9rkPh8D6A.text: This is really good food. Take the same food to the strip and serve it on upscale dish ware around fancy decor and people would be willing to pay triple. The pork was fantastic, verde sauce was bright and flavorful, chips and beans to start were a great touch.   We came here on the recommendation of a friend and despite our skepticism it really was good. We even got 2 free margaritas with a yelp check in. 4.5 stars but rounding up for great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La Cuzuela for 2 and pork carnitas.

OIbz45hKZBT_jlLCVg5OYg.text: For our last night in Vegas, my colleague requested authentic Mexican food off the strip. After checking yelp and talking to a few locals, they all mentioned Bonitos. So after the CES show, we made our way here.  For starters they gave us chips, bean dip, salsa and some tomato noodle soup for free! We ordered ceviche to share and for myself I got a whole fried fish tilapia with sauce on the side and a mangonada margarita. The sauce that was served with the fish was so fricking delicious! The magonada margarita was refreshing and reminded me of those lollipop mango candies I use to buy from the ice cream truck.  Service was exceptional, super friendly and attentive. I can see why the locals in vegas love this place!

aORHzv6HGoW-6roZjbukPw.text: One start just because of the waitress poor service. She was so concerned about a large party not leaving her tips that completely forgot about us. We wanted more food, more drinks, dessert but there was no one to help us. Won't be back.

Ef_qL9NJhN8UOB0E-H7ehA.text: I have been coming here for years with my family but after how i was treated last night i will never return again! Food was less then average..cold rice little portions and i got screwed on the bill! Do not use a prepaid mastercard they will give you 80% value and short you the rest! My bill was $119.20. The kicker here is the manager Gerardo is a crook. He said i should have known that about prepaid gift cards! He never said sorry and i had to chase him the next day for my money since he double charged me. Go somewhere else like flaming Fajitas! Hell of lot better food and service.

14zM7zV6ACoeSajWHi2jHQ.text: Excellent place recommended from two Las Vegas residents to have real Mexican meal and they were right! Extensive menu and hard to pick what to have for lunch. They have great lunch deals on weekdays. They serve your table free chips, spicy salsa, bean dip and tomato soup with noodles in it.  For a moment I thought I was in a Korean restaurant that gives you free Banchan  dishes. Good portions size. I and my companions will definitely return again! Friendly service. Free photo of your party as a keepsake which was an unexpected surprise which made the meal more memorable. So much food with the pork carnitas which is probably great for dinner, but not for lunch, unless you are starving. Ha! Ha! Ha!  The two chile rellenos were excellent and cheesy as I ordered the combo that came with beef taco, beans, rice and some salad.   Had to get doggie bag to go. Yummy.

jiFw-jcXmE8Q88xneFk1Aw.text: This is one of the most authentic Mexican restaurants I've been to in the Vegas area. All of the staff were friendly and very helpful.  The meal started with complimentary chips, salsa, and bean dip. The salsa was a little too spicy for me, but it had the right amount of spice and saltiness. The bean dip was very good; it was smooth and not overpowering, pairing well with the warm, fresh tortilla chips. The meal also came with a Fideo; it was hot and perfect for the cold night. The tomato flavor was amazing and the onion gave it a slight kick.   I had the Enchiladas Michoacanas with steak and it was amazing! The warm tortillas were filled with cotija cheese that crumbled delicately; it had a saltiness that paired well with the enchilada sauce. The steak was cooked to perfection as well. It was a medium rare with a hot pink center that was easy to cut through and delicious to eat. It was seasoned lightly, as the steak did not need any extra flavors to make it stand out. When paired with the enchilada - AMAZING! When put together, the flavors had a good harmony and the dish was absolutely enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides with fajita
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchilada with steak, 4/5
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas, 4/5

t2Az8UWl7ZaT9lZrydXsaQ.text: I LOVE good authentic Mexican food! I enjoy a fun and colorful atmosphere and you will feel it here! The optimistic service is always a bonus aside from the delicious food!  I tried something new this time and it was Sopes, grilled chicken as my choice of meat. It was 3 generous delicious fried disk of flavor!  I enjoy the complimentary beans, salsa and chips!  The Staff is Amazing in making for a fun dining experience, consistent drink refills and live music!  We will be back for more yum yum and fun fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sopes!

ygDFWUy00ooQC_VAu_bjtA.text: Delicious and beautifully decorated! Live music on the weekends!! Servers seem to have a "greater than thou" / cocky attitude. Before tipping we asked the assistant server if they share tips because she did soooo much more serving us then the "head server". She said "when the head server feels like it."  Broke our hearts, unfair working environment, but delicious food FUN FUN FUN atmosphere! Go and then them it's your birthday!

t3t6zoCv48nxtdg0kYzW7Q.text: Everytime I'm in vegas is a MUST...food is great never disappoints...from the chips and salsa..fideo soup...anything on the menu..I recommend Carne al cilantro...

P_SfxTXDqPB7dldcSdZfcA.text: Our server was like one of the staff working at a resort in Cabo; he was super friendly, super on top of everything, and had off-the-cuff and scripted jokes and zingers for days. Sombreros off to Richard (per the receipt)!  We were also seated right next to the singer/piano player and he was a regular Mexican Sinatra. He knew the right songs to play at the right time at the right decibel. A True sign of someone who knows how to read a dining room. If we didn't have to head back to LA that day, I think we all would have sat there for hours eating their fresh AF guacamole (honestly, why can't I make it like this at home when I have all the same ingredients?!?) with chips, throwing back their refreshing AF micheladas, and singing/dancing with the whole Bonito crew. Clearly, they know how to AF things.  The place was packed with huge groups of locals, so you know it's a legit, off-the-strip joint. There's bar seating if you're by yourself or with an amigo and a handful of booths, but clearly this place specializes in big parties of people.   The salsa was a little off for some of us (it left a weird aftertaste), but the guac and homemade chips more than made up for it.  Everyone seemed to really love their dishes, but I can only speak for the tortilla soup with handmade flour tortillas (I think most dishes come with the option of corn or flour tortillas - just get the flour; even Richard said so). The soup was plentiful, had just the perfect amount of grease coating the top, and the broth was super flavorful.  And again, the micheladas went down like water...if water was a michelada.  Would definitely make my way back the next time I'm in Vegas, and hopefully with more time on my hands.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tortilla soup

1-TKZb1tlbDVpfO12LpXsQ.text: Took some friends from out of town for breakfast- the wait staff was nice but he forgot to bring water after me asking twice.  The food was fresh and my friends enjoyed themselves

cHhX52bnbkHMPC4NxoT9-Q.text: When we first arrived a lot of people were seated before us so I was upset and spoke with the manager. He kindly explained that our unique party of 5 would need a little more time to seat as they mostly have booths for twos, fours, and large tables that were already reserved. Not long after we were seated and the manager and waiters made our experience unforgettable. Not only was service excellent but the food was very delicious and authentic. They have so many options. My whole family loved their food. I'm only sad that this restaurant is all the way in Vegas. We need Bonito Michoacan in California. I'll definitely go back whenever we visit again. Thank you to the manager and waiters for helping make my family vacation so great.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork and Guacamole burritos with rice and beans.  The chips are freshly made and served with salsa beans on the side. Everything was perfect

Zw5uiodUAKzvo66wVTgUtw.text: Found this place on accident while in Vegas! Great place! Great decor! Great food! Great service! Very authentic. Will be returning in my next visit to Vegas. I would have posted photos BUT we ate it all.

fdjF_KpQKchPWvqWoWyvTQ.text: Consistently delicious! Great lunch specials and good service. Love the sopa de fidelo soup it's sooo good!

0AwT3zjvxZuGKpSDc-_CBA.text: ...sigh  There was a time when eating at this restaurant was the best part of my Vegas trip. My stomach still feels that way, but my wallet no longer agrees.  While their "Queso Fundido" is still one of the best in the American Southwest, don't expect the same level of quality from their sub-par Margarita.  Aside from being "slurpee-esque," the price almost made me choke on the free chips (which are a major saving-grace). $12 for a SINGLE MARGARITA?!  The two I ordered drove the bill up by almost $25! For that price, I'll hire a LADY named Margarita to love me for the night (or hour).  Also, as big as the cheese skillets were, they brought a mere 3 tortillas for us ravenous patrons to savagely fight over. When we asked for more, we still had to wait another 10 minutes, all the while staring at the delicious but forbidden cheese sitting before us!  It's not like we could use our hands! Utensils are what seperate us from the animals!

i1vK8CWDv1t4-uHI2f4o1g.text: This is by far my favorite Mexican place in Vegas. Perhaps the entire west coast. Authentic feel from the ambience to the servers. Dishes are large and full of maximum flavor.

lpW-3lNXHMED28sv6QQNow.text: Food Good! service eh.many better places in town.... not much to see here, but the diehard mexican food fans wont be too disappointed, there are just alot of places in town that do it better!

JH_UavfrOOuQ1jrOzSt7AQ.text: This has always been my favorite Mexican restaurant especially for lunch. For over two years I've ordered lunch  here... never a problem. But today we ordered the green chili burritos there was literally about three chunks of meat in it along with a spoonful of beans and it was the flattest burrito I've ever seen. There was a spoonful of beans on the side and a fair portion of rice. Typically when we order and pick up we get the lunch special which includes one order of being dip and chips and a drink. Today there were  no chips ...just a container of salsa. I know sometimes things happen I hope this is just a rare occasion!  we'll give it one more shot but we were really disappointed. I hope this isn't another case of great restaurant gone bad.

1e4INB8nu6oL3xtrjFcV4A.text: Food was great and so was the service. They make you feel like you are at home. The only bad thing is that you leave in a food coma since all the food is beyond amazing !!! My props to waiter Violeta and Mario for the great service.

M26U3mxZ_Dcy43m4SVfOWQ.text: First time here. Recommended by my compadre. I am impressed. The service was fabulous. Julio was great! He was friendly and he even gave my kid a complimentary sopa de fideo. Maybe because I told him I was going to split my meal with him and he felt bad. Hehe. 3 of us ordered the beef machaca. Our plates were left clean. Two others ordered huevos rancheros. Plates were left clean. It's located about 3 miles from the Orleans.

5WDEtgxf2UaAqj_8a9gBnQ.text: Found this restaurant via Yelp. The complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip was great. The peach margarita was good, but needed more tequila for the $14.00 price. The food was average. Although I purchased the group photo for memorabilia, the Photograher was horrible. Would not return.

4ddfC07JtWvnPnIEohb_xQ.text: Every time I would drive by this restaurant the parking lots always at its max capacity.  So finally on a slower day I decided to give it a try :P  The ambience was highly energetic.  All the coworkers  gathered and sang two different birthdays.  The decor was very colorful and gave the Spanish vibe.  As I looked their menu I was getting pretty  full eating their complimentary snack- chip and dips.  They had bean, salsa and guacamole (this was extra $8)  :P  what was so awesome, was how they made the guacamole right in front of us!  Two whole avocados and get to tell them how spicy you like it.  Then they also give this comp soup cup - chicken/tomato I think ? It was pretty delicious.   Their cilantro steak ($16) was very tender - I ordered the steak medium rare.  They had  Green sauce with sauteed onions on top of the steak.  It came as a combo - with rice and beans.    I also tried their chile relleno burrito ($8.95).  I wasn't too impressed with it.  This is what I would order at any other Mexican fast food chains, but this restaurant made it like an enchilada style - with tomato salsa over it.   Maybe next time I'll tell them just like a regular burrito with beans and rice inside the burrito and no sauce on top :P

_ELc_0Kzya-NNiMPO7wwRg.text: This place is delicious!!!  The atmosphere is very traditional and expected. The food was amazing. Had the tamal and enchilada and it was amazing!!  The wait staff was pretty quick. Our waiter was a bit inattentive but I won't hold it against the restaurant.  Definitely worth checking out!!  Next time trying the mangoneada and tamarind ma

edg8S77C1Ncrsl26leEoUg.text: Great food and fun atmosphere. If you enjoy good Mexican food in a nice setting please check this place out.

BuIbK2h1DkzHnWSDH55t3A.text: Excellent chips and salsa Verde! Great device and they have a vegetarian fajitas which were very yummy!

8QdTxisNhbQlg5KAXpZBwg.text: Mexican food is a weakness of mine, especially since I'm supposed to et right for my blood type. However occasionally I will splurge and this is where I go!   Now the food is always excellent and I enjoy the atmosphere and even though the prices are still higher than I think they should be its a good stop to fulfill the craving.   I recently went to eat here with my husband,friend and little boy. The food came out hot and quick and they didn't miss a beat with filling our drinks. So they have great service. The only thing i wasn't found of is that the music was soooooo loud I couldn't hear my friend across the table. But that's really an observation rather than a complaint!   I will I back again and bring friends.

GIiYyX1YAt3exqnHjXS4Mg.text: The service is always great, even when they have a packed house. They also offer a good selection of vegetarian options. The alcoholic drinks are nice and the tortillas are a must try! This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas.

2ZcukzGmUwnXg4EmVX98OQ.text: Superb service. Sat in a bar booth.  Served immediately despite a heavy Valentine's Day crowd.  Food was awesome (carnitas michoacan). Highly recommended.  Would love to eat here again.

ivvRqzIuHBd-oWNRMKOTaw.text: Got the campechana and the ceviche and both were amazing. The soup was good and I love the salsa that comes with the chips. The only reason why they're getting 4/5 is because we waited an incredibly long time to get our orders taken. They were busy, but not so extreme as to where we should've waited the time that we did, but you have the chips to keep you busy anyways! Regardless, the food was great and so is the atmosphere.

ep74PTWLZlMwMc3qqTdC5g.text: First time i been there honesty the waiters are very nice and the food taste so good. Shrimp cocktail is alright to compare to others i have. Tostadas of shrimp are the bomb and also we had other plates which i heard they were  delicious. Agua frescas were good. I would recommend to someone else to come and eat there.

h5ZS9bEWks-AFKiepjlddg.text: Everything you expect from a great Mexican restaurant.  Very home-ish feel. Good food. Good service.  Parking lot in front of the restaurant. No wait on Saturday night for dinner.  Everyone in my party had something different and it was all delicious.    Will definitely be back.

swnQNGCMLGIhxJkZkGRDTg.text: The husband and I came here on a whim because I had an overwhelming craving for Mexican food. We searched via yelp and luckily were just down the street.  Juan might be the best server we have ever encountered- he was fun and personable. The food was authentic Mexican, genuine Michoacan flavor! We had the carnitas plate and eggs with shredded pork, highly recommend both dishes and this restaurant. We've decided to make this a tradition and stop here every time we come to Vegas!

o3kCjX7n5uboMWB7VPIQRw.text: Out of the way restaurant -- in more of a residential area -- but the food and service are great. Extensive menu. Never had a bad meal here. Try it. You'll like it. And a big hug to the lady who hand makes the fresh tortillas -- to die for. Love her.

dtg-aB6xtMZq_L8DSoXJGg.text: Came here with me and my 2 friends we instantly were seated. Sat down the food runner brought us chips, beans & salsa the beans were good the salsa good but a little bit to spicey for me. On yelp if you check in you get a free margarita it was delicious.  I ordered the 2 shredded beef tacos (comes with rice and beans) everything was delightful!  Also a mixed coctel the shrimp, ocotopus and oysters yum! The preparada and the coronarita perfect!  My friends scarfed down there food so overall wonderful Mexican food with good prices we never had to asl for anything.  Our waiter was on it!

UXqKCNsLB4x7j9pWAjNlzg.text: I came here to eat with my family and it was very good. Everything about this place is great. The customer service was good as well. The prices are decent nothing to complain about. I was recommended by a friend and her experience went very well as she had told me. Im looking forward to come back soon and I also recommend this place.

5FOqHMAP-nIw2GSKYNu8RQ.text: Thanks OMG  O. M. G.  SO GOOD GREAT PORTIONS and there's so much to look at services were excellent alsi

19D7fCJ_eZwEwId-eln2_g.text: As I was searching for another authentic Mexican food spot to try out, I decided to give this spot a try since the reviews were great.   The service was great from entering the restaurant by being greeting by the hostess and didn't have to wait for a table. Our server was very friendly and always checked up on us and right away we were served with chips, salsa, and beans. The salsa was okay I just wish it was more fresh than watery. I ordered the guacamole since everyone recommended it and it was delicious. You get to pick what you don't want in it because they make it in front of you. I went with the steak ranchero for dinner since I felt like some steak. I have to say it was made to my liking' not too salty and not too dry.   Can't wait to come back here and try another dish!

Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Ranchero...really good!
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh guacamole! Delicious!

WUXPXv2ozBatkHhYZ9hIGw.text: How awesome is it you get a free margarita with just your check-in! This is not a watered-down drink...it's a delicious and refreshing blended margarita!  Anyways... onto the review. As usual, I will split the review is three basic areas:  Facilities: Very clean and inviting, with an authentic flair. Sitting in this restaurant makes you forget you are in Vegas! Centrally located, its a great restaurant to visit if you are in the mood for some great food.  Service: There is an opportunity in this area. Although our drinks were always full and bussing was prompt, the staff could have been a bit friendlier. Do not expect smiles from your waiter.  Food: Probably some of the best Mexican food in Vegas. Any item on the menu is fresh and delicious! Do yourself a favor and try and try either the chicken or the steak with cognac sauce... it is out of this world!!!

fn07cEb2NxJTQOvr31Slrw.text: Great place to eat! Excellent authentic Mexican food  sope, enchiladas, taquitos, burritos & carnitas michoacan

Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food and awesome ambiance

iXgiyum-QlTJyCjkkbudLg.text: The happy hour here is awesome!  Great preparadas and margaritas.  The street tacos and the ceviche tostadas are bomb!!  The bartenders are all pretty hot too!  Very welcoming and give great customer service.

3_OuZKBQB7jW3JLbR-Gk3g.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant that reminds me of the authentic Mexican food found in So Cal! Great prices, free chips and salsa and bean dip, I love the deep fried taco combination and the fried ice cream! Every time I go to Vegas, I have to eat here! Very fun atmosphere and lots of singing for bdays also which makes this place extra fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream is a must! So good it will make u want a fried ice cream birthday cake!!!
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination plate! Best taco ever!!!

o5qgRYi77AW2ELotjLLBoQ.text: Why I keep coming this place? Well, Because I really like the authentic Mexican food and here you have it. My wife is from Michoacan and she said that the food is definitely authentic from Michoacan.  This time I ordered mole with chicken, oh wow. It was delicious. The pasta soup they serve is so tasteful. The margaritas are so delicious. The personal is so friendly. They speak English or Spanish. Your preference.

ryEiIkJPVdLgczYZ_w-_mw.text: Free Margarita with check in.  I got the steak with cheese enchilada, rice, and beans.  It also came with your choice of tortillas.  The complementary soup of fideo was to delicious!!! I would come back here again.  There are TVs throughout the place for game action too.
