x5AxJTc8Y1ON-epiYKXL5Q.text: The lunch was outstanding!  My wife had the Chicken Sopes, I had the De Cammaron Cocktail with shrimp, oysters and squid!  The serves was good, the bus girl Monica looked unhappy and had frown on her face the whole time.  In the past we have had Pedro as the bus boy and that guy set the bar high with great service and a smile, Monica not so much!  It was one of the best lunches in town, I  would recommend their food to everyone!

HxmjIgnwAII9PX1rBYqX2g.text: Ordered a Shirley Temple and didn't get something close. No cherries either. The Ceviche tasted and looked like imitation shrimp and the tostadas that came with it were so hard you could have broken a tooth.I found stems from the avocado in my Ceviche. I had to ask for a refill, more chips and the bill. The over weight sweaty waiter was not friendly at all. The only friendly one in there was the female waitress with blonde hair. She's a gem stuck in that hole. Wish I could post a pic but it's not giving me an option.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was not what I wanted at all! I asked for a Shirley Temple. You know...with cherries!

_CDa-C8JbuT5pwLGXJ9Svg.text: I'm from the Bay Area and omg this spot is so nice and good !! The waiter and busboy were there to help each other because we were a big group !! I love and enjoyed the spot here ! Will come agian !!

Wycj0YOGA9OLCr1xSdtLCA.text: Good mexican, good prices, great tableside guacamole.  A friendly atmosphere when you don't want "fast food" or "gourmet" mexican, but something in between. Not outstanding, but serviceable, decent food.

CgXFmTN46qQHbwiHsLGsuA.text: I'm surprised by all of the 4 and 5 star reviews for this place. I found the food to be very blah. Let me first say that the service was excellent. The servers were so friendly and checked on us often. If it weren't for them I would have given 2 stars.  The meal started off with chips, salsa and bean dip. The bean dip was ok but the beans really had no flavor and were very runny. The salsa was horrible.  It was also watery thin and had a weird flavor. After what I heard about this place I was excited to try the salsa but I prefer a chunky fresh salsa and this tastes like something from a can.  Then came a cup of Fideo Soup for us. This was tasty and it had a lot of noodle in it.   For my meal I had the #4 which consisted of a cheese enchilada, beef taco and a bean tostada with guacamole. Blah blah blah! The enchilada had barely any cheese in it and the sauce they put on top was as nasty and weird tasting as the salsa. The beef taco was cute and small but the beef had no flavor. My tostada had beans and tons of lettuce.. The small of guacamole I had was actually very tasty. I would never order this again I just didn't care for it and the taste. I could have done with out all the lettuce and had more of the other stuff on it.  My man had Fajitas and he said they weren't as good as Ricardo's or Cabo but he said they were decent. I tried a piece of his flour tortilla and I have to say I should have just ordered a stack of those and some guacamole because the tortillas were good. And the tortillas weren't small either they were a decent size.  The pic I took and posted on here looks way more appetizing then it really was. I tried to like it but I just honestly didn't :(  They had a man singing live music which was a nice touch. and happy hour specials  but during happy hour a margarita is still going to run you $4.50.  I don't see when we would be back here since there are other yummy Mexican places around town and especially with Ricardo's just down the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;The #4&#34; @ Bonito Michoacan - 8/7/12

OE8dazHE33H77a168akYGg.text: It's an amazing restaurant! I don't really like Mexican food but this place is changing my mind. I have lived in Vegas for 9 months and it's the first Mexican food restaurant that I actually like. The food is to die for.

2CZ--vWIPke6RzeQLtPKDw.text: Great place.  Big menu which means something for everyone.  The service was super fast.  Will be going back.

sifzd7ELQ1CcvAiECstDpw.text: Not bad! The staff is super nice.  This place has a bit more diversity in their menu than most of the Mexican food spots out there.  Their menu is fun.  Clearly lots of people like this place as it's always busy.   Service is great and the food is good.  It's slightly more expensive than others but I say it's worth it.  I will gladly return.

2dvgApQyFEB95YDULjquqg.text: Really good service and nice people. Really good food. Especially the fresh made guacamole and menudo. I would definitely recommend it. I would come back whenever I come back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menudo was delicious.

hL7Yql0xKq2X7KNEGY2X1w.text: Great Mexican food off of the strip. It's a short cab ride and was recommended to me by a local. There are a lot menu items to choose from, even some that are very traditional Mexican.   I had the Carne Asada which was very tasty, cooked perfectly and with the homemade tortillas were fantastic.  Nora, the bartender, had great service and made a really good margarita.   I would recommend this place to anyone in the Vegas area.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lot of food and really good carne asada.

xGyeJOIyzTQNBBvOS5HVBw.text: We checked in on yelp for the free margaritas, I was surprised and delighted that they were 2 margaritas on the rocks and not frozen overly sweetened blended margaritas.   This was a perfect way to start our meal,  while we were looking over the menu we were served chips, salsa and beans.   We were starving so that went pretty fast.   We then ordered our entrees,  I ordered the camerones al conac and he ordered camorones dionisio.  We were still hungry after the chips and salsa so we ordered chips and guacamole which they prepare tableside.   (You can definitely tell these servers do the tableside guacamole several times a day) it's nice that they ask if you want all the ingrediants and how spicy you would like your guac.  The guacamole was nice and refreshing with our margaritas.   Then our soup came.   The fideo soup was a small cup of tomatoey brothey noodle goodness,  I finished every last bite.  When our entrees came out, we both finished everything off our plates,  shrimp,  tortillas,  rice,  beans and a dallop of guacamole,  everything was good!   I enjoyed everything from the service to the margaritas to the appetizers to the entrees,  by this time we were pretty full so passed in the desserts,  I definitely recommend this place for the service,  atmosphere and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v33aXHD-9mLbaEaIZ5l8kw.text: Cozy atmosphere and great food. Get out of the casino and go eat authentic Mexican food. We took uber from Caesar Palace and with food was cheaper then one dinner at casino. Highly recommend!!

ixMHjqTR3-y4uPWEbvcwwQ.text: My lunch was delicious! The service was fast, our waiter Julio was very courteous, and the rest rooms were clean. I recommend this place for people who are looking for something off the strip when visiting Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aaron sitting in our both

Yg-unFI0g-A1LFJgWyxXJw.text: The food is on on point!  I ordered the carne asada and it was a full strip steak.  I loved it.  She had the cilantro chicken and it was great.  The chips and salsa with beans are some of the best in town.  Will definitely be back.  Great filling lunch specials too.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Ranchero kids. Muy Bueno!

gUDPIUD1zlIGe1rHE5ExhQ.text: Amazing Food and Experience! Took 4 others with me to celebrate my birthday. We made reservations earlier in the day for 6:30pm. We walked in and were sat immediately. They had a Yelp checkin that offered us a free margarita so we all checked in and got some. Our Servers were Awesome and they care very much about making our experience with them Wonderful. They sang to me with a band of fellow servers and gave me dessert and tequila slammer to top it off.  Needless to say we Highly recommend Bonita Michoacan!  Must try the carnitas and Enchiladas with green sauce.

2zKvR4LTY1FLux8RPAN8NA.text: I cannot believe I have not yet Yelped that Bonito Michoacan es muy bueno! I've eaten here several times with friends when I visit Vegas, but this time brought family here! I know they thought I was crazy leaving the strip, but I told them it was well worth the short trip! Two family members are Mexican and took a long time to study the menu. They are both from California and have never seen some of these entrees on a menu except in Mexico!  The complimentary bean dip is good and the tableside, fresh-made guacamole is the best! My niece does not usually eat guacamole and she loved it here! I've had some of the lengua dishes before and they are the best I've had! This trip I had the Biria de Chivo (a type of goat soup). I have not had goat since I was in Greece in the 90's and this was so tasty and tender with excellent spice. My only issue is that I did not have room for more! Oh, and let's not forget the margaritas! They actually make them with tequila...good and strong...wink, wink. Fantastico!  If you want to enjoy REAL Mexican food at a fraction of the price of restaurants on the strip, then this is the place! Great food, great service, great prices and more money for Blackjack!

lCopOqfcAIOEsY_MmN4WnA.text: Delicious. 1st timers and was not disappointed. The wifey ordered the cheese enchiladas but wanted white sauce, not red. Our server Richard, suggested another sauce cooked with cognac. Needless to say, wifey killed the plate. I ordered the chicken fajitas. Can't go wrong and didn't. The grilled tortillas were a nice touch. Will be back for sure.   PS, don't forget to check in on Yelp and get your free margarita.

yCoa9oYrgdBFR7OOc0ODlg.text: I went to Vegas with a large group of friends, and we decided to try this place out after it being highly recommended. The recommendation did not disappoint. It is about a couple miles off of the strip, and is situated in the middle part of a suburban area.   As soon as we got there, it was evident that this was going to be a great restaurant judging by how packed it was. There were nothing but locals here, and the waiters/waitresses were great! They were really funny and accommodating. There was live music playing in the background and I think there must have been at least 4 birthday celebrations while we were there. They make a huge deal about birthdays and even bring out the tambourines.  The food was excellent (I highly recommend the Steak Al Cilantro), the service was great, and the atmosphere was fun.  The prices were reasonable for the amount of food you get. Oh yeah, did I mention they give you fresh made tortillas?   Try this place out for some great Mexican food! You will not be disappointed!

oxOo0wMufgDVLO4bJTxIpQ.text: Free margaritas food was good but took a bit longer than expected to receive our food

r8w65A-3Yr3yG982djfQKw.text: The service was incredibly slow, are drinks or not kept up with, the hostess who seated us was upset we didn't want to sit in the back where we couldn't hear the music and gave us attitude when we requested to be moved and the food was just so-so.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RC_0EMBfxHIVr9uUnu4cOw.text: We are visiting Las Vegas from near Memphis, TN and really wanted to try some authentic Mexican food. After reviewing the many positive reviews on Yelp, we knew Bonita Michoacan was a 'must try' place. We were not disappointed. Oh, my, what awesome food and absolutely wonderful service.  We were initially provided with chips and their home made red salsa and also a bowl of refried bean dip. The salsa was well seasoned and the beans were addictive. We ordered a hotter salsa (because that's how we roll) and were brought a green salsa--whew! Fabulous and very hot.  We ordered the Mexican Pizza appetizer with a side of roasted jalapenos and grilled onions. Both were so delicious -- we highly recommend!  I had a combo platter with the pork verde and guacamole burrito -- fabulous. This truly is a must - try restaurant!

mynUsqp5hW5hYT3cIR41Pw.text: The food here is amazing. Plenty of parking and great ambiance. Traditional plates. Love this place.

uFzO_9RFh2IlTVneHSPlXg.text: Yum!!! I love that they serve beans with the tortilla chips. If you order a combination meal they serve fideo soup with it which is tasty! I like to order the #5 Santa Clara (enchilada, tostada and taco) with rice and beans which don't disappoint. I like the huevos rancheros too. Friendly service and fun atmosphere! The mariachi band is great!

vNS-awQT9J8WwbZ_cBaBFg.text: I sure like this place.  It's the "go-to" Mexican restaurant for meeting friends in Las Vegas.  I've been four times.  It's been excellent every time.  Service is outstanding.  Quick friendly seating, attentive waitstaff, and an eagerness to get everything right.  I once had a dish that wasn't as hot as I wanted and they fell over themselves to please me -- getting it exactly right the second time.  I don't eat onions.  No problema.  I want extra sauce, or sauce on the side, or extra jalapenos.  No problema.  My latest visit, with my good friend Andrei, was typical.  I had a monstrously large Caldo de Pollo (Chicken Soup) as a dinner.  Wonderfully ample white meat chicken -- at least a breast, maybe a breast and a half.  The cilantro was fresh.  The other spices delicious.  My friends garlic chicken was similarly spectacular -- even without the red peppers he's allergic to.  All the chips, salsa, and guac that you could want.  And a price that left money for our main purpose -- playing poker.  I love variety.  And Las Vegas probably has more Mexican restaurants than any city, including Mexico D.F..  Even so, a trip to this city always includes a trip to this restaurant -- so sure am I of getting a high quality, reasonably priced, delicious meal.

GG4jXqGKNnDJHLj2C5qyaA.text: This place is the best Mexican food I've found since moving to Vegas! It's Mexican food that is up to par with my favorite Mexican food from LA.  I'm so happy to hAve found this gem and can't wait to go back.  I had their strawberry margarita, but the bartender told me to try the prickly pear (I think that's what she said) next time and of course I will! The chips, salsa and bean dip was my for sure favorite. Although a little more chorizo in that bean dip would make it even better! See you soon!

ASCMraaRCYiw8XLnP9HwEg.text: Wow!!! This place was a treat, I have no complaints service was friendly quick and hospitable. I was surprised when they welcomed us to our table with complimentary soup salsa n bean dip. But what really made this a great experience was the shrimp plate, I have never experienced a taste like that. I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow!!! Get this!!!

9oOJim_qKWIPXzbLCdiWnw.text: Food is great and service is fast!!Awesome guacamole made to order tableside!!!  Chips with salsa and beans are complimentary!!!

dT45f7YxRSbktIme0dF8ww.text: Normally me my boyfriend & friends go to eat here every time we go out to Vegas & honestly use to LOVE this place ! But this weekend that we were there the service SUCKED & the food had a different taste. . . I normally get the shrimp cocktail which is my FAVORITE & didn't taste the same as well as for the rest of the food ordered, what we did like was the oysters with ceviche on the top we got a dozen to share within 4 people & the waiter didn't bring us any side plates to use for them until we asked for the place was just way to dead unlike when Juan was there he was the life of this place !!

cpBcTWCgZravUa5BuPpC-g.text: My husband and I had the "Papa Chencho" appetizer and it was great! We had filete relleno and pollo con rajas as entrees and they were so yummy! Our server Lili and armando were very attentive and prompt. I will definitely be coming back soon!

Z5ECYJAsqw5vEzIV_VjJzQ.text: Came here tonight for a friends birthday. Being Mexican, I'm hesitant trying other Mexican food places, but I have it a chance for her sake. We were seated with the rest of our group immediately, which is nice. We promptly got cups of water, and once we ordered, we got little cups of fideo soup. It was good, nothing special, tasted straight out of the packets you buy at the store. After, we proceeded to wait about half an hour for our drinks and then about another hour or so for our food. The food wasn't authentic. I understand it was towards the end of the night when we went, but my rice shouldn't have been crunchy. Old rice, beans from a can, flavorless chicken fajitas with more vegetables than anything. I also had a beef tamale that tasted very basic, run of mill, nothing special type, you know? The strawberry margarita was the best thing I had all night. I paid about $30, without the gratuity that they tacked on. The atmosphere is pretty alright, but the food is crap and definitely nowhere near authentic. Go if you want, I won't be returning.

2pwG1Cgimb181hWg5BQ8yA.text: I went the other day for lunch with a friend and was pleasantly surprised. The restaurant is very authentic with hand painted chairs and decor. I liked the chill atmosphere. I had the lunch special beef fajitas and LOVED them. They didn't get served on a sizzling plate, but they were scrumptious all the same. I also really liked the complimentary chips, bean dip and salsa. I will totally be making a return.

Rguu_17-vuJaU0FPxLA8Bw.text: Food is delicious so tasty awesome service Eduardo our server was so nice and friendly I will definetly be coming back to this place. The ambiance is good not a long wait and great decor I'm glad I found this place while visiting from la

_Ot8QfvhaM9-HJB2GMjJTQ.text: Chips, salsa, and bean dip right on the house off the rip to start?! What! Snuck in a little after 6pm and still got the happy hour price on the margarita's?! Damn who still does that. Had a regular and mango margarita. Margarita craving fixed.   Got the guac as an app. A must. They mash it up table side, so you pick the ingredients. No onions for me. I had the chicken taco, tosdada,and enchilada combo joint. Wow! My girl had the bean burrito and beef taco combo. Said she liked it (Was her pick to eat here since she said it was the best). Tons of stuff on the menu. All this for $55 and my girl had 2 margarita's too. Definitely good.    The only complaint is that the decor is a little old, but I like the mom and pop hole in the wall type places. I also ate wayyyy too much and it felt like a rock was in my stomach all night.

OIiCxvbShwhuDfKmj4HdhQ.text: This is the best Mexican food I've ever tasted in Las Vegas . Their ceviche was delicious and their table made guacamole was even better . I recommend this place to any and everyone . And their customer service was awesome .

Ec9PMkImHzptjIVfzyAxrQ.text: Proud to make this my first ever Yelp review. This place is one of the few restaurants I've ever been to that give you a full on "experience" from beginning to end. A group of friends and I in our travels dropped in due to a free margarita promotion and the party started with our awesome waiter, Richard. Then I - a black guy - took on the Gringo challenge (not spoiling it, go and take it on yourself) and got another free drink! The food was top notch and pardon the misogyny but the ladies are gorgeous too, please respect them as they want to make sure your time there is optimal with pictures and drinks as well. I'd type more but the tequila is working  go here!!!

uc31joYjTiJiK__lRFGY5A.text: Let me start by saying the food is delicious.  So, why did I give a three star rating?  The service was atrocious.  First I didn't get soup that was supposed to come before my meal.  Other people at my table got their soup.  Second,, I didn't get flour tortillas that was supposed to come with my dinner.  I asked the waiter to bring me the tortillas that I was supposed to get and he still never brought them.  I ordered a lemonade with my meal which they brought but they refilled the glass with water.  I probably will try the place again but won't go out of my way to go there.

kY_a3ExxVnhaHt5xEKXEpw.text: Waiter had an attitude, used the check in for the margarita . Oh well keep it professional and ate our food. The attitudes not necessary. Food was great

CWXG9t6NPrZuNqT8ceXofQ.text: Never been disappointed at this spot. When we are craving Mexican food these guys are on point.  Live music tonight and everyone is in a great mood.  Servers are fast and polite even singing along in some instances The food is good and portion size satisfies.  No problem with substitutions or extras.   Free margarita with Yelp check in is a nice touch as well.  Good place, good food, good times

dEPY33xqsOETNKsg05gOkg.text: This is my favorite Mexican spot in Las Vegas. The menu is extensive, with items you don't see at every Mexican restaurant, many of which are specific to the Michoacan region.  Right away, you'll notice the salsa and bean dip are great. Next, you'll notice the appetizer soup is flavorful. Then, you will certainly enjoy your entree, almost all of which are memorable and tasty. What's more, if you get the tableside guacamole, you won't be disappointed.  As a vegan, I'll say you can't beat the veggie fajitas. Probably the best veggie fajitas I've ever had or heard of anywhere, which are an interesting and delicious assortment of vegetables, served up with homemade tortilas, flour or corn (you can't go wrong either way).  For out of towners, this place is located conveniently about 5-10 minutes west of the Strip and, seeing how it is miles ahead of any Mexican restaurant at any casino, it is worth the short trip.

mf1c-k51XrAfew_pfF9Khw.text: I went with a friend because I was really craving tacos and margaritas. I think we went on a Saturday night around 10pm. There was no wait.   The tacos were really good. The margarita with the 7oz corona with it was amazing! I seriously couldn't love the taste of it more! I definitely want to come back here again. The staff was also friendly.

-ix7ZbDq4Xi4T2Te65wBSQ.text: This place is awesome! I can't complain about a single thing! The food is great! The people are great and its always fun! Ask for Juan as your waiter and I promise he will make your visit worth your while! We had our wedding rehearsal dinner there and it was amazing! Go there once and you will go there again for sure.

It was soo bland! The chili rellanos was not worth it. Chili was hard & sauce was sooo bland with no taste! Beef taco shell fell apart & hard to eat with no bottom!! This place was terrible!

kV-llnM6ypnpTC5ldRxIpg.text: This was my first time here and the food was amazing. Being that my family is from Michoacan I saw a lot of familiar foods on the menu that reminded me of grandmas cooking. I tried the Enchiladas Michoacanas - sooo good. I can't wait to come back during my next trip to Vegas

fZodvUTFnhHTCBIB79cl2w.text: Highly recommend coming here. Everything is so good starting from appetizers, entrees to drinks. Margaritas are sooo good. And our waiter was such a sweet guy. Definitely going back when I visit again.

-vrK6ncgh8O-qbIIRf6fwA.text: Nice sit down Mexican restaurant with good food and decent prices. I drive by this place almost everyday so I decided to give it a try. Came here on a Saturday night around 8pm. Place is very large and can seat a lot of people. There were some people having dinner here but it wasn't too crowded. The inside decor sort of reminded me of a red lobster lol. One thing that's cool about the decor is there are picture decorations on top of the tables and with matching chairs at each table. My server was "Lorenzo" I think. Service was very good and fast and the waiter were funny and entertaining. There was an old man providing live Latin music in both English and Spanish. While I normally don't like live music with my dinner, the artist was very good (he gets 5 stars). They give chips and salsa at the start. Their menu is very large and they have pictures for a lot of items which I assume are the more popular ones. I got the steak cilantro which came with rice, beans, salad, and guacamole, and tortillas. The plate was huge probably should be shared by 2 people. Definitely a must try at this restaurant. I got a fried ice cream for dessert but I don't think the ice cream is actually fried. It tasted like vanilla ice cream with a corn flake cereal coating. The vanilla ice cream was delicious but I wanted more of a crispy shell. Overall, I was very happy I decided to try this place out. Definitely come here if you're craving Mexican food. The portions are generous, the food is delicious, and at a decent price.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must for any meal.
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak cilantro ... a must try
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamale

HmbQ8uexs5JQakuIfGJWFQ.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet! We have been going here for years and have never had bad service, food or drinks! That says a lot. Even when they are super busy, the staff is always amazing!  Drinks: We LOVE the Cadillac margaritas! Be forewarned that if you order the large, it's huge! All of their other alcohol-based drinks are top notch, too. Their horchata is delish as well. Food: Love their bean dip and salsa that's complementary. The table side guacamole is awesome! We've had a huge array of their food. We love the carnitas. Everything from seafood to chicken to steak is yum yum. Pricing: Totally reasonable! Whether it's a date night, celebration, or just dinner with friends, it's totally affordable.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the sangria margarita! It&#39;s delish!

A1p164fCCVjRMbXMIhFCFw.text: Let me start off by saying everyone was extremely nice and very attentive. First of all, as soon as we sat down, the waiter brought us chips and two different dips. Which was delicious by the way. We started with appetizers. Sopitos.... chicken on top of gorditas with cheese, sour cream and guacamole. Then they served us with a small cup of soup before our main entree, which we were not expecting. Then onto our entree... chicken mole poblano for me.....DELICIOUS! Made the old traditional way. My hubby had the beef chimichanga which was deep fried and topped with sour cream. Both plates were so tasty and of course huge portions. Needless to say we will be back!

ftIL88vYOeT57_OOi2T04w.text: As usual the food here is amazing. Had to drop a star due to the service today. For some reason they were a little lagging today on refills and busting tables, not to mention the hostess failed to tell the server we were celebrating a bday. Will definitely be back but if service continues to decline we may have to try out their other location in Henderson.

C3pUX9Rd8b3-MiRvBPiM4g.text: The food was really good. I loved the name of the plates. The complementary soup was a plus my husband and baby loved it as the chips, salsa, and BEANS you hardly see that. The service was ok our waiter was kinda slow. I will say it was busy and a Saturday so that may have play in that but their was this other guy who was a delight as he was fast and would check on all the tables I can honestly say he might have been the one that saved the experience with the service because we hardly saw our waiter. I do recommend this place must go I say. I'm Mexican and can I just say how hard it is to find a decent Mexican restaurant and this was more that exceeded our expectations. Wish I had a picture of our food. We got the Parrillada it can with jumbo shrimp, carne asada (not the best), chicken (chicken is not always the best but may I say this chicken was amazing), chorizo, and on the side tortillas, guacamole, cheese, pico de gallo, sour cream, also they bring another hot dish but with melted cheese!!! SO so good!

AT17X14edfwUi0AmbdLPzA.text: This place was great. Very authentic Mexican style restaurant from the food to decor. The food was delicious and also were the drinks. Reasonably priced food and great service would definitely recommend.

My friend asked for freshly made guacamole and to my surprise they actually make the guacamole right in front of you. It was very delicious as well. I had a chile relleno which did not disappoint me at all. It was a great atmosphere, great experience, and most of all great food. Will definitely go there again!

QbFBsHhUrwAyCssfipf59w.text: Excellent guac, and the shrimp and avocado salad was delicious. Very busy with locals for lunch.

aicJiKYJkLmcNouUIditPA.text: This place has been here forever, and while the decor is a little campy the food is honest and delicious.  I'm not a big fan of mexican, this place really shines.

gkFjnPa7Ng_eDzuzIC07zA.text: This was an amazing meal... The Mole was killer. Service excellent. We're from out of town, always willing to try new places, this did not disappoint.

5jsQE0X2pwcnu9QxHGEGdg.text: Excellent meal, and quite a steal when you add in the Groupon discount. The salsa and bean dip were good. Not the best I've ever had, but tasty and they were quick to bring a second serving when we finished off the first. Very quick to take our drink and food orders, and service was quite fast. I ordered a tilapia dish to do something different from the usual burrito or combo plate, and was very impressed. Whole fish, flaky moist meat, crispy skin and a flavorful sauce. It didn't feel at all heavy for a fried item. Came with a healthy portion of rice and beans, as well as french fries? Don't understand that part but even the fries were delicious. Very reasonable price ($13) for seafood and the portion size. Everyone else at the table seemed to thoroughly enjoy their selections as well.  I would definitely go back, even without a groupon.

L7CgzWIgAYvhtowS12VziQ.text: Went to Bonito's today for lunch and I'm sure I'll be back!  Great fish tacos!!  The "special sauce" that goes on top was all that, it was delicious.  Chips and salsa were awesome, but the beans weren't right.  I'm not sure what it was about them, but they weren't as good as at other places.  Others in my party had the chicken burrito and the chicken sopas -- both of which were reportedly great!   Service is super speedy -- they are quick and that includes taking your plate as you shove the last bite in your mouth and bringing you the check while people in your party are still finishing up too!  That's better than waiting for the check in my opinion though!

TMbxmXbaEd3gLPU2SQeQ_g.text: I've been in vegas for almost 8 yrs and me and my family just haven't found good Mexican food like in Los Angeles until yesterday . For my birthday we came here and the food was really good , authentic , the place was clean , the service was great !! We will be back!!

mJ-56CyLOntO0162J4lAnA.text: Very good food and great portion:price ratio. -1 star for slight inconsistencies at every visit. Sometimes the beans are more runny, and sometimes the salsa is more watery than other times. Sometimes the Chile relllenos are completely stuffed with cheese, and sometimes there's much less. When. It's very busy and they have large parties, the smaller tables can be forgotten about regarding refills. Minor things like this can be easily overlooked because the taste and quality is always great and staff is always friendly.

OHkenbVlcKbNeflG_-dR6g.text: Our friends took us to Bonito Michoacan for lunch, and they did not disappoint! Large parking lot, but since it was a Sunday they were pretty crowded. Festive colors adorn the outside of the building, and inside there were a lot of Mexican decorations and murals. Very loud and very crowded with lots of Spanish speaking folks, so I was hoping that meant the food is good--and si, it was! Traditional Mexican dishes and drinks abound, and our server Jonathan was most friendly and patient with our numerous questions about the definition of some words on the menu and the food. I decided on the Carnitas Michoacan, which is pork marinated in oranges and spices and listed as "the best carnitas in all of Mexico", and I gotta agree! I really enjoyed the flavor and tenderness of the meat and all of the accompaniments--awesome! The portions were quite large, so most of our party did not finish their meals, but I totally wolfed mine down--lol! I also had a jalapeno cilantro margarita to go with my meal--woohoo, spicy and refreshing! We will be sure to visit again when we're in Vegas!

HGpxdWM-tnPiNF3hAvZ17Q.text: This was a recommendation from one of my coworkers and I decided we would stop in there after work the other day and get dinner...   First thing is first, the building is not the prettiest of places but i guess it fits the overall feel of the place, you walk in and 2 young ladies dressed in old Mexican dress great you and get you seated, the waiter then came by to see us and offer us drinks.. Let me stop and say that the waiter was extremely friendly and on top of every aspect of our meal. We ordered a Margarita and waters with the Table side Guacamole for an appetizer. this was probably the best guacamole i gave ever had. The meal also comes with not only your entree but you get sopa de fideo with every combo plus beans and rice, My grandma used to make sopa de fideo before she passed and it tasted just like her.  memories!!!    Okay so now that my review has turned into one long run on sentence I will just finish by saying the meals are huge, tasty and fairly priced, I definitely recommend this place if you like Mexican food and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s what I&#39;m talking about!
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. when all else fails order a number 5
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tableside guacamole, amazing by the way

ihqVeLcGpFjf8EiiMmASTQ.text: Went here for lunch with my co-workers and it was a great experience. The food is phenomenal and the service is top notch. We will definitely be returning for lunch and I plan to bring my family in for dinner some time as well. Definitely worth a visit!

uBglNhddktn-uUpEdAoIqg.text: My experience here with my family was outstanding. Our waiter was hilarious and he really took care of us. All of our food was SO flavorful and obviously cooked with care. I'm writing this review two years after the fact, so I know that I am leaving out some parts of our experience here, but all I can remember is how delicious and wonderful everything was. Go here, please.

xbFaNJ0S_-eujk5igu9Vfw.text: I came here for dinner once. Their Carne asada was really good and guacamole amazing.  You must try this place out!

2d3iuM4eMAkWuP1D5lCCFA.text: Amazing food, great atmosphere, fair prices. This place has great tasting classic Mexican dishes. I've been coming here since I was a kid and will continue!!

aLIRbVTnC8-btr2w6f7W-Q.text: Yet another great experience, just when I thought it couldn't get any better...we tried the seafood combo plate..... Wow!! It was absolutely delicious. Its enough food to feed 3-4 people. We washed it all down with climato prepped beer! Another favorite of mine. Overall great food, nice atmosphere and friendly staff. I highly recommend Bonito Michoacan.

L5jCQn5hrDS-NgSHyuIEiw.text: It was between here and Amigos Tacos, I decided to try this place because the reviews were pretty good. The parking was wide open, we were seated immediately and as I was excitedly anticipating, we got our chips - salsa - and beans. The chips were good, fresh. The salsa was very good for me but my BF prefers salsa with a little kick. The beans... well... they were OK, a little salty, but add salsa to the beans and a wonderful treat.   The menu is HUGE! It took me a while to go through everything and make a decision, I finally decided on the 2 taco combo (beef tacos) and he got the beef enchilada with green sauce combo. While snacking on the chips they brought out a soup.. I wasn't expecting soup, I still don't know what kind of soup it was but it was OK. About 2 minutes after the soup came, our meal came... The food looked good, plates were hot, that's always a good sign.   Now the meal... I took a bite of my taco and it was... a taco. The beef was lacking flavor, it was almost like they didn't season it while cooking, every Mexican restaurant I have been to has always used a combo of onions and other veggies/herbs to season their meat.. it just seemed.. blah. The rice was good, a little on the salty side as well and I usually put salt on everything, I like salt, but it was too salty for even me. my BF and I swapped plates to try each others dishes and his was very good. His beef was good, and it was the same type but since his food was covered lightly with enchilada sauce... i think it helped it out. I used some of his sour cream and the salsa and fixed up my taco.. not amazing but it was good.   All in all, I am happy we got to try it and I would come here again but I would definitely order something different. I will give Amigos Tacos a try next time and hope that their menu isn't as costly as it was here... over 5$ for guacamole..? Not worth it. But the main reason I will come back was the service, everyone was very friendly, our server paid attention to our table and once our drinks were half empty they had fresh ones on the table...

OTYgVViE-Er8tS5RQkJ-oQ.text: Great staff, food and experience! This is a place for sure we will come back to when in Vegas!!!!! Found our new favorite spot. No complaints! Homemade fresh flour tortillas, too! Had to order some to go.

oVMLTOH_o8wVwEks6oSQrA.text: Birthday celebrations are festive and make you the center of attention. Great employees, really make you feel at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing food and great atmosphere! Pollo Al Cognac is delicious. Wait staff is very attentive. Great experience.

E2D3NN0QvMoDGlK1nsXDbA.text: Good food with genuine flavor, good variety of items on the menu, and the waitstaff was nice and attentive. Minor complaint--very noisy where we were seated, making it hard to have a conversation at times!   After being in the area a few days and always seeing lots of cars parked out here, we gave it a try--figured it must be good with it always being crowded!

1sn0pEB2Uim92yTgZECBEQ.text: Place is great. Our server Lilly was so much fun to have around and did a great job. In addition, she made my experience a lot better than what I expected. Felt like family.

hA0edTvsqJ9hhj4M2TYjRg.text: The food was OK, not impressive. My tacos dorados has cheddar cheese in them, not authentic. If you are ok with Americanized Mexican food, go for it! But again, it was just OK. The drinks were really good.  The reason I gave a 2 star is due to the service. We went on a rainy day, no wait at all. Our waitress VIOLET/VIOLETA pissed me off. She kept forgetting stuff and was overly cocky when she was providing shitty service. It started to leak on our table and ON US! She grabbed a pitcher and put it on the table to catch the leak, THATS FUCKING GROSS! We pointed out the leaks and she ducked out of the way worried about her helmet hair. Offer to move your guest! But no.. she kinda just forgot about us. I was with a large party celebrating a birthday so I didn't want to put her on the spot, although there was plenty of open tables and pretty slow she still managed to give us crappy service. One of our guests asked her if she was going to discount or comp anything since she had us sit under a leak she said, "oh yeah sure, I gave you guys double discount" (sarcastically) and walked away. No discount, no comp $2 soda, NOTHING!  I wasn't going to review this place but the service she gave really nice customers was messed up.

HPJDTEfTZlXhZmDxHBc5ig.text: The food is good, not excellent, but good. Customer service is what can take a restaurant to another level but they lack that here.   Not friendly, no eye contact, they don't smile and seemed annoyed being asked for normal requests. We politely asked for more chips and for our drinks to be filled. They brought more chips but didn't bring more salsa or beans for the chips?    They forgot about our fideo soup and asked us if we ever got it and we told them we never did. They ended up bringing the fideo soup out with our meal.  It became uncomfortable asking for service from waiters or waitresses that simply don't want to be there or help you.  Like I said, the food is good but don't expect great customer service here.

ZPu-fWrA_yRb65ITIQYzlA.text: Food always great and service always pleasant! Love this restaurant. Great for family dining out. Sometimes their table are a little sticky, management should pay a little more attention to it. Overall my favorite Mexican restaurant in town!

TwZROcLeXHYd_LwRnpa4YQ.text: We asked Our server, Jonathon, for a recommendation.He suggested the Carnitas lunch. He was right on, awesome food.We will be back.

dlFanfzJ50L90Ft0t59c5g.text: Real Mexican food , really good food, at a good fair price. Good atmosphere ,on the left as you walk in if you have kids please sit on the right as you walk in. I'm addicted to their beef cognac seems to be better at night. All the food seems pretty good.

CrTH4vVLoevARNZqRaGedw.text: One of my favorite sit down Mexican restaurants. The staff is always friendly and polite. Went in looking for some sort of chicken tonight and decided to go with the chicken fajitas. Portion was large and the perfect blend of meat and veggies. I've had them before and always enjoy them. Only thing I didn't get to enjoy this visit was the fried ice cream... Dang diets. Next time gadget, next time.

1iNv7Hpr1mlXn4tReM6Wiw.text: Waiter was great, food... not so much. Shrimp were really over cooked. Standard "Americanized" Mexican fare. We won't be back.

fj0RNjAI3DjuA55zzIoj7w.text: Came here for Mother's day 2014. Sign said open at 9am, but the doors were still locked.  As we were walking a lady said the door will open shortly.  9:15 the door finally open, guess who opened the door...yup the lady that was walking from her car.  Can you say getting to work late?!  Anyways we order chilaquiles, one with red sauce and the other with green sauce with eggs.   It was okay.  Two kids plate,  one had a long hair in the rice. Yuk as my daughter commented.  They comp one of the kids meal and gave her a plate of new rice.  Julio did an excellent job, but the women Griselda (i think that is how you spell her name) was rude. She didn't acknowledge when we ask for things and her body language came across very negative.  What a disappointment since it was our first and probably will be our last time here.   Thanks for an unforgettable start to mother's day.  Glad we still have the entire day to make more memories.

6HWRXOwsBlXVSZnlswBs3w.text: Love the fish in a foil!  Ask for Richard, he's the bomb!  Oh and try the top shelf margarita....

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frankie feeling no pain :-)

oy9n0B5QC8LJhZqMzMeLLQ.text: Coming from a native San Diegan who has been exposed to GOOD Mexican food her entire life THIS PLACE IS LEGIT! Their menu had a good variety of dishes and the service was absolutely great! Boyfriend had the steak in cilantro & lime and I had the tamal plate. Everything was fresh and delicious! Will definitely be back!

R1criQk4p36pbZkntmzesw.text: This place was cute, but pretty average.  Our server kept trying to rush us to order because he had a party of 15 he was trying to help as well. We sat down and felt super rushed into ordering he kept saying if we didn't order now the part of 15s order was going to go in before ours and it was going to take way longer to get our food.  The food was nothing spectacular. Tasted like pretty much every other Mexican restaurant I've been to.  We ordered fried ice cream and bananas for dessert and to light them on fire they poured a full shot of tequila over it. All we could taste was tequila it made it pretty much inedible.   Decent food but nothing I would recommend.

jjnSIqup_BajHEYgufZZLQ.text: Great food. Great service and of course Amazing drinks! Can it get better than this ? Yes sometimes they have live music! Pass me a margarita please!

FpF6uS5IdTRxG-L6FVQNRA.text: Tired of Toxic Bell, or restaurants that claim to be Mexican, but serve food that can be found nowhere in Mexico? Then this is THE place for you, even if you can't pronounce the restaurant's name!  The menu includes all the dishes you'd expect at an American restaurant: burritos, tacos, fajitas et cetera et cetera, blah blah blah. But the enormous menu, literally pages long, includes many dishes you've probably never heard of, unless you happen to have spent a lot of time in Mexico.  Your meal starts out with complimentary chips, refried beans and very VERY spicy salsa. It was a bit much, even for me, but our server very happily and quickly replaced it with a slightly tamer version. The chips are made in-house, as are the tortillas, a nice touch that makes a big difference.  We ordered from the lunch menu, which is available from 11:00 to 3:00. It contains a plethora of items from the dinner menu at different price ranges, and doesn't include some of the extras that the dinner menu provides, like the bowl of chicken noodle soup that comes with the pricier dinner menu items.  If there's shrimp on the menu, you KNOW that's what I'll have. I've had the Camarones Borrachos (drunken shrimp), made with tequila and simply delicious, but not available on the lunch menu (I could have ordered from the dinner menu, but couldn't justify that much $$ for lunch), so I ordered the Camarones Saradeados, large shrimp cooked perfectly in a sauce that I'd never heard of. It's made from roasted peppers, undisclosed spices and a touch of mayonnaise, and they could bottle this stuff and make a fortune selling it! It was in the pricier category, but worth every peso and then some! My husband, whose palate is more conventional, ordered chicken fajitas, which came to table beautifully charred and sizzling. Both orders included beans, rice and house-made guacamole, the fajitas came with those yummy house-made tortillas. We had margaritas with lunch, labeled small but actually ample.  The restaurant itself is clean, well located, and with ample parking. The service is friendly and prompt, and the prices are reasonable. The voluminous menu includes Mexican delicacies like beef tongue, and they offer menudo on the weekends for those of you who may have partied a leeeeeetle too hard on the Strip the night before. It's a local place that, unfortunately for them, is unknown to tourists. If you're here from out of town misbehaving though, this is one off-Strip place that's definitely worth the short taxi ride - it's just minutes from the Strip. Do NOT miss this jewel!

KLURd1OMD9hOkxipWrkuaA.text: I'm sureee there's lots of opinion on best Mexican restaurant here in Vegas..let's review bonito Michoacan. NOT to be confused with, lindo Michoacan, that's just wrong. Atmosphere 8/10. Menu 8/10. Customer service 8/10.  Trust me, if you want good Mexican food, I don't see how you'll leave this place disappointed, yes I've had better, but not in this city. So let's be fair, when it comes to providing all of the good stuff like tacos and tostadas, you'll find that here. I love the live music and friendly staff, adds to the experience. Get a margarita here because they do that veryyy well. Good food, good atmosphere, and nice staff...all three aren't easy to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coctel de camaron

vdssCqYacsO0YWGWJ5zc2A.text: Wanted something different from the strip buffets and restaurants, so I decided to give this place a try. Very close to the strip, excellent food at a reasonable price and great service! Will definitely patronize this place again!

ZskCe6syHUK3dHQCPRre5g.text: Homemade tortillas are sooo good. Get the fundido, it's in the classic style.   I grew up in So Cal, and it's really hard to find good Mexican food around vegas (at least to meet my standards!) This place does not disappoint.

o6Vx0ZV18k4EKdtLhnZmOA.text: The service was really great, the atmosphere was incredibly authentic. The food was delicious. I would definitely come here time and time again. It also was really good for a larger group.

6Ie0WqFsOzQnxu74-2Jflg.text: A hidden gem in Las Vegas.  Service excellent.  Food excellent.  Prices very good.  We were served (gratis) chips and salsa AND refried beans.  I can't remember the last time refried bean were given as a free dish.  AND IT WAS SOME OF THE BEST REFRIED BEANS I EVER HAD.  The salsa was good, but I would have preferred it hotter.  We were hungry from a day hiking so we also ordered a guacamole  appetizer.  The guac was prepared table side to our taste, also excellent.  I ordered a coca-cola steak ala Mama Cielo, surprisingly it wasn't sweet at all just incredible juicy.  My adventurous choice paid off.  The service was exceptional.  The server came by, without asking and refilled my drink whenever it was empty (which was often - did I mention 100 degree weather in Las Vegas and hiking).  They also had a musician singing and playing Mexican love songs, surprisingly at the correct volume.  If I lived in Las Vegas, this would be my number 1 Mexican restaurant.

ZQoWM1ugPh2s5uo5aq_RWA.text: Made reservations by phone and told them we were celebrating 2 birthdays. On arrival hostess acknowledged we were there for 2 birthdays.The bus person was great, tried to get the server's attention 4 times as I wanted to get a drink menu,finally got it wanted to order a virgin drink again difficult to get server's attention. Food took a while but worth the wait. During dinner 4 or 5 tables were celebrating birthdays sombreros singing ,when we were given the check there was no problem getting the attention of the server. No happy birthday wishes at our table! We always tip well maybe they thought the attention wasn't warranted. Very disappointed in the service. Yes I tipped the bus person.

IK-f13CgKnUst_ipn_5lKw.text: Truly awful.  If I had not eaten here, I would not have believed it was possible to mess up Mexican food this badly.  By comparison, Taco Bell gets at least two Michelin stars.  Ambiance - A cut or two below Denny's, with Mexican colors.  The best I can say is that I didn't actually see any cockroaches.  There was some noise, which I assume was intended as music, but which sounded more like drunk UNLV students celebrating a basketball victory.  Service - Quick and disinterested.  In fact, quick is an understatement.  The food appeared within less than a minute, and was obviously pre-cooked and sitting under a heat lamp in the kitchen.  Food - Awful, awful, and more awful.  The tortilla chips were not fresh.  The guacamole had so much lime juice that it was nearly inedible (and I LOVE guacamole).  The soup tasted like equal parts dishwater and vinegar, with a thimbleful of ramen noodles thrown in.  My beef burrito had chunks of beef (God, I HOPE it was beef) that appeared to be boiled soup meat, although the tortilla was fresh.  Even the rice and beans tasted acidic.  The portions were small (no Woody Allen jokes here, please), and the prices (by Mexican restaurant standards) were no bargain.  Don't get me wrong - $8 for the guacamole and $10.50 for each Margarita is not ridiculous in and of itself, but by the time the check came I was thinking they should have paid me to eat here.

ZnHUq4IVDrzpXbf04bo6XA.text: Food was amazing! Authentic Michoacan cuisine, from the sauces to the steak, it was all delicious. I had the Enchiladas Michoacanas and a Chile relleno ala carte, my husband had the Huevos Rancheros and a pollo azado enchilada ala carte. We enjoyed the food. The staff was very friendly and attentive. This is definitely the place to go if you want authentic Mexican food away from the hassle of the strip.

p6UTqn2T6VLcdakOk1xHog.text: Place is fire.. The atmosphere is a bit loud but food is amazing. Ceviche extremely fresh and the steak is on point

SBcv8bGB4ELbDGPIACyNqA.text: I wanted to like this place, I really did.  The decor is great, and the men that serve the drinks are all totally on top of it and very friendly.  That is why it gets two stars.  Our waitress unfortunately wasn't as nice.  But without even that, the food just isn't good. Maybe this is a different type of Mexican food that my mom and I are just unaware of.. But neither of us liked anything.  The salsa was funky flavor, rice barely had flavor, chile Colorado was hard to chew, not tender.. Etc.  Well, we tried! On to the next...

5Gk6AzEEwmiPdBnF9IlHHw.text: Update:   Violeta, while still full of awesomeness, only works the day shift now.  If you visit in the evening Evelyn (Evie) rocks!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Guacamole made to order tableside

BVRa_B8hq4COQnnBzSEqEw.text: Ok this is a nice place... The food was good, I like the flavor of the fajitas better at other places but the tortillas were good. The guacamole my daughter said wasn't as good as a few other places as too chunky for her.... I like how they had basic options like chicken fingers for kids meals though. The mole poblano got good reviews at the table and some shrimp and cheese dish was big stars. The salsa had a nice kick.  The waiters were great.. Very attentive, and we were celebrating so they came and sang happy birthday (comic relief as maybe they sing that no matter the occasion as wasn't a birthday and they knew that lol) they put candles in the cupcakes they let us bring in and they offered to dance with the kids to the live music.  They let you watch the tortillas being made and overall a positive fun experience....other places I would go depending on what wanted but if the group wanted to go there I wouldn't protest

idJBR8BTE9auO2F07nvsbQ.text: I have been there 10 plus times now and still have never had a meal that wasn't outstanding.  Best authentic Mexican I have ever had and I travel the us for a living.  Just ask the server Richard for his favorite and you will never be disappointed.

MYAA4IierNvwRfTCmK6uaA.text: This definitely is one of Las Vegas best Mexican restaurants. From the decor to the service and the food, it all deserves 5+ stars. We found this place on Yelp and with all the great reviews everyone left we had to try it. The restaurant was as good or even better then everyone said it would be. We were greeted as soon as we walked in and seated right away. Our server came right out with chips salsa and beans to dip. After looking at the menu for a few minutes our server took our order and the food came right out. Everything everyone ordered looked and tasted great! We told our server it was one of our friends BDay and the whole restaurant came out and sang 2 songs to her! One in English and one in Spanish lol its was soo cool! They even gave her chooros topped with whipped cream lol we had a great time here and id recommend everyone who is looking for good food and great service to come here. You wont regret it!

Oexhg4npfCyn67m6tHQ1OA.text: Great Mexican authentic food. Read about this place and decided to try it next time I was in Vegas; It's like El Toritos Mexican food but better.  The hot bean dip they bring to the table is good.  I ordered the chese enchilada and beef taco hard shell you don't see hard shells these days anymore.  Service and ambience were good. I would return next time in Vegas.

kPStm2QNXf0KXVlYGPtjTA.text: Well....out of all the Michoacan family of restaurants, I would rank this my #3 choice, with Viva being #1 and Lindo being #2.  There's a couple of reasons for this -  1.) Viva gives you complimentary fideo soup when requested. If it doesn't come with an entree, Bonito charges you $2.50 for it. It's good soup but not worth paying $2.50 when it costs probably $.25/cup to make.  2.) The customer service is off par from the rest. I experienced a rude, short tempered server today at lunch. When I advised my meal came out wrong, he refuted "well this is the way you told me you wanted it!". Well, actually that's not the way I told you and I wouldn't be telling you it was wrong if you just listened the first time. My last visit, when I asked the question "what is fundido dip?" I was treated like I was stupid for not knowing. It was off putting. 3.) The busser was kind but she was bad at refilling drinks. My one pet peeve is drink refills. Don't keep me hanging.... 4.) The chips and bean dip that come out are bland. Do they use different chips & dip than the other Michoacan resturants? I'm not certain but they don't taste as good here.   There are good things about the resturant as well -   1.) They have an extensive Mexican themed menu with many options for even the pickest of eaters. My favorites are the beef chimichangas and the beef flour flautas. Their spanish rice is decent and their refried beans are good & consistent. I tried my friends carne asada steak today and it was juicy and yummy. Their homemade flour tortillas are delish! 2.) They run resonably priced lunch specials. For two of us, we escaped at around $20.00...not bad for a sit down lunch.  3.) It seemed as though before our tushs hit the seats that there were chips and dip on the table. We were immediately asked what we would like to drink. Very speedy in this regard. 4.) Pleasant hostess staff, large restaurant seating areas and a full service bar.

mCziWxSWyvZio7mKda7Q-g.text: Have driven past this place for years and finally decided to give it a try. They are advertised as being "authentic" mexican food - so when I asked if they had Horchata they said yes, and when I asked if it was homemade they said NO. So much for being authentic. Their salsa has a weird taste to it, and is the worst salsa I've ever had. The chips we received were broken into tiny pieces (as if we had the bottom of the barrel). We saw other tables get their chips piled high and in large pieces. The waiter, Saul, seemed nice at first but I then realized he gave ALL his attention to the hispanic diners, we are white. I felt discriminated against. I ordered the Sopes and they were flavorless. Saul NEVER came to the table to ask how everything was - isn't this one of the main responsibilities of a server? I saw some older mexican woman walking around with a scowl on her face (probably somebody's illegal mother) and I politely asked her if we can have more chips and bean dip....she stared at me for a minute without saying a word. I repeated my request and in very broken English she says "more??", as if that was unheard of. Chips are always complimentary and refills are always given. When we left I had to ask for a to go box. Saw the mean old lady again since Saul didn't care to check on us and I had to talk with my hand showing this woman the size of a box I needed. this place needs to give ALL their customers the same respect and attention, no matter what race the people are. Train your workers to speak English since you are in America!! Never going back. Horrible experience from start to finish! Roberto's Taco Shop is more authentic than this place!

6-K1eDuTkVtxsbMHjxCnhA.text: 1) long wait to order 2) long wait for food after ordering 3) 3 out of 4 meals were cold 4) salsa and bean dip were pretty good.   We ate- Carnitas- (pile of meat. Not much else) Sopes- looked ok. But was cold Chile Rellano de camarone- cold chile rellanos aren't very good Chicken burrito- cold. Not much flavor.   Yes, we could have sent cold food back. But after the wait, we were pretty much ready to eat and leave.

F53mTJlYdje19EE9sj-nKQ.text: I first became a fan of sister restaurant Lindo Michoacan on Desert Inn but Bonito is much closer to my home.    We are "regulars" there so it's nice to walk in and have the waiter or waitress know your order.    Try the table side guacamole.  It's the best guacamole I've EVER had. And if you can, try to sit in Violeta's section.  She makes it even better than the other waiters. However, Juan and Jose (I think that's his name) are good waiters too.    The veggies in the fajitas are so fresh and delicious but you can't really go wrong with anything you order here.

PyHbOUqZk7RU-CCse6x3-A.text: This place is super awesome! The service was great! Very attentive! The food was absolutely on point. Order the shrimp fajitas and they were delicious! Drinks were amazing and at a reasonable price! Homemade tortillas were delicious! Ugh loved it here! Would highly recommend this restaurant to my friends!

Y1jreoNGy7SZIvFyH6Vcsw.text: Great food this place did not upset especially since I'm visiting from California. I had enchiladas they were great the service was excellent food came soon after ordering they give you sopa and chips with beans and salsa while you are waiting I highly recommend this place

uEwWzaf1Uu-5_SzFFpJcmQ.text: I have to remember, just because its near my house doesn't mean it's gonna be better!  Viva Michoacan and Lindo Michoacan  have such better food an atmosphere, I've learned my lesson to take the extra time and gas and get some good food.  Our waiter was friendly, and full of energy, he made the experience better.  The free tortilla chips were dark and over fried, also tasteless. The bean dip and salsa were okay, just seemed not as hot (spicy). The fideo soup was watery with about 20 noodles in it, I mean, it is so cheap to make fideo and this is what I get? I got a Soft Beef Taco and a Crunchy Chicken Taco, there was so much lettuce and shreded cheddar cheese on top I had to dig my way to my tacos. Both were edible and had a good amount of meat but didn't have much taste even after I drenched them in salsa. The crunchy taco was a little greasy. I actually thought they'd be more like street tacos since that's what I'm served at the sister restaurants. My husband got the Carne Asada Burrito, but he had them add cheese and mole sauce which they gladly did, it was okay, but was still missing something...especially some heat (spice).  I won't be going back, especially since there are so many better mexican restaurants.

ftBcMQen8_K_EaVlNEGlmg.text: One of our favorite Mexican places in town. The handmade guac at the table is delicious, entree portion size leaves you full and the Margarita's are tasty. Good service and very good family crowd. Lots of creepy clown type figurines prevents the 5 star review...

fl0xIdYvyDF-EG3BL4hgRQ.text: Quesadillas and ceviche here are yummy!  Our server was really friendly and seemed to love working here.

-cvaICC0zgxJIoZA2R8qvg.text: I love the authenticity of the decor and cuisine. I celebrated my birthday there. It was a blast. The salsa and chips were savory and spicy and had you wanting more. The portion sizes was pretty plentiful I left with a to go bag. The waiter we had reminded us of a family member serving Sunday dinner he was laughing and joking and also very friendly. I had the "combancion mary y tierra" (Grilled steak and shrimp) which was DELICIOUS.... It was an enjoyable experience. I truly recommend for authentic Mexican and a good time....Try this place...

Z94FN0XqXPd176AY2Ehfzg.text: Thank you for the delish food and for accomadating our big party. We celebrated our daughters 21st bday and it was a blast with  great food and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Celebrating Briana 21st bday
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d_8xXY5zOTImgf6zSlc91A.text: The nicest service of all time. The best food in all of Vegas!! This is the best place. Forget the strip this is where you want to be!!!

OVwsOQ33QUFHeQBV3UoVOg.text: Just ate there on Saturday 9 /15/18. The service was terrible . The food was nasty. I would never eat or recommend this place to anyone when visiting Vegas. Not what I expected.

1SSKV_m9fB4HE4Y7TwPWdw.text: I'm at the bar having huevos machaca for Easter lunch & it's delicioso! Their margaritas are delicioso too!

l5YxdDjfG4R6C6b5fhX21A.text: I went to Vegas on a family trip, we stumbled upon this restaurant since we wanted authentic Mexican food and it really did not disappoint. We were greeted right away by the host and seated maybe about 5min after. They accommodated our group of 8 right away. The decor is so cute and fun. Our waiter was very helpful and friendly. They bring you a fresh fideo soup for the whole table and it is warm and delicious. The Micheladas are so good and big! They have all these different types of drinks with fun names! The food is very delicious and flavorful, I ordered the carne asada, so juicy and full of flavor. I asked for the Carne Asada medium done and it was exactly how I wanted it. Everyone at the table was very satisfied and happy we came across this restaurant the service was great, food was definitely authentic, I will be coming back whenever I'm in town.   Also they take these cute pictures of your whole table that you can purchase afterwards!

B6eyrQ_HNTjzyf3-sMhb6Q.text: Walked and was seated right away. Great atmosphere and very friendly staff. Was suprised to be in a place with refillable horchata. The complimentary chips, beans and salsa was on point. The horchata was made perfect. Will update once we get the main entrees.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade tortillas!

xyENqOYj6pyn_ihUABmqgQ.text: Sad I have to give this place such a terrible rating because service and employees were impeccable; so friendly and accommodating. But the food was absolutely terrible. Paid about $13-$15 for a plate of 2 chicken enchiladas and rice. Others in my group hated what they ordered as well, my cousin ordered the enchiladas Michoacan and he said the steak meat inside tasted like rubber... all of our meat was tough, the enchilada sauce was more like a dried on paste, yuck. And again, I keep reiterating it because for some reason everything was just so dry! The Fideo soup was very good. I will give them credit where it's due, and the soup was truly good. In all honesty, You know it's bad when the chips and salsa were your favorite part of the meal. Will never return here :-(

IgaYPNGwUXGgQJgGJqEJpg.text: Omg where should I begin ? This by far one of the best Mexican restaurants I been too ! Unfortunately It isn't located in Cali!! The service is amazing and out server JULIO !!! Amazing!!! Best customer service ever !!! We absolutely enjoyed the experience!! Don't miss out on this gem!!

fUjgYgCPmES38-NYQ84yGg.text: This place was great. Wouldn't have stopped in if my brother didn't recommend it. Get service and food. Not sure I like the picture taker thou.

DzESqJ4hH8E1t1wiV5L7lw.text: Excellent service the only thing I do not like the menu says homemade chicken tenders, however, there are Dino frozen chicken nuggets they need to correct that the in the menu does not match the quality of food they're serving.

ua6-TknsTMxagw0J46iL6w.text: Great customer service and amazing food. I come here every week for happy hour. Best prices in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

udwI4-s71oiabStdVlKKBQ.text: The best Mexican food I tasted since I'm from East Los Angeles California. Homemade flour and corn tortillas. The chili verde was super bomb and fresh with no fat , the staff was very welcoming and amazing hospitality. This place is a must when in Vegas!

8zjjKpuxOUOX6XnuhuZiRw.text: I thought the restaurant was really good. I had the chicken tacos, which came with (3), rice, beans, and guacamole. There was also a starter of a light tomato soup with noodles, which was also REALLY good. What made it even better was our server, Jonathan, who was very knowledgeable about the menu and was able to steer us in the right direction.   I also appreciated the free check in margarita that the restaurant offered, which made us come to the restaurant in the first place. I live close by so this will definitely be on my list of places for my fiance and I to go and eat during the week/weekend.

FFO_bu0xKEAk_C3U3XWmXQ.text: This is a very nice place to eat authentic Mexican food in vegas the is nice the flavor off the dishes here are perfect and the drinks are terrific!!! Thanks you guys for a very good experience

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nSIh8IJlpVSnBdlGlS23zA.text: Drove by this place a couple times and finally stopped in.  I had a grilled chicken dish with Monterey Jack cheese and it was delicious.   The table side guacamole wasn't bad either.  Very friendly staff.

6kl0YyitqE6I8jGCgr-ucQ.text: Found this place recently...not sure how I ever missed it.  Went back four times in two weeks.  That should tell you what I thought of it.  The atmosphere, service, and of course the food are are great.  Amazing selection of tequilas, and staff that actually knows about them!  Can highly recommend the carne asada tacos, and the cerviches.  Try not to fill up on chips and bean dip so you can enjoy the mains...

ODVFTSo769mKOF1ef9eAiw.text: The service here is amazing. The food and the drinks are even better. Best happy hour in town! Great prices and atmosphere. Alejandra the bartender makes beautiful and very yummy drinks. I will definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas. Thanks again

x8LLVDkiiTgSTeUsWEOz6w.text: This was the best Mexican food I have ever eaten! Unfortunately it is all the way in Nevada and we live in Georgia it we would be there every weekend! Staff was awesome! Homemade guacamole at the table! Can't get Better then that! While renting our car for our trip the customer service rep suggested we try this place! I'm so thankful she did .

VZYpdkVyK356q3I1nvfOPQ.text: Food is good generous portions.  The acoustics in the restaurant are punishing, bordering on painful. Impossible to hear your waiter or dining companions.  Same review as before, food is good ambience is still terrible, and the booth seats are old and punishing with no support.  My GF was sitting directly on a 2x4 throughout dinner.

eaNhk0aZa4gsbUwc8RjrfA.text: I love this place is so good. Every time I come here the food is delicious and the service is awesome. Make sure you check in you get a free margarita:)

a8mKl4C-u8GmPq2-t4AAyQ.text: We decided to hit up their happy hour last week and was disappointed all around. We ordered 4 different food items from the HH menu and no joke everything came out within less than 2 minutes. Obviously they must just have everything laying around premade/microwaved to order. It really wouldnt have been that big of a deal had the food at least been good but everything was terrible and lukewarm. We go out to eat all the time and my gf used to own a burrito shop in cali and we both left saying how we havent had food that bad in a longggg time. Go to Robertos or Don tortaco or really anywhere else if you're looking for at least decent (not even great) mexican food lol.

4gQPRuRHYRs-5LIoSyDG4g.text: We have been here a few times and the food and service is always impeccable. We are creatures of habit and get the table side prepared guacamole and the steak Fajitas for 2. I was a bit disappointed to find out that they have a loyalty type card and we had never been told about it. We only discovered it because we went to the bar for drinks and there was a small sticker that mentioned it. The points/punches are done via an app so even proving our previous visits, they can't add any. I have the app now and I will return but I think they should tell people about the loyalty program.

EfH9Q5upTVedf5pQRbHfcQ.text: Always an enjoyable experience. This place gets pretty lively in the evening and it gives a vibrant feel. The food was delicious and service was in point (Jonathan). I had the carne asada plate cook to your liking. I'll be coming again!

9Bea8xAt_tO2Sm3_0h_8Yw.text: Steak Al Cognac was to die for!!!!! It wasn't even what I ordered but my Friend so graciously allowed me to taste it and it's definitely what I'll be getting next time! The red salsa was very hot, (I'm a but of a sissy when it comes to spice) but the green was much more mild and very flavorful! You do you have to to ask for it. You get bean dip and fideo soup with your meal it was very good! The service was great also. I'd also highly recommend the shrimp ceviche! So fresh and flavorful! I had the Camarones Dionisia..... basically Shrimp in a Chile Verde sauce with cheese melted in the oven with Rice and beans. Also really good! If your looking for real authentic Mexican food in Vegas this should definitely be on your list!

y6Xpg2FQgPFtjca___L_Sg.text: I LOVE this place. The decor, the customer service and the food! I'm here in Vegas on vacation but I ate at this place every single day since I got here. They servers were on top of things. The second we finished our drinks they were already back with a refill. Literally. I tried the oysters, menudo, tortilla soup, and the chilequiles. I have no complaints about any of it! They were all delicious! I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VkLrUm-xro9W76WmIfCs0w.text: Went today to eat there usually very good! service was terrible was there about 4 PM very rushed told the guy not to give me the bill quite yet but he insisted he brought it and then went back and said he forgot to charge for one beer I said OK, but not too close it out yet as I might want another beer and dessert well he still brought the bill anyway for the 2nd time! I guess he was trying to tell me it was time to leave so because of that I have to give them a bad review on their service and feeling rushed I didn't get my dessert or another beer. I only left a 10% tip which I am usually a 25% or better tipper. He LOST OUT! I guess I should've known when I wanted to sit at the bar and was told to sit somewhere else that was my first clue that today was not going to be there day and they would not be on point on anything. Just wanted a quiet place to eat a meal and have a beer and enjoy it and relax on a Friday afternoon before it got too late. Not like I was sitting there or not ordering anything or spending any money but they just did not want anymore $$ I guess. Then while I had to go check myself out the girls in the front around the register gossiping about someone else that works there and that you can't tell them anything as they blow everything out of proportion don't want to hear the drama of a restaurant that I go to again just looking for a nice place to eat a nice dinner early and have a few beers and relax on a Friday afternoon now I know this is not the place to go.

dMtPue0nGFfAneA9eVTeLg.text: Yum! Hard to find decent mexican food in Hawaii so I always look for good ones when I'm in Cali and Nevada. It seemed most of the entrees came with the delicious tomato fideo soup, beans, rice, and tortillas. They even have a glass booth where you can see the cute guy making the tortillas.   The margaritas were the best I've ever had. I had the cucumber one, my friend had the jalepeno one. They both came with a chili lime salt rim which was soo good. I'd be happy with just the comp chips which also come with salsa and refried beans.  I can't remember the name but I had the pork dish that's marinated over night in orange juice. It was pretty good. My friend had the Carne asada and the steak was so tender. My other friend had the deep fried snapper which was ok but nothing special.

9NKcs0AodfBkwP2XfNtIMQ.text: One of my bosses from the East Coast loves this restaurant and we'll hit it up every time he's in town.  All of my experiences here have been during lunch time so I really can't tell you much about dinner. I'm sure it's the same, busier, and minus their lunch specials.  You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  My favorites include their carne asada plate and steak fajitas.  Their plates are huge and they hook up more than just the rice & beans.  Sometimes I'll dine here in the middle of dieting and have always found something "clean" enough to eat.  They'll even substitute some of the rice & beans for more steak.  Besides Vegetarians and Vegans, who doesn't want more steak?  It's not surprising that a lot of Yelpers rave about the service here.  The hostess and servers are all over customer service.  They treat you good here and most importantly, they'll keep your bowl of chips full.

32kUahJwjITnlZFFFrFsIQ.text: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! We had our wedding dinner with over 30 people in our party and the food, service, pricing and fun were flawless. They dedicated plenty of servers to our party and over-served us to the max. All of the employees had a great attitude and were a huge part of making our wedding day perfect!!! The food was fantastic and the drinks were mixed to perfection. I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone, whether a group or solo. We are definitely returning to this place whenever we visit Las Vegas!!! THANK YOU BONITO MICHOACAN!!!!

00DCvmj_PVHbKgefi2r7dQ.text: OMG the best Mexican food I've tasted in a looooong time. The margaritas were BOMB. The service is excellent as well.  I must!!

e8Tq1j57IDoG05dyMcxJ8Q.text: Great food and service but alot if noise to much for me to relax for a good meal if you dont mind noise great place

DJAr537jh4FAbIMEToV5qw.text: Nice Mexican foods here and also look really popular for local ppl and latin ppl. I think foods it's really nice and special is Margarita drink is nice.  But a little loud for us.

vL2FWDtRUJAYC-FdtuSABg.text: Violeta is the best server ever ! This restaurant was good but the service was better

LNE4fq1fmLdin8c_9r83Gg.text: Whenever we crave Mexican we come here no matter where we are living. They have Delicious Food here. I always get so full. Tonight I will bring food home
