_P2JW8XXUkcqq2kyVAoNLg.text: Well they wouldn't honor the coupon on Yelp for a free margarita that we ordered with an entree. Food is great but they should have restrictions apply or something to say u can't just order a margarita and expect if free with an entree because it doesn't work that way. You have to show them the coupon and they will bring u a small house margarita.

QmRNiCE7y6QEqA5zxqL69g.text: I haven't been here in a couple years and I now remember why. Ive been working in the restaurant business since 2016, and I know this is probably going to be stupid to some of you but when someone orders a beverage either you bring the straw to the table so they can put it in themselves or if the waiter/waitress wants to put the straw in for the customer then leave half the paper on... I don't know if you touched my straw with your dirty hands so that already grossed me out.   I'm not personally a big fan of Mexican food but I had family that wanted to go there so I love the Carne Asada Enchiladas anywhere I go and I thought I would try it here. It was gross... the carne asada had a weird taste to it, there red sauce tastes like generic spaghetti sauce, it looked burnt, there's usually a lot of cheese! My Aunt got the cheese enchilada and there was NO cheese at all inside the tortilla it was just all tortilla she always got the red sauce. When we told our waiter "Isreal" he kept nagging and nagging for us to get something else so I finally agreed and got the taquitos.   They're always so busy here and I don't get how... I've had a lot better Mexican food than this.

1gHU_g7B23xo40fe5Vy_kA.text: Really good restaurant in Las Vegas, we are from Asheville N.C. and it was easy to find.

1OD6D0vLW5NyiA1Uh5_2Uw.text: I love this place. I come here all the time, they have great alcohol , great service, great food!! The environment is impeccable. 10/10 would recommend

y_OY0e6Kx7hBRUeyHQiE3w.text: The atmosphere here is beautiful. The building itself looks straight out of Mexico. The paintings on the wall are astounding and even the tables and chairs go with the overall theme of the restaurant.   I've ordered to go from here several times, I always end up getting Timo's Grandeto Burrito on the A La Carte menu (11.99) and it's HUGE! It could feed me for breakfast, lunch, and dinner!  On top of that, their green habenero sauce is amazing. I did stop in once to dine in on a Sunday night, they had live music (which was wonderful, might I add) and the server was amazing! When we first walked in however, the hostess did not even acknowledge us but she was with another customer so I let that slide and hope that next time that doesn't happen.   Overall, this place is amazing. If you're craving some great Mexican food with a beautiful atmosphere this is the place!!

5udvrrj0AADQpK4h5_hkzg.text: We LOVE this place.  The food is always good, and the service is excellent!  We always roll up with at least 10 peeps and they have always been able to accommodate us.    They give you this yummy bean dip with the chips and salsa and fideo soup when you order an entree.  Both are so good.  Our favorite go to Mexican restaurant while in Vegas!

Lld5U9XZmTBFhc6r6qRVTA.text: This has to be one of the worst experiences I had ever had in my life. They never brought our food to the table. They didn't bother to check on us for drinks, to see if we needed a refill. They had us waiting for more than an hour. We asked for drinks and they kept bringing the wrong ones as well. We asked politely if they could change the tv channel. And that didn't even happen. They don't accommodate the guest/customers. And the waiter was pretty rude, as we told him that we just wanted to get the check and leave. Pay for our drinks , as we know everything cost money lol.

UPL19a32u4cn3PxN0ica-w.text: Great food and service. We ordered the mole and it was delicious, service was excellent. We're definitely coming back

7R3p3osf2u6U7lgUfuBHWg.text: Had a wonderful mother's day dinner. Our waiter was amazing. Food was delicious as always. My only complaint was that the cheese in my enchilada was not melted at all. I would have sent it back but they were slammed and I didn't want to make the kitchen more stressed.

ryAVb0T1URYz_F-Grou7iQ.text: Our server Lorenzo was great. The food was overpriced end it was not good and small portions. We got chicken fajitas which were dry and this wilted. The chili relleno  had very little flavor. The beans were just ok. There were flies everywhere all around the windows and behind our heads where were sitting. It was gross.

mf4HDk0JnZXOvBtatmgQ6Q.text: Wonderful experience ! I love the decorations the interior design, definitely feels like you're in a little Pueblo in Mexico.  The food was delicious and the service was perfect. Very nice and attentive.  We celebrated a birthday and made a nice little surprise with singers and guitars, the staff clapping around the birthday Family !  They bring a sombrero and a shot of tequila (if you're over 21, of course).  They pair it with mini churros and whip creme with a candle on top.  We had a blast and can't wait to go back to Vegas to visit this place again.

Fn7tfMHaHmZtrdq8Tr-G1Q.text: Good service, mediocre food.  The bartender was very friendly, and I got my drink/chips and salsa/dinner in a timely manner.  The chips and homemade salsa/bean dip were good, about on par with what I would expect at a Mexican restaurant.  I ordered the pork green chili burrito/chili relleno combination. The burrito was pretty good, the chili relleno was overwhelmingly average. The sauce seemed really tomato-heavy, and the breading was a little soggy.  Overall, not bad, but I'm not in a hurry to go there again.

Qb286wjw5gnlRB1iI4vbJg.text: This was great! We really had a fun time! Today is my daughters bday and the staff went all out with singing and dancing with instruments and a sombrero for a prop and sang happy birthday in Spanish AND English to her with a shot of tequila at the end. I was laughing and crying at the same time at then end how much fun it was. The food and service was excellent! I give them 25 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x-dlm-ZbcE0h3pb9ku8RKQ.text: 2 stars. Experience is everything. This would have been a 5 star review because i really do love Benito Michoacan. I go there occasionally as a treat for my family. The food is pretty good or i wouldn't go back. The 3 star deduction is because of the service. Javier was our waiter, but he started taking the appetizers off the table before we were done. I told him we were not done with it and he put the plates back on the table like he was annoyed. I dropped $79.00 on lunch today and he never even said thank you or nothing. I get it, they're busy. But if you're busting your ass for tips, you should make your guests feel welcomed and not like they're inconveniencing you. I will probably go back, but i will not be sitting in Javier's section.

JLBMUB1lD2H5rQ6kTVhFKA.text: This review is about the staff not the food. The food has always been great at this place, the staff however is getting worse as time goes by.  I know this is a very popular spot in town. For this reason we have tried to make reservations before going to the restaurant. Several times we have been told that they do not take reservations when calling ahead just to find out that they did take reservation and by the time we get there, there is a huge waiting list ( over an hour wait time).  When asking the staff how come they didn't took my reservation when calling earlier all they had to say was that at the time they were already full on reservations. Being  booked up is very different from not taking reservations at all.   Even when waiting (yes the food is worth the wait) the staff does not communicate at all how close you are to be seated, they never seem to know what's going on and give you attitude if you hold them accountable for their previous statements.   Like mentioned before the food is great but the staff could use some major improvement.

8eFrNR7H5bdOubBVIgfL3w.text: Great food , Awesome service highly recommend. Great restaurant to screto escape from the strip

x4coTdPdnIVv_PBV9ws9wA.text: Good Menudo and excellent menu choices. The queso fundido and homemade tortillas were amazing.

YIJAtgjMubwI0myvC527Sg.text: We went to Bonito Michoacan for my little sisters birthday and it did not disappoint! So delicious and fun... really good for any occasion, even if it's a date or something intimate. They have a heavy hand with the tequila, but I was not upset by that. One large strawberry margarita was more than enough for me, left feeling amazing! The food was great but I really loved the soup that came before the entrees, I believe it's called sopa de Fido. I can't remember off the top of my head. It's tomato based with small little noodles, aka DELICIOUS. Definitely coming back to drink with my friends!

WaRcajiWyYdopL2hPyuWeg.text: Great service! Food was TERRIBLE! I'm amazed it has so stars . And of course it's the only I stop by this place!

zRYaFeDt9vBFiV9_IyrSfA.text: Great experience.  First time here.. The service was great, we didn't had to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated in a Sunday afternoon. Our order was taken within few minutes and food was prompt and delicious.  We tried the fajitas shrimp, the parrillada mixta, sopes (steak) and the Tuna Margarita. Everyone in our table was pleased with the service, food and music.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CNR99lykmIjGmLv8NNVTiQ.text: I have never been to this location and I'm glad I came. The food here is so good.   There are several Lindo Michoacan Resturant and I believe this one is the original location...but I can be wrong. Located on Decatur in between Twain and Flamingo in a big corner lot by itself. Cool out door patio and cozy interior with low ceilings and different aesthetically compared to it's other big location in Summerlin and Henderson but the food definitely makes up for it in big ways.  I came with a party literally of 14 for a late company Christmas dinner in January and Violeta handle us with complete ease. She was not only helpful but she was so pleasant, swift and personably. I really enjoyed her, her smile and friendly service made it for a great experience. She went around the table with individual attention with and balance us and getting her job done Kirk a pro. The whole staff was amazing especially when we had the entire crew singing happy birthday to one of our guys. It was so fun complete with a mariachi band, a ginormous sombrero and a tequila shot poured into your mouth and your head shaken by the person who does so. It takes me back to my trip to Cancun; so much fun.   We had happy hour bucket of Coronas (they were baby ones) and some of us ordered margaritas which there was some very interesting flavors that I really wanted to try but I stuck to my tequila on the rocks and again Violeta did not disappoint when asked for her recommendation. I'm not sure how everyone's food was but the whole table had nothing but good things to say about what they got to eat. I got to try my neighbors carnitas and it was BOMB. So tender and full of flavor and not dried and tough like pork at other places can be. I gave him a taste of my Cilantro steak which I ordered Moo mooing as Violeta would say and he liked it a lot as well. The steak was rare and the green cilantro sauce on top was really good. The guacamole table side was so good but I missed the show because I showed up late.   All in all a wonderful experience and when the food is good out of the ball park is what they hit!

If the kids don't like Mexican there's more options like cheese burgers and chicken. The service was average.  Very average.  The patio may be wonderful once it warms up a bit.

F-Fy0x3ejpOKOaQ9az7WDg.text: If you like Mexican food even a little bit, go here! The food is excellent, the service is outstanding, and I can't say enough good things. Especially good: there's a dish with bacon-wrapped shrimp stuffed with peppers and smothered in cheese, and the mole is exceptional. I get something different every time and love everything. While I'm not fond of the complimentary salsa, the bean dip is tasty. This is a favorite for sure.

J6ADaehLgq2sgs7NBCzWmg.text: Fun! The experience is fun, yummy margaritas. The food isn't anything that I haven't had before. I ordered one of he combinations, it was tasty but nothing crazy different from other Mexican restaurants I've been to. I'll be back though, it was a lot of fun and looks like a cool place for birthdays.

ddCzNHmsi3J6n8CRCkmYlw.text: Fun place to celebrate a birthday because they sing to you and give you a sombrero to wear and maracas to shake. The mariachi guys take requests of regular songs too.   They serve complimentary warm bean dip and spicy salsa with fresh tortilla chips.   Fast service even when it is crowded. Authentic decor but the booth table was too high even for my tall husband.   The fried shredded beef tacos are awesome! Good enchiladas, rice and beans.

Y1zHKieY6XMhNFkkbTimRA.text: Food is DELICIOUS and the staff ultra friendly and accommodating. Love this place!

l2XNZjiNlcldgaDr_hlP5g.text: Saw this as the best Mexican restaurant in Nevada, and now is by far my favorite in Las Vegas. Managed to get there for Happy Hour and my girlfriend had the large Cadillac Margarita, and even I liked it, and did not take much to get my girl friend drunk. Also had the  Steak al Cognac (New York steak cooked to taste, sauteed in cognac, mixed with mushrooms, onions, secret spices, a little sour cream and a touch of cognac) 19.99. It was a really great deal, and the sauce was superb. Would definitely recommend this place for their steaks. Forget the steak houses which will charge you a lot more for a steak which is not as good. If you have kids they should love the ambience, and great for adults also. The Sopaipillas were only $3.49 and the Churros were only $3.24 and they were both great.

h8yu62KpM38OfevT6eMfyw.text: Love this place! Love the beans/salsa/chips they start you off with :) love their chilaquiles and their enchiladas Michoacan. Yum! Such a nice atmosphere, love their soft Spanish rock music playing in the background.

siZD4WoD8I8nzHvJFUUqeg.text: I have eaten Mexican food all over the country and this is some of the best I have had. Great service, great food. I highly recommend coming here. Just a short 6 dollar uber ride from the strip.

PBB6QwYBspnH8Ue7Oui31w.text: Came here hoping for some authentic Mexican food, but was disappointed. The two stars are for the very good service , unfortunately it didn't make up for the food. It was not at all good in fact it was bland and the salsa was tasted really odd like it was old or something . The bean dip was cold, and the prices are way too high. Save your hard earned money and keep looking .

P1fBCC6LfqylmQc6AkvP0Q.text: Absolutely DELICIOUS... the sopita de fideo they give is DELICIOUS the camarones a la diabla are DELICIOUS.  Definitely recommend this place

lZsaWkHgPx8uJK6vKzG5Ww.text: Came here today and ordered the lunch special  tacos. The tacos were super dry, barely any lettuce or anything else just a plain taco with chicken. Service was great but not too happy about the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bonito Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J8flSLsQXNQJ-Ro0T33tMQ.text: Came here yesterday with my husband. Ordered a molcajete mixta, it was amazing! Staff was very welcoming and friendly. Will definitely come back when I'm In town again.

ts1qdi5RUJmcfrwzRPz-Ig.text: Their food was amazing! My first time going and I will definitely be going back! From their chips and salsa to their carne asade tacos this food is not heavy and is fulfilling. So glad this place is close to my job!

lOhipO3TnrkgEn3V1O9PrA.text: Bonito Michoacan is one of the more authentic Mexican restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas. Even the funky decor is pretty damn authentic!   The complementary chips, salsa and bean dip are excellent, we always end up getting more because of how quickly they disappear. Rarely do we have to ask for more chips, salsa or anything for that matter since service is always very attentive...   I tend to stick to 'standard' dishes when I eat here... they have great tacos, excellent fideo soup, wonderful enchiladas and the strawberry margaritas are made with real fruit, yum! They make their guacamole table-side here, you can request it as mild or as spicy as you prefer.  Prices are reasonable for the large portions you get...   This isn't your on the strip, "fine dining", spending $50 a plate, fancy dancy type restaurant but it's still well worth a stop even for a special occasion like a birthday... The employees come out singing, with musical instruments and a big sombrero for the special person to wear. I think you get a complimentary dessert as well... It's embarrassing if it's your birthday, hilarious if you are with the birthday boy/girl and entertaining if you just happen to be there when it happens.

Vm1KEUt3-ZZ5Rkk3VWYaSA.text: Randomly driving off the strip and happen to spot this place. The bean dip tasted just like typical frijoles so i wasn't that impressed, but it was good. I had 3 tacos de chorizo and they were super delicious! The chorizo was piled high on these which was a nice surprise. My plate came with more beans and some rice both good. The sopa de fideo wasn't bad either but I love my mom's better :) the service was awesome. Our waiter was super courteous and came frequently to refill our drinks. The place is very nicely decorated with authentic Mexican decor and the Spanish music (Vicente Fernandez) playing in the background just added more charm and authenticity to this good Mexican restaurant. I'd definitely eat here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

wgV8EJgdn9QCQo4NBtSxvg.text: Excellent food and service. Reasonably priced. Not touristy - local favorite and off the strip. One of my favorites in Vegas.

2gnpQJtJVS-9uflw36bv1A.text: Great service and friendly staff; food is good and prices not bad $$. I will defenilly comeback again.

PR_P_XvkixngImdHKvckvg.text: Best Mexican food! Authentic, and great customer service. I've made it a tradition to stop by before leaving Vegas!

pQzyC0Ua93Qvom_scbuCmA.text: Amazing food! We came on the recommendation of a bell boy and the food was amazing. The cilantro steak is delicious as well as the carnitas dish

JARq3R9Tihb9ESa5a_XgHw.text: The best in Vegas by far. This is where the locals go for Mexican. Many different dishes not just tacos, burritos etc. Many seafood dishes.  Service was exceptional. They make the to taste right at the table.  Drinks are also good. As an added attraction there is a lady making tortillas right in the front. Not the easiest place to find but worth the search.

7Gc6q0e8YQcKT3t-wW2HUg.text: I think you'll notice in many of the reviews you see comments on how exceptional the service is at this location and I completely agree! Our server, Richard, was totally awesome and boosted this from a 4 star to a 5 star review. He was super friendly, helpful, attentive and made some bad-ass guacamole! The food was delicious and very authentic according to my latin boyfriend. The homemade tortillas were sooo good, the steak & chicken fajitas very tasty also. We had a great time and will definitely be back for more.

W6cC4hO3K5WE74zd1s6gRg.text: This is THE place for Mexican food in Las Vegas....and there are plenty of good places here. Started coming here in 2006 or so, love everything I get and it won't break the bank.  The soup!!!! Great Drinks! Amazing food Best seafood dishes (as my partner claims, I hate seafood) Home made tortillas Chips and Salsa!!!!!  At least 50% of the customers are Mexican and come in groups. They do it right here.....It's worth getting off the strip for if your visiting, and the money you save eating away from the strip pays for your cab ride.  What are you waiting for?

J442oRkOgJzAlD3Cbegj9w.text: Lively atmosphere maybe too much.  Above average food but not exquisite thus the barely four star rating.  Perhaps bigger menu than needed.  At your face but not rude service that won't over sweeten you.  That said the service was still good.  The booths felt odd to sit on.  They were spaced too far back from table and too low.  Will go back.

pLw_Y3m7SsFnBpt9adJWjw.text: Stumbled upon this restaurant after making attempts to eat at a few others. When we pulled into the parking lot it was full of cars which is always a good sign. We were very hungry and were hoping the food was good and service was fast. Thumbs up to both!! The food was delicious and fast and the service was great. This will be part of my restaurant rotation whenever I'm in Vegas

79TVO4NdBJV9DtF6x2k-mg.text: Came here on a groupon. Had bacon wrapped shrimp. good flavors, but the shrimp was over done. Typical beans and rice. Nothing special. The food did come to the table hot. Nothing really stands out about this place.

uDfGkpXxdMY9vMgTwhSvkA.text: Best Mexican food ever!! Everything is so packed with flavor and deliciousness, even to the extent that something as simple as Chile Relleno is superb.

a0XVVKNsRSBQzEuXVRsWKQ.text: Fantastic food, great service and cute kitchy decor. My cheese enchiladas were delicious and my boyfriend can't stop raving about the fajitas.

yQzd5DsRXGqs6GxX2kQtpg.text: Love the Mexican food here, went this weekend with my in-laws and they loved it too. Some friends of ours introduced us to this place and were hooked. Mexican pizza is delicious.

oWMi0ThozYrTgvkELX6qsw.text: Not sure what experience former reviewers have with Mexican food but don't believe the positive reviews. This place was awful. Carnitas are stiff and smell like old feet, bland chicken tacos, bland enchiladas. Only positives were the shrimp which were decent at best and the homemade tortillas but what good is a tortilla if there's nothing tasty to put in it.   If you're from la or sf skip and save your Mexican for cali. If you're from Vegas go anywhere else. There's no way it can be worse than this.

uqb5nlXSWR7ghGvN6fZCLQ.text: GREAT SERVICE!!!! GREAT FOOD!!! GREAT PEOPLE!!!  It's a must stop for us when we visit to Vegas. We usually take a taxi to and from our hotel/casino...this time when our server called on a taxi, they said it would be an hour wait for pick up...the lady at the counter offered to give us a ride back to our hotel/casino.  FYI we offered $$ to kind lady for the ride and she refused to take our money....THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR THE RIDE!!!

vw5Do8vq5c0riPzrg3VZ_w.text: Food was ok, was bearly warm when I got my plate, kind of pricey. Nice live music, clean place. Friendly service.

-XPC2UKnUNxxLTum7XpYpg.text: I had a Groupon for Bonito Michoacan.  I was seated in the bar area and the bartender was my server.  She brought me chips, salsa, and bean dip quickly along with my iced tea.  She passed the empty sweetener bag test with flying colors!  First. my dinner came with fideo soup.  It was very good with less of a tomato taste than I'm used to getting.  There was more of a chicken stock flavor.  For the main course, I ordered the Enchiladas de Mole con Pollo, two cheese enchiladas heated in a red mole sauce with a chicken breast, refried beans, rice, and some lettuce shreds and a dollop of sour cream.  The mole tasted a bit sweet at first but then I got the undertones of the other spices and the richness of the mole came out.  The chicken breast was good.  It was seasoned in any manner so I gave it a good shower of Tapatio.  For dessert, I got the fried ice cream.  I guess fried ice cream is just something that comes out of the freezer.  I don't think anyone "breads" and fries the ice cream in real time anymore.  I was very pleased with my visit.  I was of two minds about where I was seated.  Two men were having a loud discussion (argument?) about politics in Spanish and the one had enough tecate to not know how loudly he was talking.  However, I could have been sitting in another part of the restaurant where there was a crying baby.  I think it was better where I was.    This was an enjoyable dinner!

hE4vxi_lul-Cftgh9sHxQw.text: Our favourite Mexican restaurant whenever we visit Vegas. The taste and quality of food is great. Many choices in the menu. Ambience and service are top notch. Having been to lots of Mexican restaurants in California, this place definitely is the best I've been out of many, because they seem to get everything just right.

xX72waJ717IawfWQobvTkw.text: Excellent food and value.  Get there early for dinner!  I've had the taco salad with beef and another time with chicken.  Put salsa on top and yum.  I've had their pork, tostada and enchilada combo.  Excellent!  Chips, salsa and bean dip appeared quickly upon being seated.  Service very good.   I only gave 4* because the checkin margarita was not 12oz as advertised!  I ordered another at regular price and both tasted good!  Minor point......

jpK974lwrgKCazcYV-3IhA.text: It was really good. The service is excellent and it has some pretty cool ornaments; nice ambiance. We had the carne asada plate which was delicious. My gf had the menudowhich was not bad, just a bit too much fat on the menudo.  The bring you chips, salsa and frijolitos mmmmm really good! It could use a bit more lighting in some areas.  They got this old guy playing music  from back in days.... de la era del caldo lol.

CpRx079hpYtFr-bx7f7sYA.text: I have been on the search for a great Mexican restaurant ever since I moved back here a few months ago & THIS IS IT! I feel like I am in Mexico every time I go. The atmosphere is great. The staff are friendly. The place is clean. The location, super easy to find. Good parking spots.   Firstly, the chips & salsa they serve when you first sit down are delicious. They also serve BEAN DIP! We always get the guacamole as well & it is made table side! Be careful not to eat too much & stuff yourself before you even order, like I always do.   The menu is so big, it always takes me a while to decide. They have a combination menu for people like me who can't decide on what to get. Last time I got the beef taco & cheese enchilada combination, which is served with rice and beans.   They also have a great desert menu! I forgot what the name was, but we ordered the Fried ice cream with bananas around it. It was delicious! Also, their margaritas are exceptionally good.   Definitely going here any time I want good Mexican food in Las Vegas.

BoZX0D2uXKfk7lZVFdEbFQ.text: Today we decided to have Mexican food for lunch.  We have been here before, but I have never reviewed this restaurant.  We started out with the chips and salsa along with bean dip.  I could actually make a meal out of these alone, but I paced myself.  Unlike my last review I was able to get my favorite Raspberry Iced Tea, and it was delicious.  Mom had a Chicken Chimichanga, our daughter had a Steak Burrito, and I ordered a Chopped Beef Burrito.  All of them came with the usual rice and beans.  We ordered a side of Guacamole and to our surprise, our server Lorenzo brought out all of the ingredients including the fresh avocados and began to prepare it right there at our table.  He seasoned it just to our liking and wow, delicious.  Mom and I spooned the fresh guacamole on our burritos, mmm, a nice added spice to an already delicious burrito.  Lorenzo was a great server, very attentive to our needs, and of course, our drinks never went dry.  Overall, Bonito Michoacan is an excellent restaurant and we will certainly be back.

gIHQvzdogYJf3vXcnhvN7w.text: Years ago this place was the greatest. Unfortunately, I can't say the same anymore. I use to love the vibe here and live music, but the service went downhill along with their food. We were seated right next to the music so I couldn't even hear the person next to me. The flavor of the food was was off, chicken was chewy, orders were wrong, and the kids meal was not eatable. The only plus to my dinner was the margarita I ordered. Maybe the restaurant was having an off day... but it made me not want to go back ever.

IJA6eRp0-62ARBCIcQ19sQ.text: This place is just eh... Edible I suppose.... Seems like their food always takes so long just to come out warm. The chips and salsa are ok.  The service is never great but ok. Like most Mexican restaurants they just take your order, bring your food and your bill.... I only eat here when I'm invited to join someone, never by choice.

isiD-UgYM3IAAMsYKNP4Qw.text: I really like the food here. the restaurant itself is really cute from the outside looks like something that belongs in Mexico! I love it  they sang me happy birthday with a full mariachi it sounded like. the staff is really nice and attentive.   good place to come if your in Vegas and in the mood for some Mexican food.

N46VB-Cx3_sX7kxtW_-bpw.text: This was my first visit and I will definitely return and recommend it to friends and family. The food was delicious, the prices were great, and the service was EXCELLENT!   I had the beef enchiladas, my wife ordered the chile rellenos, and my sons had the shrimp fajitas and steak fajitas. Plus, we had 2 margaritas and deep fried ice cream for dessert. A fantastic meal.

tMEU4chVC9xGla8EoeSf7A.text: Great food and great service, parking is tight and come prepared to wait.

PIs2gCa4mKVORow_7A3IOQ.text: Love the atmosphere! The waters are so upbeat and fun and the food is really good! They also have a great view of all the pretty lights from the strip. Careful though they really like to up sell.

7dQoFw_x9S3MNTaUncvakQ.text: I typically hate going to mexican restaurants because I usually leave thinking that I could have made better mexican food at home but this place totally made me feel like I was at home eating my own homemade food. Their guacamole is delicious, the beans were so good, tacos were fried perfectly and not greasy. My husband had the chile rellenos and enchilada and loved them. My son had the fideo and quesadillas, he said his dinner was "the best" :D Our favorite was the sopa de fideo. This is the first restaurant I have been to that offered it in their menu and it tasted totally homemade and was incredibly delicious!! Also the service was awesome, probably the best we've had in a long time. Waiters were friendly, our drinks and chips/dip were never empty, and they made sure to check in with us pretty often. Highly recommend this place! Will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas!!!

dIXAy7qXOmyLGpSFZtAw_Q.text: Good food and great portions. They keep the fresh tortilla chips with beans and salsa coming. I got the pollo con rajas y crema, which was freaking awesome. Oh, and you get a free margarita if you check in.

mKogSK_rx8Eh2fE-6zU6Aw.text: We pulled thus up on Yelp and with the reviews. We decided to try it. Everything was amazing from the service to the food.

_0zTR6udIw8fZSUyRJVj9A.text: Pros: good mole sauce Attentive staff above average food They bring out complimentary bean dip  Cons: busy on weekends

8AImYGzRGgVEXwo2xXHIyw.text: This restaurant is amazing! The guacamole is a must. Great ambiance, friendly staff, and incredible food. We found this place while searching on Yelp for a family friendly restaurant. The kids loved everything. Even the free margarita we received for checking in on Yelp was delicious. This will be a must go to place every time we come to Vegas!

_j0oQ5YHmEoQrhqUgmtxyA.text: Great authentic mexican food and environment. I have never been let down by the food and you can't beat their chips with bean dip and free Margarita with each check in.

ZCIgq3geGLrgyven9qODGA.text: Had a large party. 15 people. Very accommodating. Great food. Great service. Good prices.

dWF1i4VVFlvDHmYSa4RrIw.text: Great place to eat! We come here every time we come to Vegas. If you like Real Mexican food and a free margarita stop by. You'll keep coming back for more! Guaranteed!

6vaAD-ki_lBqVAX0NkhA-Q.text: This place reminds me of a El Torito chain with mildly better food.  I started at the bar while we waited for our table. I ordered a negro modelo and she handed me a bottle.   I had to ask for a glass and I got my own lime wedge.  The appitizer selection was a bit week so I started with just a dinner salad.   I thought they might have some  mexican infused dressing but nope. Bottle sauces.   For my entre I had the cilantro steak.  The steak had a lot of silver skin and the steak was covered in sauce but lacked much flavor.   This is a typical gringofied mexican restaurant.   You guerro friends will thank you.

E1qMCb-fREVeFJw0BwiPWA.text: Fantastic place!!! Mexican people is very positive, friendly and funny! Food is delicious and atmosphere is super romantic!!!Highly recommended!)

tV3oGHMkzYGGroOTjCCZ_A.text: Very good food ,the fideo was delicious . Had a party of 8 ,would have been nice to have more chips and bean dip than the 2 small bowls. Definitely will come back when in Las Vegas again. Prices are very reasonable .

vKkE0H9Hs6iJfOnCVxlr7w.text: The service here is just excellent! Fast and efficient.. the food was a little bland but the service makes up for it.. glad we stopped by before our drive back to Cali. Totally worth it!
